story:
Short Summary

Greetings, all! My name is Ben Fuselier, Ben Fuse, Fuse Box, whichever you prefer. I am an aspiring screenwriter/comic writer from New Orleans, Louisiana. This story has been an idea that I ping ponged back and forth in my mind: a pipe dream for a film. The recent surge in independent comic book creation had inspired me. I love seeing grass roots creators forge ahead without the control of modern, incorporated comics. As such, I decided to contribute to the cause.

This book is going to be 25 pages long (50 pages if we can hit 10K!!).

 

A win win in the best sense possible.

Outlaw Nights took on a new life as a comic and, in fact, works best in this medium! 

Cyrus Lawson works as a security officer in a remote, strategically useless colony. The 31st Century has seen the countries of earth reignite colonialism in the endless ocean of the universe. Cyrus has seen his fair share of conflict and chaos as a result of the never-ending race. He seeks a quiet life, where he can exercise some "small town justice." Unfortunately, fate has other plans...

Ivory, and the pirate crew of Hazard, raid the small settlement of Terez; an art gallery in particular. They seek data that will lead them to the ultimate prize: coveted by nations and individuals alike. In the ensuing chaos, Cyrus must confront these pirates, as well as his notions of "right" and "wrong." 

GENESIS OF A RENEGADE will hopefully be the first of a 6 issue series arc. I would love to continue Outlaw Nights, with standalones and series' alike; but this depends on YOU!  This book is going to be for audiences 17+ as it contains mature violence and strong language. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is quite a steep incline. The artwork for this book is going to be top tier quality! Render Contender, an up and coming artist (who has worked on titles such as GRAVEYARD SHIFT VOLUME 2 and CHRONO MECHANICS) is producing the gorgeous line art for OUTLAW NIGHTS! Prasad "PressColors" Patanik is providing us with the most in depth color work imaginable! 

As such, in order to ensure this book is all it can be, this is going to require some substantial funding. I am setting the fixed goal to 6.5k, but we are going Indemand, as we are going to need at least 10k! I know this is a tall order, but this story is more than worth it!

  • Funding will go towards completion of the book, as well as shipping! Hopefully, we can accumulate some to begin work on Issue #2 right away!
  • You have an opportunity to receive 1 of 10 ORIGINAL, HAND DRAWN ARTWORK pages, as well as a chance to be DRAWN INTO THE BOOK!!!!!!!!

  • If we are unable to reach our goals, you will be refunded. If we reach 7k, you will receive the 25 page book! If we can get to 14K Indemand, we're gonna take it up to 50!!!! 

The Impact

The Comic Book Industry needs a renaissance: a return to form in terms of art quality and story. Excitement, fun, and compelling characters are in high demand. I am here to deliver it unto you, in an epic way:

  • OUTLAW NIGHTS will be a foray into a new world of adventure and action
  • Incorporating elements of several genres, OUTLAW NIGHTS will breathe new life into crowdfunded comics! 
  • With your help, you will be launching this along with me. You will be instrumental in entertainment meant for you, no matter who you are. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for this campaign is exposure. I am building up my youtube and bitchute presence, but being very new on the scene, my advertising is limited. As such, the fixed goal is our failsafe benchmark. 

  • I am very tenacious. My goal is set. I promise you a book, you're getting a book!
  • Once we have surpassed 7k, our exposure will increase. As such, I will be able to work within those parameters. The time in which our team will be producing the rest of the book will be ample time for our InDemand store!

Other Ways You Can Help

As I mentioned above, our biggest weakness is exposure. If you are unable to back for any reason, we would appreciate it if you could share this project out: loud and proud!

  • Tell your friends, tell your family (please note, this book is intended for audiences 17+)

Share it! Check out the social media options below the campaign!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Greetings, all! My name is Ben Fuselier, Ben Fuse, Fuse Box, whichever you prefer. I am an aspiring screenwriter/comic writer from New Orleans, Louisiana. This story has been an idea that I ping ponged back and forth in my mind: a pipe dream for a film. The recent surge in independent comic book creation had inspired me. I love seeing grass roots creators forge ahead without the control of modern, incorporated comics. As such, I decided to contribute to the cause.
This book is going to be 25 pages long (50 pages if we can hit 10K!!).
 

A win win in the best sense possible.
Outlaw Nights took on a new life as a comic and, in fact, works best in this medium! 
Cyrus Lawson works as a security officer in a remote, strategically useless colony. The 31st Century has seen the countries of earth reignite colonialism in the endless ocean of the universe. Cyrus has seen his fair share of conflict and chaos as a result of the never-ending race. He seeks a quiet life, where he can exercise some "small town justice." Unfortunately, fate has other plans...
Ivory, and the pirate crew of Hazard, raid the small settlement of Terez; an art gallery in particular. They seek data that will lead them to the ultimate prize: coveted by nations and individuals alike. In the ensuing chaos, Cyrus must confront these pirates, as well as his notions of "right" and "wrong." 


GENESIS OF A RENEGADE will hopefully be the first of a 6 issue series arc. I would love to continue Outlaw Nights, with standalones and series' alike; but this depends on YOU!  This book is going to be for audiences 17+ as it contains mature violence and strong language. 


What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is quite a steep incline. The artwork for this book is going to be top tier quality! Render Contender, an up and coming artist (who has worked on titles such as GRAVEYARD SHIFT VOLUME 2 and CHRONO MECHANICS) is producing the gorgeous line art for OUTLAW NIGHTS! Prasad "PressColors" Patanik is providing us with the most in depth color work imaginable! 

As such, in order to ensure this book is all it can be, this is going to require some substantial funding. I am setting the fixed goal to 6.5k, but we are going Indemand, as we are going to need at least 10k! I know this is a tall order, but this story is more than worth it!

Funding will go towards completion of the book, as well as shipping! Hopefully, we can accumulate some to begin work on Issue #2 right away!
You have an opportunity to receive 1 of 10 ORIGINAL, HAND DRAWN ARTWORK pages, as well as a chance to be DRAWN INTO THE BOOK!!!!!!!!


If we are unable to reach our goals, you will be refunded. If we reach 7k, you will receive the 25 page book! If we can get to 14K Indemand, we're gonna take it up to 50!!!! 

The Impact

The Comic Book Industry needs a renaissance: a return to form in terms of art quality and story. Excitement, fun, and compelling characters are in high demand. I am here to deliver it unto you, in an epic way:

OUTLAW NIGHTS will be a foray into a new world of adventure and action
Incorporating elements of several genres, OUTLAW NIGHTS will breathe new life into crowdfunded comics! 
With your help, you will be launching this along with me. You will be instrumental in entertainment meant for you, no matter who you are. 


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for this campaign is exposure. I am building up my youtube and bitchute presence, but being very new on the scene, my advertising is limited. As such, the fixed goal is our failsafe benchmark. 

I am very tenacious. My goal is set. I promise you a book, you're getting a book!
Once we have surpassed 7k, our exposure will increase. As such, I will be able to work within those parameters. The time in which our team will be producing the rest of the book will be ample time for our InDemand store!


Other Ways You Can Help
As I mentioned above, our biggest weakness is exposure. If you are unable to back for any reason, we would appreciate it if you could share this project out: loud and proud!
Tell your friends, tell your family (please note, this book is intended for audiences 17+)
Share it! Check out the social media options below the campaign!

story:
"See, now that's where you're wrong.

This universe doesn't need another protector.

It needs a new god." 

STANDARD COVER

 

What is Doctor Mars?

Verdant Comics returns with the follow up to our first successful campaign, Doctor Mars #1! Serving as the launch series for our interconnected universe, this first volume focuses on the story of doctor Adam Albert, who, at the conclusion of the first issue, not only inherited the galaxy, but also the responsibilities that come with protecting it. Wielding both the power of a god and the light to guide him, Doctor Mars must learn what it takes to protect our realm from a threat steadfast on taking it. 

For those of you just finding us for the first time, the first issue also saw Doctor Mars uncovering a long-buried threat, a race of ancient alien parasites with the unique ability to not only inherit your physical features, but your memories as well. And when the first of these parasites finally reveals his own face, Adam Albert must learn what it truly means to face one's inner demons. 

 

Who are we? 

We are Verdant Comics, an independent publisher looking to launch the second entry in our very own shared universe! With plans to grow our roster of interconnected characters, we are also beginning the early stages of launching our own original, animated series! 

 

Meet the team! 

Jacob Coppock (creator and writer) founded Verdant Comics as a platform to further his passion as a writer as well as utilize his talents to produce high quality, interconnected stories that he hopes will someday redefine industry standards. You can find him on Instagram and Twitter at @jakemakescomics.

James Garman (creator and editor) co-founded Verdant Comics after his experience in helping introduce Handsome Devil Comics’ Fantasy Killer to the masses lent its hand in understanding what independent comics are really all about. You can find him on Instagram and Twitter at @jamesmakescomics.

Emanuel “Eman!” Sotomayor (artist) is an illustrator, comic book, and storyboard artist who’s worked in the industry for companies such as Creature Entertainment, YouTube horror channel Crypt TV, Frameworks Artists Agency, and recently was brought on by Verdant Comics as a penciler and inker for Doctor Mars #1. He enjoys spending his days drawing and eating pizza. You can find him on Instagram at @e_man_arts.

Danny Faubricio Sànchez Chaves (colorist) is a Costa Rica based colorist. He has studied graphic design and began his career as assistant flatter. His career took off when he became involved with Boom Studios for the comic, Smackdown 20th Anniversary. You can find him on Instagram at @dannyfsch.

James Dufendach (letterer) wears many hats. He is the editor, letterer, and PR guy over at independent comic publisher PLB comics and is also the coordinator of the Ocean City Comic Con. His credits include lettering, editing, writing, and coloring credits on over fourteen issues with PLB Comics, lettering on American Mythology's Stargate Atlantis: Hearts & Minds, as well as many credits on a wide variety of independent projects. When not working on comics or managing the con, James can generally be found fussing with his comic collection and vintage toys while blaring 80's new wave records at full volume.

 

Take a look inside! 

With pleasantries out of the way, let's show you a closer look on what you can expect to find in the second issue with these randomly selected pages!  

We are also excited to reveal that we will again be releasing with two exclusive, limited print variants! These come in their own tiers - or, you can take home a bundle with both variants+ the standard cover in our ALL COVERS tier!

On that note, our first variant comes from interior artist Emanuel Sotomayor!

EMAN'S VARIANT

Our second variant (which is our very first textless cover) comes illustrated by pin up artist Leah Kemp! You can find more of her wonderful art on her Instagram @ellyrieve. 

LEAH'S VARIANT

The rewards!

Sure, you want to read the book. Some of you want to continue investing in Doctor Mars' story, and others of you are just discovering us for the first time! But what's a little backing without the fun?

That's why this time around, we're offering even more rewards! From shirts to badges, keychains to prints, even customs and cameos,  we have more than enough to salsify that itch you're looking for! With plenty of limited tiers (and we do mean limited), there's never been a better project than ours to collect some truly exclusive toys! 

CUSTOM BADGE PROOF (FRONT AND BACK) 

Take a peek below at all our different tiers, and this summer bring home some truly incredible rewards to compliment your book! 

Risks and challenges

This issue has already been scripted and completed by Jacob Coppock. The art itself is almost complete. Emanuel Sotomayor has proven to be quick and reliable in his attention to art and speed, and has already begun to work hard at completing the last half of the book during the course of our campaign. We expect the full book to be completed soon after the project is funded. Printing costs have already been obtained and secured with various printing companies, as well as our shipping methods. We are expected to launch without issues, however it's possible, while unlikely, that printing or shipping issues could still arise and the book could be delayed. In the case that this happens, backers will be notified and given updates on the reasons for the delay. Should we also face any issues with our primary printer, we have a number of companies ready to commit in a timely and professional manner to ensure backers receive the book and any pertaining rewards on or before schedule.

Should we also face any issues with our primary printer, we have a number of companies ready to commit in a timely and professional manner to ensure backers receive the book and any pertaining rewards on or before schedule.

story:
Click Here to read the SUPER OFFICIAL FREE Preview!

Daym Drops...a comic book!

Daym Drops: SUPER OFFICIAL is the first official comic from YouTube food titan Daym Drops. You all know Daym loves his Foodie Fam and he has partnered with Ikari Press to bring hot super powered action at the highest level. SUPER OFFICIAL is over 40 pages of full color action and includes 2 stories. SUPER OFFICIAL written by Antonio Brice (Brand, Brand: Way of the Gun, FAME) and Caanan White (Uber, Son of Shaolin, Harlem Hellfighters). 

The second story is Melee at Mofongo written by Antonio Brice with art by Dimitrius Miller and will feature fellow YouTube sensation Badlands Chugs as they take on villians Flava and Triple D.

 SUPER OFFICIAL will be a premium comic experience. Our books will look fantastic, printed on high quality paper stock, and will feature stunning colors by 15 year comic veteran Jesse Heagy. The books will be bagged and boarded and shipped in a secure mailer. Physical backers will also receive free rewards as we hit our stretch goals for this campaign. 

The Covers

Daym Drops: SUPER OFFICIAL will feature 4 covers from some of the best artists working in comics today.

Cover A by Caanan White is a stunning tribute to the king of comics Jack Kirby and his classic cover for Incredible Hulk #1

Cover B was created by New York Times best selling artist Mike S. Miller (Game of Thrones: The Hedge Knight, InJustice). Because Melee at Mofongo will feature Badlands Chugs we asked Mike to bless us with this tribute to Rob Liefeld's cover to X-FORCE #3

Cover C is done by the great Elliot 'JerkMonger' Fernandez. Elliot decided to recreate Todd McFarlane's classic cover to Incredible Hulk #340 and we think he nailed it. 

For Cover D we brought out the big guns. Acclaimed artist Manasseh Johnson has been hired by Hollywood heavyweights like Kevin Hart, Steven Spielberg, and Lena Waithe. His art has been featured in The Source magazine and on The Steve Harvey Show. We are honored to have him as a cover artist on this project.

 

 

Brand and The FAME book


 

If you checked out our free preview you saw pages from our other titles Brand and the Fame book. Both of these Ikari Press titles can be added to your order at checkout. Daym and the entire team at Ikari Press appreciate your support on what we hope will be just the beginning of epic SUPER OFFICIAL storytelling!

story:
Pre-order at www.illustrateyourlife.com
 

"Pieces Project - Pieces Book 2" 

Welcome to our Indiegogo campaign! 

For the last 15 years, we have been collaborating with artists from all over the world (from 39 countries to be precise), creating unpredictable, experimental comic stories. What started as a fun, creative exercise dedicated to close friends sharing a passion for illustration, has become an international project introducing different artistic perceptions. 

Today, we need your help to take the final step: to publish “Pieces Project - Pieces Book 2”.



Contributing Artists

Pieces 2, similarly to its first edition, has provided a unique platform for creative collaboration between artists. The story has been imagined and brought to life by not only comic creatorsbut illustrators, graphic designers, animators, painters, street artists, sculptors, printmakers. For some, this was the first-ever opportunity to express themselves through comic art. Each of the artists involved was asked to prepare only ONE "piece" (comic book panel). Each of the artists involved was asked to decide where the story should go next.      ---The full creative process has been explained below.


Countries involved

Pieces 2: Argentina, Australia, Belgium, Botswana, Canada, Chile, China, Colombia, Denmark, England, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, India, Indonesia, Israel, Italy, Latvia, Malaysia, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Romania, Russia, Scotland, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Taiwan, United States of America, Wales 


 

The Story

Pieces 2 will take you on a quest for the Golden Egg. An exciting journey filled with monsters, mega-birds, werewolves, flying cats, witches, and skeletons.


Unconventional Techniques

Some of the "pieces" are highly original in their form and style. Techniques such as 3D rendering, embroidery, sculpting, painting, and building with LEGO bricks were incorporated.


Extras 

"Pieces Project - Pieces Book 2" will include short biographies/ information about the artists, ideas for the continuation of the "pieces" they created, photos from behind the scenes, additional sketches & illustrations, and the alternative endings.


"The CROWD"

Pieces 2 will bring you a one of a kind, collaborative illustration by 46 leading comic book artists. Inspired by the "Where's Wally?" concept, the splash-page artwork will invite you to engage in the search for the Golden Egg hidden among over 1000 characters.


Endings by Established Artists

The book will include alternative endings by established artists, exhibited by prominent museums and galleries around the world. (e.g. Sun Xun, Abdul-Rahman Abdullah, Joan Ross).

  • sneak peek - the ending by Sun Xun - full artwork available in the book


Augmented Reality

Pieces 2 will leap into the future with a unique AR illustration. You will be invited to scan the artwork and explore enhanced visual experience. The ending has been cerated by Sutu - an author, illustrator, media artist and the founder of EyeJack (Augmented Reality company).


Specifications 

"Pieces Project - Pieces Book 2": A4 size / hardcover with spot UV / 100+ pages (approx. 120 pages - the final number will be known after finalising all translations, etc.).
All of the graphics included in the presentation are mock-up designs; the final product might slightly vary.


The Cover 

The front cover has been created by an award-winning illustrator and graphic designer - Patrycja Podkościelny.  

 

The following artists have contributed to "Pieces Project - Pieces Book 2":

Jakub Mazerant, Reg Mombassa, Igor Myszkiewicz, Patrycja Podkościelny, Paweł Zawiślak, Dieter Van der Ougstraete “Dieter VDO”, Agata Karelus “Gagatka”, Ben Frost, Ola Marchocka “aleksandracupcake”, Adam Strzelczyk “Bohun”, Marta Gliwińska “panimarto”, Joanna Krótka, Kuba Gornowicz, Olga Wróbel, Sylwia Paś, Ingrīda Pičukāne, Alicja Gapińska, Giorge Roman, Emilia Dziubak, Tomasz Płonka, Katarzyna Wołodkiewicz-Przyborowska, Krystian Żelazo, Alicja Kocurek, Doug Smock, Łukasz Poślad, Gosia Herba, Patryk Hardziej, Eugene Plotnikov, Andrzej Kidaj “Andy”, Marcin Golinowski “Enes”, Tomasz Jędrzejowski “Skoti”, The HOSU, Greg Holfeld, Mark Rodda, Andrzej Pągowski, Stuart Campbell “Sutu”, Kurt, Anna Helena Szymborska, Maria Apoleika, Zuzia Turek, Julian Frost, Agnieszka Grajda, Elżbieta Gądek, Megi Kopaniszyn, Marta Szudyga, Karol Banach, Adam Kmiołek, Maciej Kmiołek, Pam Pam Liu, Jotaká, Jongmee, Carl Krull, Darek Vasina, Reena Makwana, Malwina Mosiejczuk, James Gulliver Hancock, Titon Małczow, Luke Ramsey, Joaquín Pérez “Monojoaco”, Robert Sienicki “bele”, Agata Wawryniuk, Kostas Kiriakakis, Gemma Correll, Reza Dalvand, Patrick Hruby, Patrycja Garczyńska, Łukasz Samsonowicz "Zimzonowicz”, Rán Flygenring, Jakub Grochola, Guillaume Beinat “TazasProject”, Jeremy Delhuvenne, Oze Tajada, Marek Szymczak, Ric Carrasquillo, Magdalena Koźlicka, FuFu Frauenwahl, Iain Heath, Chris Carfolite, Tim Molloy, Victoria Healy “Meltycats”, T. Motley, Lee McClure, Piotr Kasiński “PIK”, Robert Trojanowski “ROBI”, Mikey Karpiel, Phillip Marsden, Joel Priddy, Magdalena Chojnowska “EMCH”, Sam Spina, Chema Peral, Bogusław Polch, Zbigniew Kasprzak “KAS”, Thomas Campi, Lesley Vamos, Michał Śledziński “Śledziu”, Tim McEwen, Zezhou Chen, Vin Ganapathy, Martin Mörck, Tomasz Marcinkiewicz, John Joven, Marty Schneider, Phil Guy “BurritoBreath”, Ovadia Benishu, Mike Watt, Jakub Czyż, Mr Mead, Katarzyna Olbromska, Julia “Zeke's Lunchbox”, Blair Sayer, Mulga, Sindy Sinn, Bruce Mutard, Madfire, Michał Polaczek “Tybex”, Tom DesLongchamp, Max Prentis, Wout Schildermans “Melvin”, Jonathon Saunders, Stuart Medley, Claudia Chinyere Akole, Ben Mitchell, Mandy Ord, Rob Feldman, Chris Gooch, Louie Joyce, Fionn McCabe, Soolagna Majumdar, Ben Hutchings, Eleri Harris, Georgina Chadderton, Samuel McEwen, Frank Candiloro, Hayden Fryer, Madeleine Karutz, Bill Hope, Sarah Firth, Owen Heitmann, Gregory Mackay, Tatiana Davidson, Jin Hien Lau, Dean Rankine, Piotr Nowacki, Marek Lachowicz, Marcin Surma “XULM”, Adam Pękalski, Katarzyna Witerscheim “Panna N.”, Tomasz Kaczkowski, Igor Wolski, Jacek Frąś, Anna Krztoń, Paweł Pyzik, Przemysław Surma “Surpiko”, Maciej Pałka, Michał Ambrzykowski, Paweł Płóciennik “Szaweł”, Janek Koza, Hubert Ronek, Tomasz Niewiadomski, Monika Laprus-Wierzejska, Jakub Babczyński, Bartosz Minkiewicz, Wiesław Skupniewicz “Ziuto”, Agnieszka Świętek, Tomasz Karelus, Stelios Papadakis, Abdul-Rahman Abdullah, Joan Ross, Mora Vieytes, Sun Xun.

 


Pieces Project

The idea for Pieces was conceived in 2006. It was to be an internal project addressed to the members of IllustrateYourself - an on-line gallery promoting young illustrators I had been running. I believed that the form of a graphic novel would create an opportunity for an exciting, creative dialogue between entirely different personalities. The project was to involve representatives of various arts, not only cartoonists. As the story grew, its local character changed. Over the years, more than 200 artists from 39 countries have contributed their artworks, co-creating two unpredictable stories.


Creative Process 

Pieces Project started with a panel ("piece") depicting a group of characters in specific surroundings. The initial situation in which the characters were introduced served only as an excuse to further the story. Every next "piece" of the tale is sent to another artist involved in the project. Taking into account the previous panel, the artist draws the next part providing his/ her style to the overall story. Every artist has the opportunity of leaving their own impact on the whole body of the work; by adding new characters, slowing down or speeding up the action, etc. As the story progresses the protagonists and other characters can evolve, and the story itself may change - from being full of humour to a sombre, melancholic tale, to becoming a horror full of disturbing imagery. The outcome is only limited by the participants’ imagination. The artist that will receive the last part will have a chance to create the conclusion and finish the story. The result of the collaboration of many artistic minds and personalities is a diverse and unpredictable graphic story - a story that we could control only at its inception, at its first piece; a story that lives its own life. 


"Pieces Project - Pieces Book 1"

The first edition of Pieces project was published in 2013. 


Guinness World Record

"Pieces Project - Pieces Book 1" set a Guinness World Record in "The most contributors to a published comic book" category and was featured in the official Guinness World Records Book of 2016.


Exhibitions 

One of the main goals of the Project is to promote the artists involved. Pieces 1 has been showcased in Europe and Australia at comic festivals and standalone shows.

 The album has been appreciated by all sorts of characters;)

Above: The contributors and happy owners of the "Pieces Project - Pieces Book 1". Among others: Grzegorz Rosiński ("Thorgal"), Andreas ("Rork"), Alan Grant ("Judge Dredd"), Tadeusz Baranowski ("Antresolka profesorka Nerwosolka"), Zbigniew Kasprzak KAS ("Yans"), Bogusław Polch ("The Witcher").

 

The funds raised through this campaign will help us do the following:

- print the book the best way possible - we want the artists involved to be proud of the final product and you to enjoy the experience!

- mail the books to the contributing artists - having nearly 200 artists from 34 countries involved is super exciting... but sending each of them a copy of the book will be an expensive task. We would love to deliver "Pieces Project - Pieces Book 2" straight to every artist's door.

- cover the costs of translations and design - international content requires international linguistic skills. The money raised will let us cover the costs of translations, editing and design.

- fulfill the rewards / orders - printing T-Shirts, posters and other amazing extras.

- pay the Indiegogo platform fees - 5% platform fee + processing fees.

Pieces 2 is nearly done. We are waiting to receive a couple of additional endings which should arrive by mid-September. The design process has been finalised. We expect to have the whole book translated and edited by the end of October. The printing will start in November. "Pieces Project - Pieces Book 2" should be ready in December 2020. 



 * Pieces 2 Digital Copy (PDF) 

* Pieces 2 - a copy of the book

 * 2 Books: Pieces 1  & Coloured Cities

* 2 Books: Pieces 1 & 2 

 * 3 Books: Pieces 1 & 2 & Coloured Cities

* Pieces 2 & "The CROWD" Poster

* Pieces 2 & IllustrateYourLife T-Shirt (only 4 available: 2 x M and 2 x XL, please choose the correct size when selecting a reward)

* Pieces 2 & Pieces logo T-Shirt

* Pieces 2 & signed Print

* Pieces 2 & "The CROWD" T-Shirt

* YOU in "The CROWD" - MEGA PACK

* Pieces 2 & painting on canvas

 

 

Risks and challenges

I have faced numerous challenges working on this project for the last 15 years and welcome the final stage - the printing of the actual book - with open arms. The only risk I can think of is the need for updating the number of contributors on the cover. Eventually, there might be more than 170!:)
story_txt:
Pre-order at www.illustrateyourlife.com "Pieces Project - Pieces Book 2" Welcome to our Indiegogo campaign! For the last 15 years, we have been collaborating with artists from all over the world (from 39 countries to be precise), creating unpredictable, experimental comic stories. What started as a fun, creative exercise dedicated to close friends sharing a passion for illustration, has become an international project introducing different artistic perceptions. Today, we need your help to take the final step: to publish “Pieces Project - Pieces Book 2”.
Contributing ArtistsPieces 2, similarly to its first edition, has provided a unique platform for creative collaboration between artists. The story has been imagined and brought to life by not only comic creatorsbut illustrators, graphic designers, animators, painters, street artists, sculptors, printmakers. For some, this was the first-ever opportunity to express themselves through comic art. Each of the artists involved was asked to prepare only ONE "piece" (comic book panel). Each of the artists involved was asked to decide where the story should go next.      ---The full creative process has been explained below.
Countries involvedPieces 2: Argentina, Australia, Belgium, Botswana, Canada, Chile, China, Colombia, Denmark, England, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, India, Indonesia, Israel, Italy, Latvia, Malaysia, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Romania, Russia, Scotland, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Taiwan, United States of America, Wales  The StoryPieces 2 will take you on a quest for the Golden Egg. An exciting journey filled with monsters, mega-birds, werewolves, flying cats, witches, and skeletons.
Unconventional TechniquesSome of the "pieces" are highly original in their form and style. Techniques such as 3D rendering, embroidery, sculpting, painting, and building with LEGO bricks were incorporated.
Extras "Pieces Project - Pieces Book 2" will include short biographies/ information about the artists, ideas for the continuation of the "pieces" they created, photos from behind the scenes, additional sketches & illustrations, and the alternative endings.
"The CROWD"Pieces 2 will bring you a one of a kind, collaborative illustration by 46 leading comic book artists. Inspired by the "Where's Wally?" concept, the splash-page artwork will invite you to engage in the search for the Golden Egg hidden among over 1000 characters.
Endings by Established ArtistsThe book will include alternative endings by established artists, exhibited by prominent museums and galleries around the world. (e.g. Sun Xun, Abdul-Rahman Abdullah, Joan Ross).sneak peek - the ending by Sun Xun - full artwork available in the book
Augmented RealityPieces 2 will leap into the future with a unique AR illustration. You will be invited to scan the artwork and explore enhanced visual experience. The ending has been cerated by Sutu - an author, illustrator, media artist and the founder of EyeJack (Augmented Reality company).
Specifications "Pieces Project - Pieces Book 2": A4 size / hardcover with spot UV / 100+ pages (approx. 120 pages - the final number will be known after finalising all translations, etc.).All of the graphics included in the presentation are mock-up designs; the final product might slightly vary.
The Cover The front cover has been created by an award-winning illustrator and graphic designer - Patrycja Podkościelny.   The following artists have contributed to "Pieces Project - Pieces Book 2":Jakub Mazerant, Reg Mombassa, Igor Myszkiewicz, Patrycja Podkościelny, Paweł Zawiślak, Dieter Van der Ougstraete “Dieter VDO”, Agata Karelus “Gagatka”, Ben Frost, Ola Marchocka “aleksandracupcake”, Adam Strzelczyk “Bohun”, Marta Gliwińska “panimarto”, Joanna Krótka, Kuba Gornowicz, Olga Wróbel, Sylwia Paś, Ingrīda Pičukāne, Alicja Gapińska, Giorge Roman, Emilia Dziubak, Tomasz Płonka, Katarzyna Wołodkiewicz-Przyborowska, Krystian Żelazo, Alicja Kocurek, Doug Smock, Łukasz Poślad, Gosia Herba, Patryk Hardziej, Eugene Plotnikov, Andrzej Kidaj “Andy”, Marcin Golinowski “Enes”, Tomasz Jędrzejowski “Skoti”, The HOSU, Greg Holfeld, Mark Rodda, Andrzej Pągowski, Stuart Campbell “Sutu”, Kurt, Anna Helena Szymborska, Maria Apoleika, Zuzia Turek, Julian Frost, Agnieszka Grajda, Elżbieta Gądek, Megi Kopaniszyn, Marta Szudyga, Karol Banach, Adam Kmiołek, Maciej Kmiołek, Pam Pam Liu, Jotaká, Jongmee, Carl Krull, Darek Vasina, Reena Makwana, Malwina Mosiejczuk, James Gulliver Hancock, Titon Małczow, Luke Ramsey, Joaquín Pérez “Monojoaco”, Robert Sienicki “bele”, Agata Wawryniuk, Kostas Kiriakakis, Gemma Correll, Reza Dalvand, Patrick Hruby, Patrycja Garczyńska, Łukasz Samsonowicz "Zimzonowicz”, Rán Flygenring, Jakub Grochola, Guillaume Beinat “TazasProject”, Jeremy Delhuvenne, Oze Tajada, Marek Szymczak, Ric Carrasquillo, Magdalena Koźlicka, FuFu Frauenwahl, Iain Heath, Chris Carfolite, Tim Molloy, Victoria Healy “Meltycats”, T. story:
Get the funniest X-Parody of 2021!

All 3 editions are now in print and shipping out next day!

 


"X" Marks The Laughter Spot With X-Farce: Reloaded #1!

 

Parody Press Comics is back with a FULL-COLOR 48 page graphic novel X-travaganza guaranteed to tickle your funny bone!  This jam-packed book is ad-free, so you're getting nothing but hilarious content from cover to cover!

 

PERKS AHOY!

  • We have cool perks galore! 
  • Besides the fantastic new X-Farce Reloaded #1 cover homage drawn by Bill Maus (based on 1992's smash-hit Eclipse Comics satire, X-Farce #1  where Don and Bill first collaborated), we also have Parody Press alumni Mark Lewis returning to give us a brand new Unfunny X-Cons #1A cover as shown. It's his take on spoofing the classic Uncanny X-Men #4 cover right down to making it look like it came from the 1960's!  Coincidentally, Mark went into animation after drawing for us and landed a job on X-Men: The Animated Series!

  • Plus, the phenomenal team of artist Rob Willis and colorist Matt Yackey contribute an amazing X-Farce Reloaded Cover Variant #1B as well!

  • We need your support to make fun comics that readers ages 13+ can enjoy, and that will hopefully bring a smile and laughter to your face!
  • ​X-FARCE RELOADED #1 marks the triumphant return of the original Parody Press Comics co-founders, Writer Don Chin and Cartoonist Bill Maus, the original "1990's Princes of Parody". 
  • Along for the ride are over a dozen merry comics pros, ready to ridicule, skewer, and poke loving fun at the Marvelous Mutant Franchise, The X-Men!

What You Get

This is our biggest, boldest project yet! We have a HUGE GRAPHIC NOVEL in the works with seven individual stories by some of comics brightest talents!

  • “The Unfunny X-Cons: The Beginning”, a 10-page parody of the original Stan Lee and Jack Kirby 1963's X-Men #1 by Don Chin, Mark Lewis, Kurt Hathaway and Delfin Barral.  Professor Ex with his young prodigies Anglo, Beastie-Boy, Dumbkophs, Marvelous Girl, and Sno-Cone must defeat the evil plant-based villain Magnutto! Done in retro-aged color FX!

 

  • “X-Farce”, a complete 21-page adventure which was the first ever collaboration of Chin and Maus for Eclipse Comics in 1992. It was the best-selling black and white satire for that year, and was a parody of Rob Liefeld's X-Force #1.  X-Farce members Cable TV, Dominoze, Eightball, Shboom Shboom, Garferal, Fallenstar and Tonto must thwart the evil Mpuppet Liberation Force and their secret weapon, the all-pungent wise-cracking mutant known as Cesspool!  Story by Don Chin, art by Bill Maus, Bob Hanon and colored by Delfin Barral.

 ​

  • “The Newt Mutants” by Chin and Thad (Zen Intergalactic Ninja) Rhodes , lettered by Keith Gleason.  A short story in the artistic painted style of Bill Sienkiewicz about Young Amphibians with strange powers who were rejects from the Van Sciver Institute of New Jersey.

​

  • “Professor Ex: Auditions” by Mike (Nexus) Baron, Ted Helard and Barral.  The X-Cons must interview potential new hero recruits after mutant Hunger James ate himself. 

 

  • “The Overcomplicated And Completely Unnecessary Power-House of X” by Keith Gleason, Ian Waryanto and Anton Bandi.  The Professor has a chance encounter with Moira McMorbid and she shares her vision of an All-Mutant Island Nation known as Whackoa.  Gleason, Waryanto and Bandi are also the creative team behind “The Mighty Mascots”, a popular independent title  for Alterna Comics.


  • “WHAT IF…Other Comic Book Companies Had Mutants?” by Chin, Delfin Barral and Michael Grassia.  Asks the hypothetical question of The Unfunny X-Cons Creators Stan Wee and Vac Kirby if they they worked for publishers other than Marble Comics and came up with mutant heroes for them.  “It’s narrated by The Poacher, who is basically Elmer Fudd in space who likes to wuh-wuh-wuh watch from afar,” said Chin.

  • ​“The X-Cons Meet The Infringers in Mission: Antarctica!” By Chin and Kurt Hathaway.  “We challenge the reader’s imagination in this short art-free story that has nothing but word balloons and sound effects”, said Chin.

  • We are hoping that this comic book's success will allow us to bring more fun, high-quality material to an ever-growing enthusiastic audience. It is our FIRST CROWDFUNDED endeavor and we hope to make it the first of many offerings for our fans!

 

THE X-FARCE COLOSSAL 
EXECUTIVE BOX COMETH!
 

For the fan and collector that wants it all!

We are offering a limited amount of X-Farce Reloaded Colossal Executive Boxes that includes: an exclusive X-Farce Reloaded Mini Metal lunchbox (6 x 8 x 4 inches), (1) X-Farce Reloaded color ceramic mug,  (1 each) X-Farce: Reloaded #1, #1A, #1B cover edition variants signed by X-Farce creator DON CHIN, PLUS an exclusive BILL MAUS X-Farce character original art signed inked sketch card only available with the X-Farce Reloaded Colossal Executive Box!  

And you also will receive all stretch goal incentive goodies as they are unlocked!  

Or get the X-Farce Snack Pack with Lunchbox, Mug and (1) Single #1 issue for a great price!

 

COOL ORIGINAL ART YOU CAN BUY!

If you're a collector of original comics art, we are offering select interior pages and many of the amazing original cover art pieces for sale.  Own one-of-a-kind hand-drawn or painted pieces, suitable for framing! Plus, you'll get a copy of the X-Farce Reloaded #1 comic with the cover art!

BILL MAUS COVER PENCILS (11" x 17")


THAD RHODES PAINTED ART (19 x 30", AIRBRUSH, ACRYLIC & COLORED PENCIL)

MARK LEWIS & KURT HATHAWAY X-CONS PAGES FROM 1992! (10" x 15" PEN & INK)

MARK LEWIS UNFUNNY X-CONS COVER LAYOUT FROM 2020! (8.5" x 11" PENCIL)

DON'T BE A STINGY SCROOGE LIKE PROF. QUAX...
HELP US REACH OUR STRETCH GOALS!

As an incentive to back our project and to share it with your friends, we are offering these cool, fun items as we hit each goal as shown:

$15,000 - All backers get an Exclusive X-Farce Color Magnet

$25,000 - All backers get an Exclusive X-Farce Holographic Sticker

$30,000 - All backers get a BEARDZZERKER Color Poster

$50,000 - All backers get an Exclusive X-Farce Cesspool Whoopee Cushion

$75,000 - Mystery Perk (To Be Announced)

$100,000 = Whoa Nelly! Mystery Perk (To Be Announced)

 

The Impact

They say that laughter is the best medicine, right?  I think we can all agree that if we survived the year 2020, we could use A HUGE DOSE of laughter to offset the world's doom and gloom! 

What better way to kick off 2021 than to sit down and have a bunch of belly laughs while reading  X-Farce Reloaded ?

 

Risks & Challenges

  • We are happy to report that 80% of this book's art and story are already completed! 
  • It's been a labor of love to bring the creative teams together and we are in a strong and confident position to see this book to the finish line and get it into your hands.
  • Our funding goal is minimal at $1,700 (we didn't quit our day jobs, lol) and we are feeling GREAT about being able to deliver this book to you on or before April 1, 2021. (No joke!) 
  • Best of all, most creators to the book have already been paid for their work. We are just awaiting what should be a mind-blowing variant cover #1B by ROB WILLIS & MATT YACKEY, and for a couple short stories to be illustrated, which should be done by the end of January 2021.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially at this time, we understand.  We would be so grateful if you could please get the word out and tell your friends about our campaign.  

  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to publicize it on Social Media.

Thanks for your support...we truly appreciate it! 

--Don, Laura and Bill, Your Friends At Parody Press Comics

  • Parody Press was founded in 1992 by Don & Laura Chin and Bill Maus and has published several best-selling satires based on popular comic-book icons such as Superman (The Death of Stupidman), Spawn (Yawn), The Uncanny X-Men (Unfunny X-Cons), Ren and Stimpy (Rank & Stinky), X-Force (X-Farce), and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (Adolescent Radioactive Black Belt Hamsters), and the company’s books have total sales of well over one million copies.

"Huh?  You're still here?  The pitch is over.  You should seriously consider backing it!" -Ferris

“Professor Ex: Auditions” by Mike (Nexus) Baron, Ted Helard and Barral.  The X-Cons must interview potential new hero recruits after mutant Hunger James ate himself. 

 

“The Overcomplicated And Completely Unnecessary Power-House of X” by Keith Gleason, Ian Waryanto and Anton Bandi.  The Professor has a chance encounter with Moira McMorbid and she shares her vision of an All-Mutant Island Nation known as Whackoa.  Gleason, Waryanto and Bandi are also the creative team behind “The Mighty Mascots”, a popular independent title  for Alterna Comics.
“WHAT IF…Other Comic Book Companies Had Mutants?” by Chin, Delfin Barral and Michael Grassia.  Asks the hypothetical question of The Unfunny X-Cons Creators Stan Wee and Vac Kirby if they they worked for publishers other than Marble Comics and came up with mutant heroes for them.  “It’s narrated by The Poacher, who is basically Elmer Fudd in space who likes to wuh-wuh-wuh watch from afar,” said Chin.
​“The X-Cons Meet The Infringers in Mission: Antarctica!” By Chin and Kurt Hathaway.  “We challenge the reader’s imagination in this short art-free story that has nothing but word balloons and sound effects”, said Chin.


We are hoping that this comic book's success will allow us to bring more fun, high-quality material to an ever-growing enthusiastic audience. It is our FIRST CROWDFUNDED endeavor and we hope to make it the first of many offerings for our fans!

 

THE X-FARCE COLOSSAL EXECUTIVE BOX COMETH! 

For the fan and collector that wants it all! 
We are offering a limited amount of X-Farce Reloaded Colossal Executive Boxes that includes: an exclusive X-Farce Reloaded Mini Metal lunchbox (6 x 8 x 4 inches), (1) X-Farce Reloaded color ceramic mug,  (1 each) X-Farce: Reloaded #1, #1A, #1B cover edition variants signed by X-Farce creator DON CHIN, PLUS an exclusive BILL MAUS X-Farce character original art signed inked sketch card only available with the X-Farce Reloaded Colossal Executive Box!  
And you also will receive all stretch goal incentive goodies as they are unlocked!  
Or get the X-Farce Snack Pack with Lunchbox, Mug and (1) Single #1 issue for a great price!

 
COOL ORIGINAL ART YOU CAN BUY!
If you're a collector of original comics art, we are offering select interior pages and many of the amazing original cover art pieces for sale.  Own one-of-a-kind hand-drawn or painted pieces, suitable for framing! Plus, you'll get a copy of the X-Farce Reloaded #1 comic with the cover art!BILL MAUS COVER PENCILS (11" x 17")
THAD RHODES PAINTED ART (19 x 30", AIRBRUSH, ACRYLIC & COLORED PENCIL)

MARK LEWIS & KURT HATHAWAY X-CONS PAGES FROM 1992! (10" x 15" PEN & INK)

MARK LEWIS UNFUNNY X-CONS COVER LAYOUT FROM 2020! (8.5" x 11" PENCIL)

DON'T BE A STINGY SCROOGE LIKE PROF. QUAX...HELP US REACH OUR STRETCH GOALS!

As an incentive to back our project and to share it with your friends, we are offering these cool, fun items as we hit each goal as shown:
$15,000 - All backers get an Exclusive X-Farce Color Magnet
$25,000 - All backers get an Exclusive X-Farce Holographic Sticker
$30,000 - All backers get a BEARDZZERKER Color Poster
$50,000 - All backers get an Exclusive X-Farce Cesspool Whoopee Cushion
$75,000 - Mystery Perk (To Be Announced)
$100,000 = Whoa Nelly! Mystery Perk (To Be Announced)

 
The Impact
They say that laughter is the best medicine, right?  I think we can all agree that if we survived the year 2020, we could use A HUGE DOSE of laughter to offset the world's doom and gloom! 
What better way to kick off 2021 than to sit down and have a bunch of belly laughs while reading  X-Farce Reloaded ?

 
Risks & Challenges

We are happy to report that 80% of this book's art and story are already completed! 
It's been a labor of love to bring the creative teams together and we are in a strong and confident position to see this book to the finish line and get it into your hands.
Our funding goal is minimal at $1,700 (we didn't quit our day jobs, lol) and we are feeling GREAT about being able to deliver this book to you on or before April 1, 2021. (No joke!) 

Best of all, most creators to the book have already been paid for their work. We are just awaiting what should be a mind-blowing variant cover #1B by ROB WILLIS & MATT YACKEY, and for a couple short stories to be illustrated, which should be done by the end of January 2021.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute financially at this time, we understand.  We would be so grateful if you could please get the word out and tell your friends about our campaign.  
You can use the Indiegogo share tools to publicize it on Social Media.
Thanks for your support...we truly appreciate it!  --Don, Laura and Bill, Your Friends At Parody Press Comics
Parody Press was founded in 1992 by Don & Laura Chin and Bill Maus and has published several best-selling satires based on popular comic-book icons such as Superman (The Death of Stupidman), Spawn (Yawn), The Uncanny X-Men (Unfunny X-Cons), Ren and Stimpy (Rank & Stinky), X-Force (X-Farce), and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (Adolescent Radioactive Black Belt Hamsters), and the company’s books have total sales of well over one million copies."Huh?  You're still here?  The pitch is over.  You should seriously consider backing it!" -Ferris

story:
The strangest, most startling Western hero of them all returns!

After blasting his way through a literal army of killers, Six-Gun finds himself trapped by his enemies. Now they play a sick game of cat and mouse with him. Will he emerge triumphant or will he be join the countless nameless corpses in the CEMETERY WITHOUT CROSSES?

This 30+ pages comic and all books in this campaign will ship bagged, boarded and signed by the author. New to the world of SIX-GUN GORILLA? Missed the first seven issues? Don't sweat it! You can get the previous issues as add-ons or as part of a set at a special discounted price. We've also got the 148 page TPB with a new, campaign exclusive cover by Vinnie Tartamella. Wanna kick the tires and see if this is your kind of book? Read the first issue free.

Stepping in to take over art duties from the late, great Adrian Sibar is the incredible Preston Asevedo (DOC SALEM, ROCKABILLY ROADTRIP). Check out this wicked cool wrap-around variant cover he's painted for this issue, a parody of an old Iron Maiden album cover:

*NOTE: If you already have the SIX-GUN GORILLA trade paperback, this means you need issues #7 and #8.

Let's take a look at some of that sweet interior art!

 

Also, back by popular demand, is the original 148 page trade paperback edition of SIX-GUN GORILLA: LONG DAYS OF VENGEANCE with a brand spanking new campaign exclusive cover by the one and only Vinnie Tartamella.

Collects SIX-GUN GORILLA issues #1-#6!

 

And brand new to the campaign, the much asked for SIX-GUN GORILLA FIGURINE is now available.

Hand-made, numbered and signed by the author. Limited to 50, Get one while they can still be got!

If you signed up for the pre-campaign your order will come with a limited edition trading card by super artist Shelby Robertson!

story:
KAYAS ISSUE #1 - 64-pages of Black & White manga inspired action! 

KAYAS ISSUE #2 - 32 pages of adventure in the next instalment of the KAYAS series! 

THE STORY!

KAYAS- A Story of Blood and Stone, takes place long before the Earth was formed. In a realm that sits at the foundation of time. Where might, magic and high adventure reign supreme.

ISSUE #1

A thief has stolen something from a kingdom that could upset the power structures. She makes her escape toward an enchanted land known as The Dragon Mouth Pass while being pursued by psychic bounty hunters. Her cargo has condemned her to a life on the run but it might be a key to changing the future, especially the future of a boy named Nito.

ISSUE #2

An unlikely Trio consisting of Nito a young fifteen-year-old boy, TRIGGER the chain-smoking chicken and Sissik the giant rattlesnake leave their jungle home in search of the one thing that might save their dear old friend Cat Master LEE. Aided by a mystical Seeker Stone they set out into the world in search of something that might not even exist! Join our adventurers as we discover the world of KAYAS!

Hello everybody!

Welcome to the campaign! I'm Ryan Cardinal and for over 20+ years I worked as a tattoo artist and did a stint in the animation world doing storyboards. I’ve been lucky enough to work with a bunch of great people and have done some really cool projects. Most notably has been the fan favorite animated series on NETFLIX called The Hollow.

But before all of that, all I have ever wanted to do was make and draw comic books. Now I want to tell the story of my creator owned project -KAYAS: A Story of Blood and Stone!  This series is all about high-impact action, martial arts mayhem, swords, sorcery, monsters, mystery and the spirit of adventure (plus some comedy and drama to break up all the battles and running around!).

KAYAS is intended for Young Adult Readers ages 13+.  It contains violence, use of tobacco/alcohol, body horror, suggestive themes and awkward scenarios

The campaign for KAYAS has a fixed goal of $3,000 to produce the 1st print run of issue #2!

Variant cover unlocks!

For both issue #1&2 there is the standard edition, sketch covers and the secret tier(for those who subscribed to the email list prior to launch). The standard edition of each issue will have a very small print run of 300 copies. When they are sold out, that cover will be retired and a new variant cover will take it's place. This cover will also have a limited print run. 

 

 

 

Any questions or concerns please contact me at ryan@kayascomic.com.

When the campaign closes, all sales are considered final so I can get my butt into gear and produce these action packed adventure books! All refunds during the campaign period are welcome and will be honored!

Final artwork may vary.

story:
SAVING THE WORLD

I grew up listening to Nirvana, watching Daria and reading comix like Ghost World, Love and Rockets, and The Crow. That's where I'm coming from. Saving the World is a super hero comic, but with the soul of the mid 90's underground comix. Why? Cuz I think it's cool.

HERE AND NOW!

STW #5 is jammed packed with new adventures! Three, count'em three new stories! Our main event follows Kierra and Alice on their way to their local comic book shop, but as you might imagine, things go sideways real fast when they encounter the diabolical Arakness! He's like a insect in human form, that claims to be a spider...but is clearly a insect. He get's an D- in biology, but an A+ is being a jerk.

Next up is Lilly and Wepwawet: Day Zero. Our fan favorite, time traveling explorers return with a trip back to where it all began....if that's even possible. Before Lilly ever met Wepwawet she worked as a bank teller trying to move up that latter of success, however, as is Lilly's destiny, nothing is ever straight forward, or even remotely linear.

Lastly I introduce the high flying adventures of Hobo-Girl! She's a little mad, dines on catfood, and fights crime without a moments hesitation. Okay...this sounds dumb, but trust me, it's great! :P

 

SPECS!

Color Cover by Illustrator Monk

Variant Cover by Zombie Ernie

Written and Illustrated by Tonicmole

32 black and white pages (like the cool kids do!)

Saddle stitched (Fancy way of saying it's stapled.)

 

SPECIAL ORDER?

I'm always willing to help out a customer, however I also have a website if there's any back issue's you want: www.toniccomix.com has what you need if it ain't here! However, never hesitate to reach out if there's any way I can help you. I wanna sell comix, so if you don't see what you want I'm always here to see if I can make it happen!

story:
Back in the summer of 2008 Ben was writing and drawing a back up for Ninja High School #'s 162-164 and asked me to  takeover writing the series after part 3 and so, a short while later I handed the completed script in. Sadly, the series never saw completion in the pages of Ninja High School as the series ended at # 175.  Fast Forward to  late 2015 and Ben & Myself decided to do a 4 issue Mini-series and finally complete the series unfortunately, the comic market is a harsh Mistress and the series was cancelled after issue two due to low sales. Shortly thereafter I  heard from fans wanting to read the rest of the series so, decided to bring it directly to them  and the best way to do that was with a fundraising campaign.  Comics are not cheap to produce and it takes time to get the work done but, I was resolute in bringing the completed series to the fans that have supported us or those that just want to read a fun, exciting story set in the Ninja High School universe.

So, here we are. Indiegogo.  I hope you consider helping us bring out the complete Ninja High School : Ninjas VS Aliens TPB .Your support means the world to us.

Jim Felker & Ben Dunn

story:
An Indie Comic Event, 7 Years in the Making! 

7 years to fine-tune the story, to develop characters with real depth and refine the art! And now we are SO DAMN PROUD to FINALLY bring this project to life as an 80+ page, fully-colored, perfect-bound graphic novel!! 

 

 

Bring back the classic hero story!

 

In our story ISSUES, we set out to bring back classic superheroes, and the sense of immersion that comics used to provide! We wanted to create an epic story where heroes could be heroic again, where men could be masculine and women were allowed to be sexy! We wanted dialogue where characters talked like real people, cracked jokes and had real emotions. We want you to feel for our characters, to cheer for them on through their hardships and root for them in battle! Most of all, we want you to have FUN!

ISSUES is a satirical look at classic superhero archetypes, in a modern setting. It explores the intricacies and eccentrics of their lives, and re-examines the question, 'what does it truly mean to be a hero?', all while navigating a deeper, original story of family, redemption and loss. 

This first installment follows a young Special Agent, and a group of veteran set-in-their-ways superheroes, as they learn to come together as a team, and take the first steps on a journey to regain their former glory. 

 

Examples of the updated Interior Art!

 

Skip some pages to appease the spoiler gods...

And we have the first appearance of our speedster Haste!

 

 

 

 

And Much More To Come!

 

 

Anne Gallo: A young Special Agent thrust into the world of veteran Superheroes, trying to keep her sanity as Team Liaison, while hoping to learn the truth behind her own father's murder.

The Patriot: The most powerful being ever known. Previously retired after being accused of his team's death. Now, years later, Patriot hopes to regain the trust and admiration of the country he loves.

Haste: Fastest hero to ever exist! People may think his best years are behind him, but there's still plenty of heroics left in this former world-renowned speedster!

The Standard: A newer arrival to the vigilante scene, little is known about this Hardware Hero. While he is VERY handy in combat, he's WAY too full of himself. Even the emblem he wears is a 'raised bar'. Is he just an asshole, or does his cocky façade hide something darker?

Lux: Technically government property and forced to be a superhero, this former Dimensionaut has a symbiotic entity that grants him the ability to create and manipulate insane amounts of white hot energy!

Havana, Hunter & Bafo: These newbie 'modern-day' superheroes go by the team name Reverb! Hunter and Havana are extra-dimensional twins who share wildly amplified versions of their powers when in close proximity to each other, making them some of the worlds strongest heroes. Also there is a monkey. He is super intelligent, and very pompous about it. 

 

 

"Before Picture"

We wanted to go with something a little lighthearted with this first one. Still a group cover, but showing what everyone was like before shit hit the fan. Like the first day at work. 

 

"Untitled Variant"

For this one we contracted an amazingly talented artist, Valery Ike Bayu Aji, to work up a clean and simple cover that reflects the naivete of our main character in contrast to the seasoned heroes she works with.

 

"Stunning & Brave"

 

This special wrap-around cover is another work from the skilled hands of Valery Ike Bayu Aji. I could give you a bunch of bullshit about 'empowerment' and whatnot, but honestly, who doesn't love beautiful women? No 'approved body types', just good old fashioned fan service!

 

 

The Physical Perks

  • Every perk comes with at least one SIGNED copy of the book, with the cover of your choice!
  • All 3 covers are available as high-quality SIGNED 11"x17" prints!
  • All character sketches are of a character of your choice OR you can get a sketch of yourself or a loved one, drawn in the style of our comic!
  • Every physical perk can ALSO be selected as an add-on, so you don't have to worry about missing out on anything!

 

The Cameo Perks

This is where we REALLY shine!

  • We want maximum customer involvement, so we made all the cameo perks super affordable, and the lowest tier doesn't even have a limit!
  • If you choose to 'fight a hero' you don't have to worry about only showing up in one panel, we'll flat out make you a villain and put you in a whole fight scene!
  • The 'featured character' we have written, is a speaking role with multiple appearances, AND is even featured in the second book! 
  • If you choose to 'be the mayor' you'll have a speaking role, with multiple appearances in at least the first two books as well!
  • If you have great ideas for some dialogue, or even a good joke or two, choose the Video Chat perk! We'll set up a live chat with you and go over your ideas to write up a great cameo appearance that we can all be proud of! Or at least make fun of!
  • The 'child's fan art' is near and dear to my heart! I have a great plan for it, but I can't say too much without giving anything away! Just know that your kid's fan art will be added in and 'received' by our heroes, who will love it, thank your kid BY NAME, and hang it up on their fridge! From there, I can't say much more, but it will be shown and referenced in ALL 3 BOOKS! We'll even write a special 'Thank You' to your child on the inside cover of your book! If this perk doesn't provide a memorable experience, I don't know what will!
  • All cameo perk backers will get their name added in a 'Special Appearances' section in the back of every book! 

 

We here at War Dance comics are SERIOUS about providing, not only a great story, but a truly memorable comic experience as well! 

 

 

$1,000- Spot UV Covers! 

 

$2,000- Fan Art Contest! 

All backers are able to participate in the fan art contest! Our top picks will have their art featured as chapter breaks IN THE COMIC!

 

$3,000- Trading Cards Added to Every Perk!

 

$4,500- Exclusive Print Added to Every Perk!

The fans have spoken, and we listened! We're doing a great 11x17 piece EXCLUSIVELY for our IndieGoGo backers! This art will be painted up by our very own Snoots, signed by us at War Dance Comics, and will NEVER be offered again!

 

$5,500- YOU tell US!

We don't want to waste everyone's time and money with things our fans don't want, we want to know what you DO want! Every stretch goal, $5,500 and up, is up to the fans! You guys tell us what you want to see, and we'll try to make it happen for you!

 

 

We Work For You!

EVERYTHING that comes from this campaign is going towards fulfilling your perks, and feeding us while we finish this book and create the 2nd! I personally have set aside my life savings to try and make this dream of ours a reality, and everything we get from our backers is going directly back in to further that dream! So when I say 'we work for you', that's  A PROMISE! 

 

 

 

Our brand was formed back in 2013 after a series of passionate debates between best friends who happen to be giant dorks. Our 'what if' and 'logical progression' thought process soon snowballed into a whole comic universe, and we have been working on building it ever since.

Fast forward to present day; we recently decided to finally take the leap and focus, full time, on getting this label off the ground. The two of us have been working every day to create our first real product, our flagship comic, ISSUES. 

Also social media is fucking cancer, so we employed two very close friends of ours to brave those particular waters for us, so that we can focus on creating great content.

 

 

CG and WC friendly.

Loyal to the art.

Loyal to the fans.

We'll fly our own flag.

 

Back ISSUES Today!

 

 

Trailer Credits:

Editing by Brett Weidmann

Voice-over by Kenneth Edward

Music by Benjamin Tissot​

Previously retired after being accused of his team's death. Now, years later, Patriot hopes to regain the trust and admiration of the country he loves.Haste: Fastest hero to ever exist! People may think his best years are behind him, but there's still plenty of heroics left in this former world-renowned speedster!The Standard: A newer arrival to the vigilante scene, little is known about this Hardware Hero. While he is VERY handy in combat, he's WAY too full of himself. Even the emblem he wears is a 'raised bar'. Is he just an asshole, or does his cocky façade hide something darker?Lux: Technically government property and forced to be a superhero, this former Dimensionaut has a symbiotic entity that grants him the ability to create and manipulate insane amounts of white hot energy!Havana, Hunter & Bafo: These newbie 'modern-day' superheroes go by the team name Reverb! Hunter and Havana are extra-dimensional twins who share wildly amplified versions of their powers when in close proximity to each other, making them some of the worlds strongest heroes. Also there is a monkey. He is super intelligent, and very pompous about it.   "Before Picture"We wanted to go with something a little lighthearted with this first one. Still a group cover, but showing what everyone was like before shit hit the fan. Like the first day at work.  "Untitled Variant"For this one we contracted an amazingly talented artist, Valery Ike Bayu Aji, to work up a clean and simple cover that reflects the naivete of our main character in contrast to the seasoned heroes she works with. "Stunning & Brave" This special wrap-around cover is another work from the skilled hands of Valery Ike Bayu Aji. I could give you a bunch of bullshit about 'empowerment' and whatnot, but honestly, who doesn't love beautiful women? No 'approved body types', just good old fashioned fan service!  The Physical Perks
Every perk comes with at least one SIGNED copy of the book, with the cover of your choice!
All 3 covers are available as high-quality SIGNED 11"x17" prints!
All character sketches are of a character of your choice OR you can get a sketch of yourself or a loved one, drawn in the style of our comic!
Every physical perk can ALSO be selected as an add-on, so you don't have to worry about missing out on anything!
 The Cameo Perks
This is where we REALLY shine!

We want maximum customer involvement, so we made all the cameo perks super affordable, and the lowest tier doesn't even have a limit!
If you choose to 'fight a hero' you don't have to worry about only showing up in one panel, we'll flat out make you a villain and put you in a whole fight scene!
The 'featured character' we have written, is a speaking role with multiple appearances, AND is even featured in the second book! 
If you choose to 'be the mayor' you'll have a speaking role, with multiple appearances in at least the first two books as well!
If you have great ideas for some dialogue, or even a good joke or two, choose the Video Chat perk! We'll set up a live chat with you and go over your ideas to write up a great cameo appearance that we can all be proud of! Or at least make fun of!
The 'child's fan art' is near and dear to my heart! I have a great plan for it, but I can't say too much without giving anything away! Just know that your kid's fan art will be added in and 'received' by our heroes, who will love it, thank your kid BY NAME, and hang it up on their fridge! From there, I can't say much more, but it will be shown and referenced in ALL 3 BOOKS! We'll even write a special 'Thank You' to your child on the inside cover of your book! If this perk doesn't provide a memorable experience, I don't know what will!
All cameo perk backers will get their name added in a 'Special Appearances' section in the back of every book! 
 We here at War Dance comics are SERIOUS about providing, not only a great story, but a truly memorable comic experience as well!   $1,000- Spot UV Covers! 
 $2,000- Fan Art Contest! All backers are able to participate in the fan art contest! Our top picks will have their art featured as chapter breaks IN THE COMIC! $3,000- Trading Cards Added to Every Perk! $4,500- Exclusive Print Added to Every Perk!The fans have spoken, and we listened! We're doing a great 11x17 piece EXCLUSIVELY for our IndieGoGo backers! This art will be painted up by our very own Snoots, signed by us at War Dance Comics, and will NEVER be offered again! $5,500- YOU tell US!We don't want to waste everyone's time and money with things our fans don't want, we want to know what you DO want! Every stretch goal, $5,500 and up, is up to the fans! You guys tell us what you want to see, and we'll try to make it happen for you!  We Work For You!EVERYTHING that comes from this campaign is going towards fulfilling your perks, and feeding us while we finish this book and create the 2nd! I personally have set aside my life savings to try and make this dream of ours a reality, and everything we get from our backers is going directly back in to further that dream! So when I say 'we work for you', that's  A PROMISE!    Our brand was formed back in 2013 after a series of passionate debates between best friends who happen to be giant dorks. Our 'what if' and 'logical progression' thought process soon snowballed into a whole comic universe, and we have been working on building it ever since.Fast forward to present day; we recently decided to finally take the leap and focus, full time, on getting this label off the ground. The two of us have been working every day to create our first real product, our flagship comic, ISSUES. Also social media is fucking cancer, so we employed two very close friends of ours to brave those particular waters for us, so that we can focus on creating great content.  CG and WC friendly.Loyal to the art.Loyal to the fans.We'll fly our own flag. Back ISSUES Today!  Trailer Credits:Editing by Brett WeidmannVoice-over by Kenneth EdwardMusic by Benjamin Tissot​

story:
So here's the pitch

The gods of our world have turned against us, sending their minions to terrify and enslave us. Why you ask? Because an alien and enigmatic race known as the Fae arrived on our planet, and we didn't turn them away. Now our gods seek to punish us for the sin of harboring their enemies. 

Bookmark

Here's the mock-up for the Bookmark you'll be getting. This is a language and alphabet we made to be used when people use the 'words of creation' or as you're used to calling it - magic. 

We have a shirt and other items you can acquire as add-ons

The Next Great American Fairytale

  • In the vein of Star Wars, Lord of the rings, and Harry Potter we need a new fairy tale to capture our attention and stoke the fires of our imagination — Let Sins of the Fae be that for you and your family.
  • This comic is the first peek into a world that is over a decade in the making. 

Sharing is Caring

  • These are crazy times, not everybody has money to burn. So if you can't buy it, then talk about it. Spread the word, do some fan-art, and be sure to hit us up on Twitter. 

Stretch Goals

  • 15,000 - Third variant Cover available

  • TBD

These are crazy times, not everybody has money to burn. So if you can't buy it, then talk about it. Spread the word, do some fan-art, and be sure to hit us up on Twitter. 

Stretch Goals
15,000 - Third variant Cover available
TBD

story:
The Ultimate 80s Horror Homage for a good cause!

 

 

Everybody knows the last year has been filled with unprecedented challenges.  It felt like Covid-19 changed the world overnight and we all were just in a rush to keep up with those changes.  Some of us were hit harder than others.  

 

Terry Parr is a father, husband, and comic creator.  I’ve been proud to call Terry a friend and creative partner for the better part of two decades.  He is extremely talented, imaginative, and a wizard with a pencil.  He is like a brother to me.  So, of course, when he got sick, I knew I had to help him. 

 

Like so many, Terry was hit with high medical bills after contracting Covid-19.  Thankfully a solution presented itself in the form of an indie comics crossover between my own Lucy Chaplin: Science Starlet and Terry’s Aerobicide.  Based on a story originating from myself and Terry,   I have gathered a talented creative team to bring this tale to life.   This comic has it all, bodacious babes, pop culture references, gallows humor, and of course PUNK ROCK ZOMBIES! Best of all, proceeds from this crowdfund will be going to help the Parr family cover Terry’s medical bills. 

 

Your Favorite Brain Soup!

 

 

Aside from being for a good cause, this crossover aims to be - above all - a good time.  Following our two leading ladies as they get pulled inside REVENGE OF THE CREEPING DREAD, an 80s horror flick with all that entails.  Together, Sheri and Lucy must fight to survive hordes of the undead while trying to find a way out of the movie and back to their own worlds. 

This comic is crammed with heart, horror, and the kinds of things both comic book and horror fans love.  

 

Meet the Team: 

 

 

Drew Edwards: Story/Script/ Creator of Dr. Lucy Chaplin

Award-winning comic book writer, horror film historian, music journalist, rock promoter, and showman extraordinaire; these are all guises of the creative force known as Drew Edwards. Best known as the writer and creator of the long-running underground comic book series, Halloween Man, thousands tune in each week to hear him as a cast member of the horror movie podcast, Castle of Horror. Known as “Howlin’” Drew Edwards to many musicians, he’s helped bridge the horror and comic culture worlds with Austin’s legendary music scene with Halloween Man Productions annual “Punk vs. Rockabilly” showcase during SXSW, now in its tenth year, and as a contributing writer for Rockabilly Online. Drew currently lives in Austin, Texas with his wife, musician/activist, Jamie Bahr, and a pair of loveable bunnies. 

 

Terry Parr: Story/Creator of Aerobicide

Terry Parr is a Korean-American artist & writer currently living in Fort Worth. Terry is known for his comic/manga pin-up style. His works can be seen on Ninja High School (Antarctic Press) Aerobicide The Extreme Ninja Workout, Vampirella, Dusk Comics, Rio Bravo Comics, TeeFury, and Project A-Kon (America’s 4th largest Anime convention).

Brian Crowley Artist/Inker

Brian J. Crowley is a design leader and illustration professional currently working with Fortune 500 companies and multiple agency clients specializing in organizational agile transformation. He lives in Portage Park with his wife Stacey. He’s the creator of the webcomic “Hamster Rage” and has drawn and written numerous other comics.

 

Wesley Wong Colorist

"Wesley Wong is a freelance illustrator and colorist working in the comic and game industry. Up until recently, his dayjob was color and line art restoration artist on the Marvel Masterworks line of books. He currently lives in the suburbs of Tinley Park with his far more talented better-half Sheila Johnson.

Cal Slayton Cover Artist(Cover A) 

Cal Slayton is best known for his work on the hit indie comic series Shades of Blue. His resume includes Texas Zombie Wars, Dead@17 Rough Cut, Super Hero Happy Hour, Champion of Children, and more. He has also done sketch card work for properties such as Marvel, DC, Star Wars, The Walking Dead, Zenescope, Lady Death, and others.

April Guadiana, Art Director, Colorist/Letterer/Design

Based in Dallas, Texas, April is a cover artist for Now Books and the art director for Halloween Man Comics. Previous credits include the Save Bomb Girls Campaign,  Steampunk Originals Vol. 1, and  Night of the Living Dead: Reanimated. She resides in Dallas, Texas along with her adorable orange tabby, Kitkat.

Russell Hillman: Editor

 

Russell Hillman has been editing Halloween Man since 2003. He also writes and publishes his own comic books under the Freaktown Comics imprint. They currently have four titles available through ComiXology - The Dark of the Forest, Deadly Burlesque, Slashermania, and Fast and Frightening - A Comic About Roller Derby. Russell lives in Coventry, England, with his wife, Sheila. In his spare time, Russell wonders why he doesn't have any spare time.

 

 

 

Burn the Flames of Fandom!

 

We do this because we love it and we want to make the best comic possible for our fans.  Each backer helps us to help Terry and his family get out of debt.  But you’re not only helping a hard-working comic creator out.  You’re rewarding yourself with cool comics and cooler perks. 

Short on cash to help fund the book? There are other ways you can help! We’d truly appreciate it if you shared our Indiegogo page on your social media. Know someone who’s into indie comics?  Please send them a link to our Indiegogo campaign. Do you run a comic book store or website, or genre-related fansite? Blog about it and share your passion for indie comics with the world!

Thanks to everyone! Now let's DO this!

story:
Reena Saffron may have survived her first few days as an officer with the Pallad City Police Department, but her most dangerous cases are yet to come! She'll have to investigate a theme park where not all is as it seems, try to prevent an experimental tank from leveling the city, hunt down a robotic police canine unit, and contend with a berserk android...

Can Reena and her hot-headed partner, Madison Wynter, bring law and order to a city on the edge of chaos?

Danger Zone One originally began in June 2016 as a weekly webcomic. It continues to update every Sunday and we haven't missed an update since we started three years ago. You can read the comic online at www.DangerZoneOne.com

The physical edition will be formatted as a traditional manga-sized paperback (5.5" x 7.75").

Sample pages:

Missed out on Volume 1? Copies are still available: 

All price amounts for backers in the United States include shipping costs. International backers are responsible for taxes, VAT, and/or customs fees. Sadly, we can not mark items as "gifts." All physical items ship via USPS.
