story:
PLEASE NOTE THE STRETCH GOAL MESSAGE! 

We hope everyone is doing well. Thank you for spending the time to take a look at our newest Indiegogo campaign. Yes, we just completed fulfillment of the last COLORIZE Gold Digger campaign which got us through issue #25.  We've hit the halfway point!  Whew...it has been a journey, but thank you taking it with us. 

If you're not familiar with us, my name is Joeming Dunn, and I run Antarctic Press, a small, independent comic company started in 1984. I have personally collected comics of almost every type and genre since 1974, and I can say that during the past 30 years, we have published some of the greatest and best independent comics out there. Our publishing history includes titles like Gold Digger and Ninja High School. The comic industry has changed over the years, so we have started this Indiegogo program to help introduce new projects from our talented group of creators. You may have seen some of our other successful and fulfilled campaigns.

Over the years, we have published a number of series. Prominent among these is Fred Perry's ingenious title, Gold Digger, which Fred describes as a mixture of Indiana Jones and Final Fantasy. The idea for Gold Digger was first conceived during Fred's tour of duty in the first Gulf War, and it debuted in Antarctic Press's anthology comic, Mangazine, in 1991. A four-issue miniseries followed in 1992, and a regular monthly black-and-white series followed starting in 1993. The current color series began in 1999 and has continued since then. It is the second-longest-running solo-created title in the industry, and the only second-longest-running female-lead comic series after Wonder Woman. In 2013, Fred was honored at Comic Con International in San Diego, where he received an Inkpot Award for his work on Gold Digger.

 

One of our most frequently received fan requests over the years is, "When can I see the original black-and-white series of Gold Digger in color?"

 

Getting a book colored is not an easy proposition due to the cost and time involved, and both of those commodities are scarce in the independent publishing world. But with crowdfunding, it is now possible to achieve that goal. We experimented with a previous campaign (Gold Brick 7), and due to its success, we were able to color the first two issues of the black-and-white series. So back in June of 2016, we ran the first part of this campaign, and thus far, we've been able to COLORIZE 25 ISSUES of the original 50-issue black-and-white series.  Here is a small sample of what's been done. Below are original and colored pages from Gold Digger, colorized thanks to one of our previous crowdfunding campaigns.

 

What we would like to do is to continue this process with issue #26 of the series, since the first 25 issues are already funded and complete.

Here is a PDF link for Gold Digger #26...FOR FREE, JUST FOR LOOKING AT OUR CAMPAIGN. (Should be compatible with any PDF capable device.)

 

https://app.box.com/s/ww5oqh832e4j1upor2ixxl6ko...

 

The money collected will go to paying the colorist to perform the task of coloring. And for each $1200 we collect beyond the first goal, we will color the next issue. For instance, if we collect a total of $2300 with this campaign, we will then proceed to color issue #20; if we collect at least $3400, we'll have issue #21 colored, and so forth and so on. Supporters will receive the PDFs of each completed issue that is colored, and those in the upper pledge tiers will also get the issues that have already been colorized.

We have released some of the previous colorized issues of Gold Digger in printed format as Gold Digger Remastered Book 1.  When we complete the colorization process on future issues, we can release them in future Gold Digger Remastered volumes.

 

How we budget the money...  $1200 Goal

$120 Indiegogo Fees (Indiegogo takes 10% for various fees)

$150 for Fred for each issue that is funded...for all his hard work

$130 Administration...to manage and send the PDF's to all the supporters

$800 for our esteemed colorists...each issues is from 24 to 30 pages long, so that comes to about $25 to $30 per page for them.

 

 

Here are our STRETCH GOAL TARGETS. The more we reach, the more we color! 

STRETCH GOAL #1 - $2300 - Colorize Gold Digger #27

 STRETCH GOAL #2 - $3400 - Colorize Gold Digger #28 

STRETCH GOAL #3 - $4500 - Colorize Gold Digger #29

STRETCH GOAL #4 - $5400 - Colorize Gold Digger #30

STRETCH GOAL #5 - $6500 - Colorize Gold Digger #31

STRETCH GOAL #6 - $7600 - Colorize Gold Digger #32

STRETCH GOAL #7 - $8700 - Colorize Gold Digger #33

STRETCH GOAL #8 - $9800 - Colorize Gold Digger #34

As you all know, part of this campaign is the Stretch Goals. The idea is the more money we make, the more issues we can produce and color.  But computer coloring is very much a skill-based, time-intensive process, and we are proud to have colorists that can do this endeavor. However, these people are performing these tasks are doing so at a reduced rate because they are fans of Fred Perry and his creation, Gold Digger.

Because of this ,we are capping the Stretch Goals for this campaign to issue #34, which will be NINE issues. This will allow the colorists to do the campaign in a timely manner without affecting other jobs they are doing. In addition, we will be increasing the page rate for the colorists and the portion of the campaign funding that goes to Fred himself for creating such a fantastic universe.

We appreciate your understanding in this process. We will mostly likely “add” some bonus PDF’s of other books when the campaign is complete. (We have not decided which ones, but will aim for a variety that we hope you will enjoy.) If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to message or email us. Again, thanks for everything, and as usual, we appreciate the support of Antarctic Press.

OF NOTE - We offer this through multiple crowd funding sites so we have already reached  STRETCH GOAL #8 so you will be guaranteed 9 issues of colorized GOLD DIGGER. We know that some supporters choose one crowdfunding site over others. 

 

To help us reach our goals, we have some ADD-ONS available.  Just add the appropriate amounts to your pledge.  This will help us keep our coloring elves busy!

 

 

Risks and challenges

There are always risks inherent in any project. This project has very few risks; the books are already drawn, so all we need to do is raise the funds, pay the colorist, and get the issues colored. Our biggest risk is that we won't get the funding, and then the issues won't get colored. We have been printing and releasing books for close to 30 years, so we have a good relationship with our colorists and do not anticipate any hiccups. There is always the risk that colorization may get slowed down due to a variety of factors, but again, we do not anticipate that sort of problem. We believe in full disclosure, and we will make sure to keep you all updated on the progress of the book and all the incentives. As you can see, we have had positive responses to all our previous campaigns and have had no difficulty fulfilling our obligations. The colorist we are using for this project is someone we have dealt with for many years, so we do not anticipate any difficulties.

So back in June of 2016, we ran the first part of this campaign, and thus far, we've been able to COLORIZE 25 ISSUES of the original 50-issue black-and-white series.  Here is a small sample of what's been done. Below are original and colored pages from Gold Digger, colorized thanks to one of our previous crowdfunding campaigns. What we would like to do is to continue this process with issue #26 of the series, since the first 25 issues are already funded and complete.Here is a PDF link for Gold Digger #26...FOR FREE, JUST FOR LOOKING AT OUR CAMPAIGN. (Should be compatible with any PDF capable device.) https://app.box.com/s/ww5oqh832e4j1upor2ixxl6ko... The money collected will go to paying the colorist to perform the task of coloring. And for each $1200 we collect beyond the first goal, we will color the next issue. For instance, if we collect a total of $2300 with this campaign, we will then proceed to color issue #20; if we collect at least $3400, we'll have issue #21 colored, and so forth and so on. Supporters will receive the PDFs of each completed issue that is colored, and those in the upper pledge tiers will also get the issues that have already been colorized.We have released some of the previous colorized issues of Gold Digger in printed format as Gold Digger Remastered Book 1.  When we complete the colorization process on future issues, we can release them in future Gold Digger Remastered volumes. How we budget the money...  $1200 Goal$120 Indiegogo Fees (Indiegogo takes 10% for various fees)$150 for Fred for each issue that is funded...for all his hard work$130 Administration...to manage and send the PDF's to all the supporters$800 for our esteemed colorists...each issues is from 24 to 30 pages long, so that comes to about $25 to $30 per page for them.  Here are our STRETCH GOAL TARGETS. The more we reach, the more we color! STRETCH GOAL #1 - $2300 - Colorize Gold Digger #27 STRETCH GOAL #2 - $3400 - Colorize Gold Digger #28 STRETCH GOAL #3 - $4500 - Colorize Gold Digger #29STRETCH GOAL #4 - $5400 - Colorize Gold Digger #30STRETCH GOAL #5 - $6500 - Colorize Gold Digger #31STRETCH GOAL #6 - $7600 - Colorize Gold Digger #32STRETCH GOAL #7 - $8700 - Colorize Gold Digger #33STRETCH GOAL #8 - $9800 - Colorize Gold Digger #34As you all know, part of this campaign is the Stretch Goals. The idea is the more money we make, the more issues we can produce and color.  But computer coloring is very much a skill-based, time-intensive process, and we are proud to have colorists that can do this endeavor. However, these people are performing these tasks are doing so at a reduced rate because they are fans of Fred Perry and his creation, Gold Digger.Because of this ,we are capping the Stretch Goals for this campaign to issue #34, which will be NINE issues. This will allow the colorists to do the campaign in a timely manner without affecting other jobs they are doing. In addition, we will be increasing the page rate for the colorists and the portion of the campaign funding that goes to Fred himself for creating such a fantastic universe.We appreciate your understanding in this process. We will mostly likely “add” some bonus PDF’s of other books when the campaign is complete. (We have not decided which ones, but will aim for a variety that we hope you will enjoy.) If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to message or email us. Again, thanks for everything, and as usual, we appreciate the support of Antarctic Press.OF NOTE - We offer this through multiple crowd funding sites so we have already reached  STRETCH GOAL #8 so you will be guaranteed 9 issues of colorized GOLD DIGGER. We know that some supporters choose one crowdfunding site over others.  To help us reach our goals, we have some ADD-ONS available.  Just add the appropriate amounts to your pledge.  This will help us keep our coloring elves busy!  Risks and challengesThere are always risks inherent in any project. This project has very few risks; the books are already drawn, so all we need to do is raise the funds, pay the colorist, and get the issues colored. Our biggest risk is that we won't get the funding, and then the issues won't get colored. We have been printing and releasing books for close to 30 years, so we have a good relationship with our colorists and do not anticipate any hiccups. There is always the risk that colorization may get slowed down due to a variety of factors, but again, we do not anticipate that sort of problem. We believe in full disclosure, and we will make sure to keep you all updated on the progress of the book and all the incentives. As you can see, we have had positive responses to all our previous campaigns and have had no difficulty fulfilling our obligations. The colorist we are using for this project is someone we have dealt with for many years, so we do not anticipate any difficulties.

story:
A Medieval Fantasy Thriller

This is a medieval fantasy with a mysterious twist. A man in knights armor comes every night and kills people in the palace before crumbling to dust before the Baron. This happens nightly, the castle slowly being whittled down.

Now the Baron is slowly losing everything he holds dear, but is too ashamed to admit his past sins.

This will be 56 pages for 10 dollars.

This is a 56 page one shot with a beginning, middle and end. No issues need to be read, or will need to read in the future (though we might do further issues in the future). Just a single issue comic

story:
MATTHEW MARTIN's triumphant return to the Indie Comic Book Series that made him a star:

 

SNOWMAN: A COLD DAY IN HELL!

 

Daniel Elk Heart is on a journey seeking the meaning of a dark vision that haunts his dreams. With his companion Samual, they will discover a figure of vengeance and hatred they could have never imagined. A victim of a genocidal massacre has somehow returned from the dead and is carving a path of death across the heart of America.

Driven by the echoes of silenced screams, this is the story of a man once known as BLACK DOG.

The one now forever known as THE SNOWMAN.

And you can help us awaken him once more!  

ALL CAPS COMICS, the publisher of CYBERFROG and REIGNBOW THE BRUTE, would like to ask you to help fund this incredible return to comics for SNOWMAN and MATT MARTIN with a beautiful 48 page graphic novel!  

 

We've already begun the comic!  You can help us finish it, produce it, and be the FIRST to read and enjoy it!

Here's a quick peek!


We told you it was GREAT!

 

24 HOUR VARIANT COVER!

You've got until 5:59 PM EST on December 12th 2020 to reserve your copy of this beautiful SNOWMAN variant cover!  Then, it's closed down!  No more chances to get it!  

 

We've got four different variant covers to choose from!  Or get all of them!

Covers A-C are by Matt Martin himself!  But the fourth cover is by legendary CREED creator TRENT KANIUGA! Take a look at this beauty!

That brings the three of us together again, the original Hall of Heroes crew!  Ah, memories!

SNOWMAN: EARLY FROST #1

We'd also like to offer you a remastered, brand new reprint of SNOWMAN #1 from 1995!  In color for the first time!  We'd like to be able to reprint the whole series in color, so please don't forget to add SNOWMAN: EARLY FROST to your list!

All of these comics are ADD-ONs, so feel free to order them in any combo!  You can purchase one and add on as many others as you'd like at Check out!  We appreciate you!

ORIGINAL ART!

Matt is making 20 pages of SNOWMAN: A COLD DAY IN HELL original art available to backers!  They will be distributed on a first come first serve basis!  So order early!

 

STRETCH GOALS!

So the book is starting out as a simple classic black and white story, in a regular cover!

When we hit:

 $20,000, we're FULL COLOR INTERIORS

$40,000, we're adding a SNOWMAN sticker to everyone's order!

$50,000,  we're adding a giant dazzling ALL CAPS COMICS sticker to everyone's order!

And more stuff in between!

If we get to $100,000, we're doing all of the covers in beautiful ETCHED FOIL!

 

But let's not put the cart before the horse...help us BUILD THIS SNOWMAN!  We need you and your support today!

story:
32 page one-shot story CROSSOVER between Midnight Witch and Sisterhood, right here!!

Stretchgoals: scroll all the way down! :)

SISTERHOOD is a series of one-shot,  stand-alone stories. Each comic book will feature different artists, to ensure not only a high quality, but also creating a platform for  outstanding artists.

 

The story begins with Leona and Karmen arriving in Egypt in modern times. They are tricked by the Flow of Time and landed inside a pyramid. As they walk inside, they awaken ancient forces that attack them. Leona comes into conflict with the forces that attack her, while Karmen turns into an owl and seeks shelter somewhere in the pyramid. Leona ends up being captured and the villain reveals herself as an ancient Egyptian queen who felt the sands of time carried by Leona and knows that she could use them to restore her physical form and exercise her revenge against her enemies, the Sisterhood of Mummies.

 

If you wanna know more about the MIDNIGHT WITCH (even though you can read this crossover as standalone oneshot, as intended) then go to the project HERE which launched simultaneously. "But I do not wanna pay double shipping?" well, we got you covered here in this lovely video-update!

 
ISSUE ONE: the origin issue in which we saw the rising of the Sisterhood,  the  introduction of the Khepri god/computer and during a new adventure  Sisterhoods leader Rand is shown to share his mind with Dymonos!

ISSUE TWO:  High-priest Dymonos makes a heart-wrenching  discovery that not only lets him question his loyalty towards his master, the mighty god  Khepri, but also sets him on a path of righteous revenge and  destruction.

ISSUE THREE: Love & Betrayal in a solo-issues as Gwynn takes center stage and combats Nazi Werewolves in a fight till the death - all in ONE intense issue.

You can order all of these as an Add-On. Check FAQ and PM me if you want a complete collection.

small, right? See bigger below the interior teaser section!!

Below you can see some progress teasers, from pencils, to flatting to fully colored interiors! YES, they will look thát good!!

and now for real!!!!

Variants, in foil and metal covers and even 1 in Lenticular and 1 in Acetate version.

Regular Covers by Daniel HDR, Walmir Archanjo, Gary Parkin.

Special Wraparound Covers by Yonami Teles, 

Special double (back and front) by Brad Chavarria, Karra Art, David Gunawan

All covers can be found in regular, rainbow foil, or metal versions.

GARY PARKIN's cover can be in ACETATE even. And KARRA ART's can be found in LENTICULAR!

Acetate cover: underlying art by Gary Parkins (colors by Chris Hall)


Above the ACETATE cover in how it should look like :)

 

I cannot yet show you how the RAINBOW FOIL covers will look like in real life, since they have to be produced first, but I did produce some METAL covers before, which will be REAL METAL covers!! Check the video below!!

 

And you want to see how the Lenticular one looks like?

Check out this video!!

 

 Of course these are ALL the past and upcoming lenticular covers... but the "blue" one is the one you are getting now! Check from 00:16!!

A mockup of the NSFW Lenticular version by KARRA ART. See video for a better view > Check from 00:16!!

 

 

 

Regular items

  • Sisterhood #1, 2, 3, 4 >   digital versions
  • Sisterhood #4 will be in regular covers, FOIL cover and yes, Metal covers!
  • Sisterhood #4, cover A "battle "by Daniel HDR, colored by Chris Hall
  • Sisterhood #4, cover B "Split" by Walmir Archanjo
  • Sisterhood #4, cover C "Split Screen" by Gary Parkin, colored by Chris Hall
  • Sisterhood #4, cover D "Wraparound Night" by Yonami Teles, colored by Chris Hall
  • Sisterhood #4, cover E "Wraparound Day" by Yonami Teles, colored by Chris Hall
  • Sisterhood #4, cover F "Double Booty" by Brad Chavarria, colored by Chris Hall
  • Sisterhood #4, cover G "Flipping" by Karra Art on front and David Gunawan on back
  • Sisterhood #4, cover H "NSFW" by Karra Art on front and David Gunawan on back
  • Sisterhood #1 & #2 & #3, all cover versions > also via Add On available! And via the FULL SCORE level.
  • Sisterhood Artist Edition #1 > also via Add On available! Check visual "Collect Them All" below!

a cut-through of Sisterhood #1 covers

a cut-through of Sisterhood #2 covers

a cut-through of Sisterhood #3 covers

 

 

FUN STUFF:

  • 3D MOUSE PADS with art by Vinz El Tab, Budd Root (add-on for 20)
  • TUBE SCARF/BANDANA with art by Vinz El Tab (add-on for 10)
  • COIN: challenge coin (add-on for 10)
  • DISPLAY: for trading card lovers this is a must!!  (add-on for 10)
  • PIN: this is a pin I wanted to have... and offering it here. Art by Budd Root (add on for 10)

I used the scarf daily during this pandemic! And those 3D raised mousepads are the best :)

Just get these at checkout with the ADD-ON function! You can even go back after you already pledged and change your options!

 

 

 

ARTSY FARTSY STUFF:

  • RED Jewel Editions to #1, #2, and #3: separately and as set.
  • Original Art NOW commission by Eelco Koper
  • Original Art NOW commission by Brad Chavarria
  • Original Art NOW commission by Mike Jimmy Lortia de Bruin
  • Original Art: Interior Pages from #1 by Diego Loiola (check below and ask for a PDF)
  • Original Art: Interior Pages from #2 by Markus von Renthe-Fink (check below and ask for a PDF)
  • Original Art: Interior Pages from #3 by Vinz El Tabanas (check above and ask for a PDF)

 

Pledge first, then check via Facebook or BAD-website which page you want or request a PDF from me. DIBS via PM :)

Here you can get commissions, interior art and cover art!!

 

 INTERIOR ART ON SALE: 

Art shown here is pencils to Sisterhood #1, 2 or 3 aka interior art aka sequentials. Check tier/reward listing on the right for pricing.

Examples from Sisterhood #1.

Examples to #2

Interior samples to #3

 

 

Richard Boom (Project Leader/Creator) started out in the comic industry as your regular fanboy, just reading comics and enjoying it even more due to the internet and making contact with creators. As his contact list grew,  so did his interest in the complete field of comics. Starting up a Bad Grrl Comics Fan club in 2001 was the first step to go further then his own living  room. Soon thereafter he began setting up websites for Arthur Suydam, Eric Basaldua, Broadsword Comics, and focusing on titles like Vampirella,  Cavewoman, Hack/Slash and more... He even  started working with the FACTS comicon organization where he also met  the founder of Broken Frontier and shortly thereafter began doing headlines for this news site. Later he founded the website COMICSFORSINNERS which more resembles his prior BadGrrl fanclub. Nowadays Richard dabbles in Art Agency, sending out comic Press Releases and since 2019 publishing various comic books.

 

Yonami - Paulo Teles (AKA Yonami; Creator) is a Graphic Designer by  graduation and comic book artist for passion, works as manager for House 137 Studio and  along with his team has provided stories for publishers such as Stone Arch Books, Glyph Productions, Galaxy Graphix, Dynamite, Zenescope, Marvel and DC through the years. Today, the House 137 Studio got a partnership with the accessibility company All Geek and  created the All Geek Comics brand for publishing their books in Brazil.

 

Rodrigo "Rod" Monteiro (Writer) is a Brazilian writer who has been working in the comic business for the past nine years, being part of the Brazilian House 137 Studio since its foundation in 2015. Among his published material is "The Midnight Witch", "The Fairy Tales Unit" and "Undead  Nightmare". All of them are currently available (in English) at the  Webtoons website.

 

Cezar Razek (artist) is a Brazilian artist who has been working in the comic business for many years, with Battlestar Galactica over at Dynamite and also the inter-company crossover between TopCow and DE with Witchblade/Red Sonja. He has also worked on Stargate, Vampirella, Doc Savage, Dejah Thoris, Zorro, and many more!

 

Walmir Archanjo (cover artist) is a modest guy and a very committed professional with many published works such as the kid's book, the Whispering Peppers.

 

Brad Chavarria (Guest Artist + cover artist) fell in love with comics at about age 4.  "I was able to get a few sketch card gigs of Red Sonja,  Witchblade, Vampirella and Warlord of Mars, that gave me my first "pro"  work. It helped establish me and it gave me a sense of belonging in this  wonderful art community.

Now, I was offered this WONDERFUL opportunity by Richard Boom, who was  one of my "original" Crusade forum friends from about 2 decades ago, to  produce a cover for this Kickstarter event, of which I will be forever grateful."

story:
The Richart trading card comes with EVERY BOOK!

Get this badass Richart trading card with every book you get! One book? One card! FIVE books? FIVE CARDS! Phenomenal art from Sim Pothier (Bloodhunt, Tales from the Natverse) and brilliant colors from Eugen Betiv (Magic Cop 1, The Lost Pages)!

Get a book today and get not only the Richart card, but this 8" x 5.5" mini-print by Sim Pothier and colored by Michael Beacon free!

Grave Robbers is a fully colored 36-page graphic novel!

Grave Robbers: Welcome to Hell Hole is the first chapter in a wicked blend of gruesome horror and the classic western! Three bounty hunters with terrifying supernatural abilities hunt a satanic killer who has left a trail of mutilated bodies in his wake! Follow Big Dick Murphy as he leads Amanda Lynn and Waylon Lauder through blood, guts, and murder in this gore-slathered slaughterhouse!

Check out some INCREDIBLE pages and artwork below!

CLASSIC WESTERN COVER by Passion4Drawing

 

 

 

Grave Robbers Team:

Grave Robbers is written and lettered by Mark Middleton, with stunning pencils and ink by Passion4Drawing, and vibrantly colored by Eugen Betiv!

 

 

Big Dick Murphy: Leader of the Grave Robbers, was infected by a cursed Navajo witch called a Skinwalker while avenging the deaths of his wife and child, leaving him prone to bouts of rage that send him into his wolf form.

 

 

Amanda Lynn: the product of a botched vengeance pact between her pregnant mother a demon, Amanda was born with fangs, claws, and purple eyes.

 

 

Walyon Lauder: a ruthless, conniving outlaw who betrayed his posse during a bank robbery. With his dying breathe, an Apache shaman cursed to to be as dry as the desert, semi-mummifying him.

 

Richart: little is known about this fiend wrapped in bandages, but there are rumors that he has no soul and that decades ago, perhaps longer, he saw hell itself and came back scarred

 

 

Three bounty hunters with terrifying supernatural abilities hunt a satanic killer who has left a trail of mutilated bodies in his wake! But what else lies in the small mining town, creeping in the shadows and waiting to strike!? The parched town on the edge of the Arizona Territory is brimming with an evil that has never stained the hallowed grounds of our world and it is anxious to boil over! Follow Big Dick Murphy as he leads Amanda Lynn and Waylon Lauder through blood, guts, and murder in this gore-slathered slaughterhouse!

 

Stretch Goals!

$5000 - Richart Trading Card! - Achieved!!!

All backers will receive a Richart trading card with their books!

$6000 - Grave Robbers Skull Sticker! - Achieved!!!

All backers with receive a skull logo sticker with their books!

$6500 - Grave Robbers Soft Cover! - Achieved!!!

All books will have the soft touch cover!

$7000 - Amanda Lynn Art Print! -Achieved!!!

All backers with receive a 8" x 5.5" mini- print of the Amanda Lynn piece by Preston Asevedo and colored by Oliver Lee Arce!

Three bounty hunters with terrifying supernatural abilities hunt a satanic killer who has left a trail of mutilated bodies in his wake! story:
Shadow of the Kraken

 This is a tale about the darkness of man and the actions one takes to get back into the light.  A hunt for treasure and power, with betrayal looming around every corner. The fight for survival is palpable. This is a can't miss adventure!  The desire for freedom on the open seas awaits you!

****NOTE: This campaign is ONLY ON INDIEGOGO****

                                             50 pages of gorgeous art and story!
                                                All by Vinnie Tartamella
                                      (possibly more pages if we hit stretch goals!)
  **All sales are final. No refunds given, since the campaign is InDemand**














This book is set in the Caribbean during the 1700s. Nathaniel James Calin was once part of the Royal Navy. He then turned to piracy,  along with Anne Galway, a survivor in her own regard. Their crew is made up of mostly  freed slaves and other defectors from the Royal Navy. They are pursued by a ruthless and mysterious man with a vicious crew and a vindictive nature.. 

  • Expect action, Fierce sea battles, beautiful locations, and brutality! 
  • An intense story set during a very dangerous time in history!  
  • Rare treasures and deadly threats from above and below the waves! 


















    Vinnie Tartamella creator/artist/writer 
  • Creator/writer/artist of City of Venus: Dead City
  • Co-creator and artist for Through the Woods
  • Co-creator and artist for The Ghostly Manor on Howling Hill
  • Former Lead Designer for McFarlane toys. Toys Biz, Diamond Select, Randy Bowen. 
  • Cover artist for Image comics, Blue Water Comics, and other various companies.
  • Concept artists and independent comic book artist


      **All sales are final. No refunds given once we're InDemand**
    My other live campaigns:  *City of Venus and art books are on the same campaign*
    Through the Woods is a completed hardcover 98 page book! 

    These 4 books ship the same day or the next day!
    City of Venus: Dead City http://igg.me/at/cityofvenus
    Through the Woods Hardcover http://igg.me/at/ttwc

 

If you can't contribute, please get the word out:

  • Tell your family and friends about this campaign/comic book project!
  • Share and retweet this campaign out on social media!

story:
Hi, everyone!

It's our very first time here, and we're excited to bring you Fairy Quest, our all-ages graphic novel series. Thanks to some good friends (including Billy Tucci, Brian Pulido, Dan Fraga and many others) running successful Indiegogo campaigns and waxing lyrical about how awesome you are, we honestly can't believe we hadn't come here before... so, let's remedy that right now! We hear there are lots of loyal backers who come to Indiegogo exclusively and we want to make sure everyone has a chance to read our series and love our books. Why Fairy Quest? Well, for one thing it looks like this:

There are currently about 100 pages of that goodness, and we are writing and drawing 48 more pages of it for book 3.  You can see more about the story further down.

So, what about us - who are "we?" Well, I'm Paul Jenkins, the Eisner Award-Winning writer behind Fairy Quest. META Studios, my company, is Atlanta's only cross-media development and production house. Highlights of my career include creating Wolverine: Origin for Marvel as well as The Sentry. I also did a 6-year run on Spider-Man, I've written Hulk, Batman, Avengers, Captain America... pretty much every major character there is... and I just happen to love comics. I started my career with the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and independent, creator-owned comics have always been my true love. I'm thrilled that crowdfunding allows us the chance to bring you the books you actually want, presented as a true collaboration between the fans and the creator. You guys are our publishers, and I truly appreciate that relationship. Creators should be able to give you what you ask for, not just react to some big marketing plan or crossover event.

The true talent is in our many amazing artists that have worked on Fairy Quest so far. Humberto Ramos is one of the world's most recognizable comic creators - he and I started Fairy Quest along with Leonardo Olea, our fantabulous colorist. We're now lucky enough to bring on the incredible Mike Bowden for the new chapter, but dang... we also have the most brilliant group of cover artists as well.  We have three special covers by Ale Garza, Limited Exclusive covers by Kevin Eastman (co-creator of the Ninja Turtles), my old mate, Billy Tucci (author, Shi) and a beautiful additional cover by the wonderful Jill Thompson! We can't wait to show you all of that stuff as we go along.

We wanted to make sure there are some Indiegogo exclusives as well - check out our T-Shirt, which is only available here. We have a really beautiful print by one of the best people alive: Jennifer L. Meyer (check out her many bunnies on Twitter if you want to put yourself in a good mood). And as you would expect, we really want to bring out some stretch goals and give away free stuff, so hang onto that thought as I tell you about our story...

We'll show you a ton more art as we go along, including finished art and cover sketches, as well as behind-the-scenes work. In short, we really want to make this a cool, easy, unforgettable project for everyone. To jazz you up a little more, here are a few of the cover images:

Main cover to Fairy Quest #3 by Humberto Ramos and Leo Olea



New Variant cover to Fairy Quest #3 by Mike Bowden and Leo Olea




Variant Cover to Fairy Quest #2 by Billy Tucci


Variant Cover for Fairy Quest #1 by Alé Garza


So, let me say a special THANK YOU to all current and future Fablewood fans. We know we are making a book that you can pass down to many future generations of your family. As we go, we will always be here to answer any questions on the message board or at our email address: fairyquesthelp@gmail.com. If you have any ideas, questions, problems (heaven forbid!) or just want to shoot the breeze, please write to us in either place and our crack team of email ninjas will get right back to you.

Let's build this thing together!

QUALITY

Quite aside from the story and art, we want to make sure our book is of the highest quality; a prized possession that we can all keep in our bookshelves for many years to come, which can be passed down to future generations. Check out the embossing and spot UV varnish! 


WHAT ARE SOME OF THE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PROJECT?

Yeah, we know: there are always risks. But check out our handy-dandy little chart below. We are always available to answer questions if you have anything specific. Plus, there are the FAQ's if you're not already bored of all the nuts and bolts stuff. I mean who doesn't love FAQ's?*

*Answer: pretty much everyone except the person who invented them.

 

CONTACT US

We want to make ourselves as accessible as possible so that we can answer your questions and help you with any issues that might arise. Primarily, we'll do this by messaging here, and in the comments section of our updates. For this raise, no outside party will be allowed to work directly with fans - we have learned to our cost in the past that if you want something done right, you must do it yourself. We've also created Facebook page for all of our Fablefans, where you can come and hang out, ask questions, chat with us and see all of our latest updates. We'll listen to your ideas as well, so that stretch goals and ideas for the book enhancements can come from you.

For additional help, we can also be reached at fairyquesthelp@gmail.com.

story:
PRESENTS

"a Sam Glanzman tour de force."

–Comic Book Resources

 

Welcome to the campaign from IT'S ALIVE! to publish Air War Stories #3!  Each issue of Air War Stories focuses on aerial war battles from the last hundred years, illustrated brilliantly by comic book legend, World War II vet, and Eisner Award-nominee, Sam Glanzman! This issue features: "Want Out?" (WW1), "I, Bomb" (WW2), "To the End" (Korean War), and "Dead Man's Dream" (WW2). Also included are essays about Sam Glanzman, original covers, vintage advertisements, and more!  Here is the standard cover, along with the variant cover.  Please note that there will only be 100 printed of the variant cover, and it is only available from this campaign!

 

AIR WAR STORIES #3 (standard cover)

 

AIR WAR STORIES #3 (variant cover)

LIMITED TO 100 COPIES!

 

If you missed the campaigns for the first two issues of Air War Stories, they are also available from this campaign.  Here are the covers:

 

AIR WAR STORIES #1

AIR WAR STORIES #1 (variant cover)

LIMITED TO 100 COPIES!

 

AIR WAR STORIES #2

AIR WAR STORIES #2 (variant cover)

LIMITED TO 100 COPIES!

 

Don't miss what Atomic Avenue had to say about Air War Stories, "Since DC Comics cornered the market on war comics for most of the time that they were popular, it's easy to forget that many other publishers had war titles that were often on par –and occasionally superior to–anything DC had to offer. Case in point in this Dell title, an anthology focusing on combat in the skies. During its run in the 1960s, Air War Stories delivered excitement and moral tales (often with a twist) set throughout the history of air war from World World I to the Cold War era in which it was published.  The series is notable for the regular contributions of artist Sam Glanzman."

This comic book series was originally published by Dell in the early 1960s.  As such, the original films are not available, and we had to scan directly from the original 50+ year old, yellowed comic book pages. Therefore, each page of this comic has been expertly restored by the brilliant Allan Harvey, to give reader's the best possible presentation of Sam Glanzman's  incredible artwork.  Below are three restoration samples from Air War Stories #3, to give everyone a better idea what this book will look like upon publication.  We hope you will consider baking this campaign, and spreading the word to your family and friends, helping us to continue bringing more of Sam Glanzman's best work back into print.  Thank you for your help and  support!

 

 

 

 

As many of you know, I have worked very hard for several years to bring the incredible work of comic book master Sam Glanzman back into print.  Collections I have edited and/or published include A Sailor's Story, U.S.S. Stevens: The Collected Stories, ATTU, Red Range: A Wild Western Adventure (with Joe R. Lansdale), Voyage to the Deep, and (coming soon) The Lonely War of Capt. Willy Schultz (with Will Franz). We were even lucky enough to receive an Eisner Award nomination for the U.S.S. Stevens collection by Glanzman that I edited, which contains true stories about his time serving in the Pacific Theater during WWII.  But aside from his USS Stevens comics, AIR WAR STORIES might just contain some of the best war comics that Glanzman ever illustrated.  I can't wait to get another issue of AIR WAR STORIES back into print for both long time fans to enjoy, and a whole new generation to discover!  Your support will ensure this incredible -and historically important- comic book series lives on for years to come!

#SamGlanzmanForever

#LongLiveComics

story:
STW #1

THE LOW DOWN:

Written and Illustrated by Tonicmole

STW short by guest artist Jim Lawson

100 pages of story

Black and white interiors because I’m fancy like that

5.5X8.5 Pocket sized format

Saving the World follows the adventures of Kierra and Nora as they struggle to balance their new found super powers and normal crappy lives. Just because the world needs saved don’t mean the bills don’t need paid!

Saving the World #2

 WHAT IS STW:

Saving the World is an ongoing comic book series that combines the action of super hero comics with the comedy, and subversive style and sensibilities of alternative comix of the 90's.  STW is brainless entertainment....with a brain? Something like that.   

Saving the World #3

 WHAT YOU GET:

STW Vol. 1 collects the first 3 issues in a 100 page perfect bound ’manga sized’ format. (technically a little bigger, but you get the idea.)  However, if the campaign reaches the top stretch goals it will expand to all four current issues, and the spin-off Lilly & Wepwawet for a whopping 164 pages! However, let’s not get ahead of ourselves!

STW #1

STW #3

Cover art of STW Volume #1 by Tonicmole

STRETCHGOALS:

Currently STW Volume One covers issues 1-3, however if we reach $3,000 I’ll add Saving the World #4. If we reach $4,000 I’ll also add the spin-off Lilly and Wepwawet for an astounding 164 Pages!!!

Saving the World #4

Lilly & Wepwawet

BUY OUR COMIX PLEASE!

This is part where I beg you to buy my comix! Please buy my comix. I don't wanna have to get a real job, because they suck. I promise you only the highest quality literature. All I ask of you is money. Not a lot. Just roughly $35. Heck, you don't even have to leave your house!!! I'll ship it direct to your doorstep! You can't beat that! Okay....that's enough of that. Thanks for stopping by!

story:
STRETCH GOALS

 

Amanda Conner is one of the industry's most celebrated artists.

The road to get to that position took a major turn 25 years ago when she first drew Vampirella, and now she's returning to the heroine for an exclusive new release!

Amanda Conner is known across the comics community and further for her fan-favorite writing and art on titles like Harley Quinn, Power Girl, Before Watchmen, and more. In 1996, after a period being typecast as an artist for comics oriented to young children, Conner became the lead artist for Vampirella at the height of the "bad girl" trend. She capped off Tom Sniegoski's beloved run by concluding the original Vengeance of Vampirella series and the hyped-up death of the character. Chronicling the expected resurrection and proceeding blockbuster relaunch, Amanda became to many the next definitive artist of the character at the time, following Jose Gonzalez from decades prior. Returning for covers and occasional stories through the Harris era, she cemented that legacy.

Despite frequent working with the publisher, Amanda had not drawn a Vampirella cover for Dynamite until January's Vampirella #7. With that one down, and anxious for more, now she's back with another to celebrate the character's 50th anniversary, exclusively delivered directly to fans via crowdfunding. But more than that, Dynamite is assembling a unique package for fans to really celebrate her legacy.

This new cover is featured on an all-new reprint of two classic Vampirella stories illustrated by Amanda Conner 

Amanda started her work on Vampirella with Harris Comics in the 1990's and this book collects two of her most memorable stories from that era with "Vampirella: New Monthly #1" (1997) and the "Vampirella Halloween Special" (2004).  The Vampirella New Monthly #1 features a chilling story by the dynamic duo of Grant Morrison and Mark Millar and beautiful art by Amanda with inking by Jimmy Palmiotti.  It's a true Vampirella classic represented here 24 years after its original publication!  The Vampirella Halloween Special features story and art by Amanda Conner and Jimmy Palmiotti!  These stories are must have tales from Vampirella's long and elustrous life in comics!

ALSO AVAILABLE ....

story:
Welcome to the Ultraluminals Universe!

Hello! My name is Gisele and I've been in the comic book business for roughly 2 decades. I've done interiors and/or cover work for Dynamite, Udon, IDW, Archie Comics and Marvel. I've also created many webcomics over the years, Ménage à 3 being the most popular one. Since 2009, I've been publishing creator-owned work under my publishing company, Pixie Trix Comix. In the last 3 years or so, my collaborators and I started building this superhero universe, and have created 5 series in this universe:

  • Ultraluminals (the superhero team of the universe)
  • Incredibelle
  • Nightgale
  • Infernica Sinn
  • Carmen Chamelia

In previous crowdfunding campaigns, focused on my webcomic series, we were able to fund a few comic book issues in this universe via stretch goals. With that said, we never did a true campaign for these properties. I'm hoping this campaign brings more attention to them. Ideally, each property would get its own campaign, but to simplify things for myself here, I'm starting with a combined campaign. Any future issues for each series will get its own campaign in the future.

Where Will the Funds Go?

Since we've already gotten SOME funds via stretch goals in a very recent crowdfunding campaign for my Pixie Trix Comix webcomic series (yes, I use the publishing name for a webcomic series as well, sort of like Archie prints Archie!) we're not asking for much funds here. This campaign is more to supplement our current funds, and we're hoping that if it does well here, we can immediately start work on more issues. For now, the funds will help with the production and printing costs of these comic book issues:

  • Ultraluminals Issue #2 (Issue #1 included in this campaign)
  • Infernica Sinn Issue #1
  • Incredibelle: Galactic Delights One-Shot #2 (one-shot #1 available in this campaign)
  • Carmen Chamelia: Bio(nique) Hazard One-Shot #4 (one-shot 1 to 3 available as well)

NOTE: All our comics are your regular sized saddle-stitched full color comics.

Now About These Comic Book Series...

Preview Pages

From Ultraluminals Issue #1...

From Infernica Sinn Issue #1...

From Nightgale:Learning Curves One-Shot #1...

From Incredibelle One-Shot #1...

From Carmen Chamelia One-Shot #1...

Pixie Trix Comix books also available as add-ons!

Risks & Challenges

Pixie Trix Comix is no stranger to making books. We have over 35 books in print. Shipping should start mid December 2021. We might experience delays, but we'll keep you posted. We've done six crowdfunding campaigns over at Kickstarter in the past, and each has been 100% fulfilled. Pixie Trix Comix is not responsible for import/duty fees your home country may charge. (We haven't had any reports from backers so far, but we can't assure you 100% that it won't happen).

story:
MAGIC COP! Now Shipping to Order!

A 90+ page fully colored Graphic Novel drawn by Brandon Diaz and written by Phillip Diaz.
Based in a world that mashes 1980s Miami Vice with the magic and monsters of Halloween!
This time the team is cracking down on the new Pixie Dust drug ring!

Paired with our new ASHCAN with behind the scenes material and a 12 page short story telling the tale of Greywulf's hunt for revenge! illustrated by Allen Alonzo.
ATTENTION:  SIM OHARA SKETCH CARDS SOLD OUT!

Cover by Pablo Romero!

32oz MAGIC CUP by Allen Alonzo! Add it on to any purchase!

Interior pages by Brandon Diaz




A new strain of the drug Pixie Dust is turning criminals into wizards!

The Big Bad, Arsenic Jones uses Pixie Dust as magical steroids !


The Headless Hitman is gunning for the cops!

Iggy Cromwell, the Magic Cop and his team of detectives investigate the new magical drug, Pixie Dust, after junkies start getting powers from the white glowing powder. When drug lord Arsenic Jones finds out his plans may be foiled, he hires The Headless Hitman to take out these cops for good!

Get Ready for the GREYWULF ASHCAN!

With making of, behind the scenes material, plus a 12 page short story where Detective Greywulf goes above the law to seek revenge on a new criminal. 80s Steven Seagal meets Bruce lee's Game of death. Art by Allen Alonzo!


Missed MAGIC COP 1?

Grab the Reprint Cover by KELSEY SHANNON! 
Magic cop 1 is where it all started (92 pages)

NEW MERCH!

Add-on handmade wall scroll


Magic Cup Foldable poster in every Ashcan Perk.
100 Backers- Headless Hitman track MP3 by Vosto Vlad
8k- Magic Wand book mark by Adam Michaels
10k- Arsenic Jones trading card by Preston Asevedo
13k- Fan Art section in the Greywulf ASHCAN
15k-EJ Morges Trading Card



19k- Headless Hitman BLOCKHED UNLOCKED!



 


 

Phillip Diaz: Writer
Brandon Diaz: Artist
Eugeniu Betivu: Colorist
Pablo Romero: Cover Artist
Allen Alonzo: Artist and Colorist of Ashcan
Kelsey Shannon: Cover artist of MC1 Reprint

story:
The Technonaut Revolution

Greeting fans!  The Technonaut Revolution is a high fantasy, industrial punk setting, with cosmic horror leanings, that follows The Pax Anti Daemus.  This is an elite investigation unit charged with hunting down and destroying demons on the mythical world of Ieo.  Think "Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow," but with magic.  A 1930-1940 'art deco' theme, classic dark noir style, not entirely unlike Film Noir, but with wizards, monsters, and demons.

This is a world where magic and enchantments have become common, taking the place of technology and stunting social progress.  The story (originally published through Madness Heart Press) surrounds the massive city-state of Cordoba.  Inside the walls of Cordoba, the citizens live in fantastic plenty.  Outside the walls, the non-citizens live in abject squalor.  Here, a new unit of the Pax has been formed to investigate a possible lycanthrope.  This would normally be a simple job for the Pax, but through this they uncover an otherworldly conspiracy.

The serial is already up to its 9th issue, but we think it deserves to be a comic!  If successful, we will do a full run of the entire serial, which looks like it will top out at 20-25 issues.  Finally, we plan to do the whole thing eventually as a graphic novel.

But to get there WE NEED YOU!!!  As you can tell from the video, we tried Kickstarter and failed to reach our goal.  SO!... We are starting over here on Indiegogo.  Please consider being a contributor. Many thanks for your support! 

~Reed Alexander

 

Who is Reed Alexander?

I'm a horror writer from the Capital Region, NY.  My writings deal in the horrific, bizarre, and macabre.

The Technonaut Revolution is the first thing I wrote that is purposefully, and specifically for the LGTBQAI community.  In fact, the serial has been free and open to trans and nonbinary individuals.

For this serial, I made two promises which I've carried through my writing career as a whole.

1) I will always fight to be as inclusive as possible with my writing. Real life is a diverse place and I have made a commitment to representing the true diversity of our world. My stories will always include individuals of a diverse cast of ethnicity, nationality, sexuality, gender, and disability. I aim for full and proper representation of all people including the LGTBQAI.

2) I will do everything in my power to assure these groups are represented properly by working with advocates from these communities.

The Technonaut Revolution has been an extremely important project to me as it deeply involves social issues I hold very dear.  These are issues of equality, both social, and economic.  Most importantly, I wanted to give all my LGTBQAI friends something that was specifically theirs, and theirs alone.  I'm openly Pansexual, and I wanted this serial to properly represent me, as well as all of my friends, in a way they could be proud.

Even if you just sling me a dollar for this project, it means the world to me.  It validates me as a person and as an artist.  It might just be one dollar, but to me, it's everything.

~Reed Alexander

 

What We Need

Our first major hurdle is paying the artist.  The current price tag is $2200, at $100 for 22 pages of pencil, ink, and lettering.

I'm also budgeting $200 for the cover art in full color and $100 for two full pages of art. 

We'll also need about $300 for printing services and another $300 for shipping/handling globally

I've already paid out about $300 for test pages and rough drafts.

In total: I'm asking for a modest $3000 which might just about break me even if I'm lucky.

 

Contributor Reward!

For the minimum contribution of $5, you will get a first-run Issue #1 of The Technonaut Revolution.

For the contribution of $10, you will get a first-run Issue #1 of The Technonaut Revolution, signed by both me and the artist.

For the contribution of $20, you will get a first run, Issue #1, signed by me and the artist, and your name immortalized on the "contributor's page" (300 spots available)

Add on a character sketch of one of 9 characters for $30 (of the 300 spots available).  They will be randomly distributed and some will be rarer than others.

Add on a T-Shirt for only $20!  Check out that logo!

Looks out for other contributor levels as they pop up and check in regularly for new development in the comments!

Already the arist is working on the first test page!

 

Your Impact

This comic is happening, and with your help, it will be a reality.  You can help me make something that creates visibility and fair representation to individuals from all walks of life, but most importantly the LGTBQAI

If you can't contribute, no big deal.  Share this on your Mastodon, Discord, Twitter, and Facebook.  Head to The Technonaut Revolution on Facebook and Twitter, and follow us.

 

Again, my sincerest thanks.

~Reed Alexander

story:
Six friends clad in Denim, Leather, Spandex and Attitude, infused with some Camo wearing, armed to the teeth misfit military motor heads.

 

 

SACTO, CALIFORNIA 1982

Mikey & Carlos are two bad-ass Rattle heads stoked for a wild weekend with their Righteously Bitchin Babes (Dee & Maria) and best buds (Brian & Rocky) at the Celtica heavy metal concert. Unfortunately for these thrashers, all hell breaks loose when strange, glowing spheres crash land in the middle of the mosh pit! It’s up to these Headbangers to not only stay alive, but save Sacto from the merciless onslaught of the otherworldly invaders.

Meanwhile, at McMaster Army Depot, Sgt. Lee and his team of Misfit grease monkeys (CPL Harris, SPC Peterson and PFC’s Meredith, Stanfield & Wahlberg) are looking forward to 48 hours of freedom from the motor pool. When the world set afire as the Alien invasion lays waste to the Depot. Now they're looking forward to inflicting a whole lot of payback.

 

 

 

Issue #1 

Johnstone, Pares, Ybanez and Powers

Details the first hours of the invasion as our Headbangers Mikey, Dee, Carlos, Maria, Brian and Rocky evade the threat and try to wrap their minds around what the hell is happening.

Issue #2   

Johnstone, Valdez, Ybanez and Powers

Introduces a team of grease monkeys from Mc Masters Army Depot as they assemble to search for survivors and the continuing story of our Headbangers fight to survive.

 


 

Thrashers #1 : This book is complete and has been printed 
Thrashers #2  All the Line-Art is finished, it is 3/4 colored and 2/3 lettered. 
Shipping in October 2020
Shipping included for all US backers.

 

UPDATE: ALL BACKERS AT THE BACKSTAGE PASS LEVEL WILL RECIEVE A ORIGINAL DRAWING BY ILLUSTRATOR MONK. 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

By working with a collective of creators who have successfully crowdfunded their own projects in the past, we have a support system that will help us avoid some of the missteps other first-time campaigns encounter.

FUNDING: We are looking to raise $500

 STRETCH GOALS 

$750     :  Sexy 11x17 Poster by Paul Kets & Sexy 11x17 Poster by Illustrator Monk

$1,000  :  Coming Soon

$1,250  :  Coming Soon

story:
Chip Mosher and Peter Krause invite you to crowdfund BLACKING OUT!

A Tale of Fire and Murder in Southern California presented as a Deluxe Oversized Hardcover.

BLACKING OUT follows a drunk ex-cop looking for redemption as he attempts to solve a murder during the Southern California fire season.

Comics industry veteran and writer Chip Mosher and legendary artist Peter Krause (The Power of Shazam!, Irredeemable) present BLACKING OUT, a 56-page graphic novel presented in a deluxe oversized hardcover in the European album tradition. BLACKING OUT also showcases the amazing talents of colorist Giulia Brusco (Scalped, Django Unchained), letterer Ed Dukeshire (Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Mighty Morphin Power Rangers), and designer Tom Muller (X-Men) .

Rewards include a print Lobby Card set from acclaimed artists Francesco Francavilla, Eduardo Risso, Jamal Igle, Emma Ríos, Mirka Andolfo, Jacob Phillips, Dan Panosian, Ryan Kelly, Patric Reynolds, Elise McCall, and Peter Krause. 

Bottom line for backers: 

9/1/2021 - UPDATE

Well, that's all folks. If you missed getting the book here, then come find us at conventions to purchase one or contact these local comic shops that supported us at the retail level and may still have a copy or two left -- Comic VS Toys in US, The Dragon in Canada or Traveling Man in the UK. The last five orders go out this week and we're focused on our next release. More about that later!  Thanks, as always, for your support!

 

6/23/2021 - UPDATE

As of this date, we have 62 copies of the book left. We continue to send orders out every week. We're going to continue to leave this open for a bit and see how it goes.  Thanks for your support!

 

4/5/2021 - UPDATE

As of this date, we have 68 copies of the book left. We continue to send orders out every week. Given that we've sold 14 copies in a month, we're going to leave this open for a bit and see how it goes.  Thanks for your support!

3/17/2021 - UPDATE

As of today, we have 82 copies of the book left. We continue to send orders out every week. We're going to try and sell through this entire set by the end of March. At that point, we'll most likely call it a day and hang up this project to focus on the next one.

2/22/2021 - UPDATE

With fulfillment basically done for all backers on Kickstarter and IGG, we've decided to offer the last 100 copies for sale of the book. So for those that missed this the first time, these are the last 100 copies of the print run of 1,000. Pete and I have ~100 some copies stashed away, but those will only be sold at shows or maybe as a special incentive for future crowdfunding. So basically what i'm saying... when these are gone. They are basically gone.

We'll look to ship these out within 30 days or less from your order.

8/1/2020 - UPDATE:

We've basically closed up shop so we can focus on fulfillment of orders in hand. If you still want a hardcover copy of the book, we are making that available for a premium price as these will come out of the limited supply of overprints we do. All the other tiers are printed to order and are in process. 

The graphic novel is complete and we have met our crowdfunding goal on another platform and are giving IndieGogo community a chance to get their hands on this book. A digital version of the book will be sent to you when the IndieGogo is complete!  Every tier with a reward will get the book! With the exception of the retailer tier, every tier 50 bucks or more will get the printed signed and numbered book, the main Lobby Card set, the digital bundle and the unlocked stretch goals. Higher priced tiers get more!  We unlocked up through the $40K stretch goal and are excited to unlock more... see below!

Table of Contents:

     What's The Story...?  

     Why The Oversized Hardcover Format?

     Digital Rewards

     Lobby Cards 

     Stretch Goals

     A Word About Shipping

     Creative Team

What's The Story...?  

Chip and Peter discuss Peter's contribution in detail during this special video shot a month after the main one, as Pete was not able to make it to Los Angeles.

 

 
 

Disgraced ex-cop, Conrad, seeks redemption by unraveling an unsolved murder during Southern California's fire season. Connie follows a lone clue—a discarded crucifix—to unravel the death of Karen Littleton, whose body was found amid a blaze that scorched 10,000 acres. The search leads Connie to clash with the victim's father and prime suspect, Robert Littleton, as well as hostile former colleagues on the local police force. All the while, Conrad combats his consuming alcoholism and fading faculties.

We're confident that you'll love this book as much as we do. But why take our word for it? 

  •  “Blacking Out is as dark as the smoky California skies that fill its pages. And like smoke, this noir clings to you. Redemptive, surprising, & bleak.” - Brian Azzarello, 100 Bullets, Moonshine 

 

  •  “A tasty comics noir for your lockdown reading. A fast-paced page turner that really delivers.” - Derf Backderf, My Friend Dahmer, Kent State 

 

  •  “A compelling story that moves like a rocket and artwork that’s stunning. When is award season, again?” - Mark Waid, Kingdom Come, Irredeemable 

​

  •  “Start with the inky atmospheric drawings. Take the narrative familiars: bad cop seeking redemption, small town with big secrets, people wanting what they can’t have. Toss them in the spin cycle.” - Betsy Willeford

 

  • Blacking Out, by Mosher and Krause, is a lovely fire-scorched brick to the head, in the Sweaty Noir tradition of Hell or High Water and Dragged Across Concrete. It takes place in one of the tired old ‘boom that went bust’ desert towns of the American heartland (California in this case) where it’s always 110 degrees in the shade, and most of the heart died long ago. There’s a murder that needs to be solved before all are forced to evacuate from the wild fires moving in on the town. It’s the fiction of regret, guilt and disenchantment, lacking any hint of fantasy, and even much in the way of kindness. If you liked Left On Mission, you already know no one does this kind of hardscrabble tale better. It’s the story of a fallen cop, taking his one last boozy shot at redemption, and did I mention it’s very good? - Bill Willingham, Fables

 

Why the oversized hardcover format?

Having the privilege to attend the Angoulême International Comics Festival in France this past decade, writer and co-creator Chip Mosher has not only fallen in love with the oversized European hardcover format (~12.5" x 9.5"), but also the creative aesthetic of what the French call bande dessinée or BD. Whereas American comics release on a monthly basis and demand tight deadlines, the standard 48 page BD album is drawn over 6 months or longer, allowing the creators to spread their wings and put their best work forward. 

 

  •  “Blacking Out is a hard drinking, hard boiled mystery with a finale that lands like a ton of bricks—do not miss it.”  - Gerry Duggan, Dead Eyes, Deadpool, Marauders 

 

With this approach in mind, co-creator and artist Peter Krause worked on BLACKING OUT over several years, toiling over each page to create a tight 56-page graphic novel. (Note: Chip needed some extra pages, so not keeping it to the standard French 48-page standard is his fault! - Pete.) Working "Marvel-style" (the writer providing the artist a script with no panel breakdowns), Peter was able to exercise complete artistic control over the pacing of the story, a rarity in American comics. Chip then followed with a final lettering draft after Peter finished drawing all of the pages. This creative process ensured a deep collaboration between writer and artist... true co-creators in every sense.

 

  •  "Blacking Out is a taut, nasty thriller about people you don't want to know, but will love watching. The slow burn (pun intended) leads to a gut punch that will leave you reeling. Well-done.” -Marc Andreyko, Supergirl, Manhunter, Torso 

 

Ed Dukeshire then lettered the project with Scalped alumnus Giulia Brusco providing colors. Finally, Tom Muller designed the logo and the cover, working directly with Peter. In the spirit of the project, each contributor was guaranteed as much time needed to provide their best work.

In total, the team spent more than three full years creating this graphic novel. No expense was spared, no shortcuts were taken. This graphic novel was crafted without compromise; an unrushed, immaculately sculpted book with few peers. 

(Letterer Ed Dukeshire crafted hand-drawn, custom balloons and manipulated fonts for word mood and emphasis.) 

 

  • “Hardcore characters in search for what they can’t name on a road they shouldn’t travel. A gut punch of crime fiction by Mosher and Krause.” -Gary Phillips, The Be-Bop Barbarians 

​

(Giulia Brusco's amazing color work on one of Chip and Peter's favorite pages.)

 

  •  “The writing is sharp like a razor, the sort of sharp that you don’t feel when it cuts you. It’s only when you see the blood begin to pool that you realize that you’re reading a really good book.” - Shannon Wheeler, Too Much Coffee Man, The New Yorker 

 

Digital Rewards

With the book completed, a PDF of BLACKING OUT will be immediately available to those who backed tiers including a digital copy of the book; all backers who receive any digital reward will immediately be able to read BLACKING OUT as soon as the IndieGoGo complete.

There are two additional digital items available: the Blacking Out Photo Reference PDF and a PDF of Chip's previous graphic novel, Left On Mission, co-created and drawn by Francesco Francavilla.

While writing BLACKING OUT, Chip Mosher took numerous pictures to serve as inspiration for the book. Traveling around Southern California, Chip took pictures of active forest fires in and outside Los Angeles and he then created collages of places that he imagined would serve as the setting for BLACKING OUT. This PDF served as inspiration for the art and coloring of the final work.

As a special bonus, Chip Mosher’s previous graphic novel with co-creator Francesco Francavilla, Left On Mission —which debuted in 2008, and is currently OOP — is included digitally within certain most tiers. Left On Mission recently reverted to co-creators Chip and Francesco, who are excited to get this critically acclaimed, but little seen, work in the hands of more people. 

Chip and Peter wish to thank Francesco for letting them include Left On Mission as part of this crowdfunding campaign.

The Lobby Cards

The BLACKING OUT crowdfunding campaign allows Chip and Peter to celebrate the traditions of film noir by offering 12 cinematic lobby cards from today's most acclaimed artists, with a special card drawn by Peter himself. Lobby cards are miniature movie posters used to promote films in the lobbies of theaters in Hollywood's golden era. Noir films historically offered some of the most vivid imagery of the medium, inspiring this reward tier. Chip and Peter reached out to some of today's greatest comic artists to provide their interpretations of scenes within BLACKING OUT. These artists include:

Francesco Francavilla (Afterlife with Archie), Eduardo Risso (Moonshine), Mirka Andolfo (Mercy), Dan Panosian (Slots), Emma Ríos (Pretty Deadly), Jacob Phillips (That Texas Blood), Patric Reynolds (The Mask), Ryan Kelly (Saucer Country), Jamal Igle (The Wrong Earth), Elise McCall (Spy Island) and Peter Krause.

 Our lobby cards will be a smidge smaller than the book (~12.5" x 9.5").

Each lobby card will be printed on card stock and sized to ship within the book to ensure delivery in perfect condition. Additionally, backers can opt for a tier of "naked" versions of the lobby cards, sans any kind of BLACKING OUT branding. This tier includes a special card drawn by Peter Krause and colored by Jacob Phillips.

(UNLOCKED $29K Stretch Goal additional "Robert Fawcett inspired" Lobby Card by Peter Krause.)

(The "rarest" Lobby Card by Peter Krause with colors by Jacob Phillips! Only available to those pledging "NAKED" LOBBY CARDS + 1” $200 tier and the "LIVE AND NAKED" $300 tier.)

 

Stretch Goals

We originally wrote: "Maybe we can add some bells and whistles to the book, but for now, we’re happy to let this smolder." And it has. So as a special thanks, we're adding these Stretch Goals:

STRETCH GOALS: Every backer of the $50 or more will receive these rewards once they are unlocked!

  • UNLOCKED: $29K - Digital Wallpaper + Robert Fawcett inspired additional Lobby Card by Peter Krause.  
  • UNLOCKED: $30K—Bookmark Ribbon
  • UNLOCKED $32K—Gilded Pages
  • UNLOCKED $35K—Sticker of Francesco Francavilla's Lobby Card. Gonna be smoking hot!

(STRETCH GOAL: $35K— Sticker of Francesco Francavilla's Lobby Card.)

  • UNLOCKED $40K—First Exploratory Piece drawn by Peter Krause & Colored by Jacob Phillips (See below). Those getting the "Naked" tier will  get this undressed version too!
  • $50K – Pin of the Blacking Out logo (See below)
  • $60K – Pin of Blacking Out logo—black-light edition (See below)

(STRETCH GOAL: $40K - First Exploratory Piece drawn by Peter Krause & Colored by Jacob Phillips. Those getting the "Naked" tier will get this undressed version.)

Blacking Out Pins - Regular (top ) & black-light edition (bottom)

  • “Blacking Out is not a romance.” - Kim Krizan, Before Sunrise

A Word about Shipping

We've cut this to the bone for a HC oversize book that is relatively heavy. (See size comparison below.) We are planning to ship media mail domestically and USPS First Class for all international. We look to provide each backer with a shipping confirmation email with tracking. 

(Check it out! Standard US comic/trade size vs BD album. It goes without saying... this book is going to be massively cool!)

The Creative Team

Chip Mosher

Chip Mosher currently serves as Head of Content for comiXology, overseeing the comiXology Originals line of exclusive content. In its first year, comiXology Originals garnered an Eisner Award for Harvey Kurtzman’s Marley’s Ghost. For the past 9 years at comiXology, Mosher has worn a variety of hats in the marketing, communications, and business development departments. Previously, Mosher ran BOOM! Studios’ marketing department, helping catapult the company into a top 10 direct market publisher.  During his tenure, Mosher brought home BOOM!'s first Eisner win by acquiring and editing Shannon Wheeler's cartoon collection I Thought You Would Be Funnier. In 2007, Mosher co-created the comic book Left On Mission with Francesco Francavilla.

Peter Krause

Peter Krause has worked as an artist in comics for over 30 years. Past credits include Power of Shazam!, Metropolis S.C.U., and Star Trek: The Next Generation—all for DC Comics. His work with writer Mark Waid on Irredeemable (BOOM! Studios) and Daredevil: Road Warrior (Marvel Comics) garnered several Eisner nominations.  Most recently, he helped reimagine the Archie gang as teens during World War ll in Archie: 1941, and drew the adventures of two disparate superhero universes in Dragonfly and Dragonman for Ahoy Comics.

Giulia Brusco

Giulia Brusco is Italian and lives in London. She has colored comic books since 2000, working on titles such as Scalped, Django Unchained, and The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo. 

Ed Dukeshire

Ed Dukeshire is the founder of Digital Webbing and co-creator of Fist of Justice. He's a Harvey nominated letterer currently working for BOOM! Studios and indie creators.

Tom Muller

Tom Muller's work across graphic, digital, brand, and product design is informed by Modernist principles infused with a contemporary design sensibility that blurs the boundaries between creative disciplines—delivering design that is relevant, resonates, and inspires its audience—winning him global recognition as an industry leader in his field.
story_txt:
Chip Mosher and Peter Krause invite you to crowdfund BLACKING OUT!
A Tale of Fire and Murder in Southern California presented as a Deluxe Oversized Hardcover.
BLACKING OUT follows a drunk ex-cop looking for redemption as he attempts to solve a murder during the Southern California fire season.

Comics industry veteran and writer Chip Mosher and legendary artist Peter Krause (The Power of Shazam!, Irredeemable) present BLACKING OUT, a 56-page graphic novel presented in a deluxe oversized hardcover in the European album tradition. BLACKING OUT also showcases the amazing talents of colorist Giulia Brusco (Scalped, Django Unchained), letterer Ed Dukeshire (Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Mighty Morphin Power Rangers), and designer Tom Muller (X-Men) .
Rewards include a print Lobby Card set from acclaimed artists Francesco Francavilla, Eduardo Risso, Jamal Igle, Emma Ríos, Mirka Andolfo, Jacob Phillips, Dan Panosian, Ryan Kelly, Patric Reynolds, Elise McCall, and Peter Krause. 
Bottom line for backers: 
9/1/2021 - UPDATE
Well, that's all folks. If you missed getting the book here, then come find us at conventions to purchase one or contact these local comic shops that supported us at the retail level and may still have a copy or two left -- Comic VS Toys in US, The Dragon in Canada or Traveling Man in the UK. The last five orders go out this week and we're focused on our next release. More about that later!  Thanks, as always, for your support!
 
6/23/2021 - UPDATE
As of this date, we have 62 copies of the book left. We continue to send orders out every week. We're going to continue to leave this open for a bit and see how it goes.  Thanks for your support!
 
4/5/2021 - UPDATE
As of this date, we have 68 copies of the book left. We continue to send orders out every week. Given that we've sold 14 copies in a month, we're going to leave this open for a bit and see how it goes.  Thanks for your support!
3/17/2021 - UPDATE
As of today, we have 82 copies of the book left. We continue to send orders out every week. We're going to try and sell through this entire set by the end of March. At that point, we'll most likely call it a day and hang up this project to focus on the next one.
2/22/2021 - UPDATE
With fulfillment basically done for all backers on Kickstarter and IGG, we've decided to offer the last 100 copies for sale of the book. So for those that missed this the first time, these are the last 100 copies of the print run of 1,000. Pete and I have ~100 some copies stashed away, but those will only be sold at shows or maybe as a special incentive for future crowdfunding. So basically what i'm saying... when these are gone. They are basically gone.
We'll look to ship these out within 30 days or less from your order.
8/1/2020 - UPDATE: 
We've basically closed up shop so we can focus on fulfillment of orders in hand. If you still want a hardcover copy of the book, we are making that available for a premium price as these will come out of the limited supply of overprints we do. All the other tiers are printed to order and are in process. 

The graphic novel is complete and we have met our crowdfunding goal on another platform and are giving IndieGogo community a chance to get their hands on this book. With the exception of the retailer tier, every tier 50 bucks or more will get the printed signed and numbered book, the main Lobby Card set, the digital bundle and the unlocked stretch goals. Higher priced tiers get more!  We unlocked up through the $40K stretch goal and are excited to unlock more... see below!

story:
Welcome Indiegogo Backers!!

This is the campaign to fund WART THE WIZARD #2: THE PORTAL OF ECHOES!

The 48 Page Graphic Novel by Mandy Summers & Peter Gilmore

VARIANT COVER BY NARWHAL!

 

WART'S BACK!

Wart The Wizard has returned for an all new adventure... except this time he's not alone! What Wart believed to simply be a magical orb that he had stolen from the dark wizard, Gravemoss, was in fact a Nexus Orb that hatched the rarest of all creatures, a Portal Dragon named Lixeon!

For the first time ever, Wart The Wizard will be leaving the realm of Brightmoore and traveling across incredible worlds such as Lochmoore & Shadowmoore!

YES! Wart The Wizard still has an inventory and will be collecting items and figuring out how to use them along the way to continue his journey!

If you like Big Hero 6, Shrek, Monty Python, Discworld, or The Black Cauldron, then Wart The Wizard is for you!

Interior Page #19

Wart The Wizard finds himself taking refuge in The Shadowcrest Causeway and stumbles upon Ocelot The Cruel, the World Reaper of Shadowmoore!

Interior Page #12

Wart The Wizard is unwillingly in a high speed pursuit of the dark wizard, Gravemoss!

Interior Page #13

Dark Bats have begun attacking the Sky Sweepers and Orlo The Great has arrived to the rescue!

Interior Page #14

Wart takes a spill and is left abandoned back in The Penumbra!

 

ALSO AVAILABLE!

WART THE WIZARD #1: REMASTERED EDITION!

Original Story by Mandy Summers, Completely New Artwork by Peter Gilmore!

Remastered Wrap-Around Cover!

The Portal of Echoes Cover Art Available!

MYSTICAL MAP OF BRIGHTMOORE (SOLD OUT!)

5K STRETCH GOAL DOUBLE-SIDED BOOKMARK!

The campaign has reached $5,000!! All backers will receive this Wart The Wizard: The Portal of Echoes Double-Sided Lixeon/Gravemoss Bookmark by Peter Gilmore for FREE!!

10K STRETCH GOAL TRADING CARD!

The campaign has reached $10,000!! All backers will receive this Wart The Wizard: The Portal of Echoes Trading Card by Peter Gilmore for FREE!!

Did You Sign Up For The Indiegogo Prelaunch Mailing List???

If so, you're one of the backers that will be getting this incredible trading card of LIXEON, The Portal Dragon for FREE!

Previous Indiegogo Projects:

HOW WAS WART THE WIZARD CREATED?

Years ago when my daughter was younger, I would read to her every night at bedtime. Hundreds and hundreds of stories later, when it seemed like there was almost nothing left to read, she demanded a custom tale and Wart The Wizard was born! Night after night, when most children were already asleep, we'd stay up late laughing and joking about Wart's misfortune, and agreed that EVERYONE has a little bit of Wart The Wizard inside of them. He's the humor we find when things are sometimes at their worst, and the proof that anyone can overcome life's challenges if you look within yourself and dare to dream.

IS WART THE WIZARD A CHILDREN'S BOOK?

No! Wart The Wizard is a fun, adventure-filled tale that is age-appropriate for EVERYONE! The humor and content is similar to that of Big Hero 6, Shrek, Discworld, Monty Python, The Black Cauldron, and other Disney/Pixar films!

Adults will enjoy Wart's quirkiness, personality, and frequent nostalgic references while kids will love the antics, characters, jokes, and more!
story_txt:
Welcome Indiegogo Backers!!
This is the campaign to fund WART THE WIZARD #2: THE PORTAL OF ECHOES!
The 48 Page Graphic Novel by Mandy Summers & Peter Gilmore

VARIANT COVER BY NARWHAL!

 

WART'S BACK!
Wart The Wizard has returned for an all new adventure... except this time he's not alone! What Wart believed to simply be a magical orb that he had stolen from the dark wizard, Gravemoss, was in fact a Nexus Orb that hatched the rarest of all creatures, a Portal Dragon named Lixeon!
For the first time ever, Wart The Wizard will be leaving the realm of Brightmoore and traveling across incredible worlds such as Lochmoore & Shadowmoore!
YES! Wart The Wizard still has an inventory and will be collecting items and figuring out how to use them along the way to continue his journey!
If you like Big Hero 6, Shrek, Monty Python, Discworld, or The Black Cauldron, then Wart The Wizard is for you!

Interior Page #19
Wart The Wizard finds himself taking refuge in The Shadowcrest Causeway and stumbles upon Ocelot The Cruel, the World Reaper of Shadowmoore!

Interior Page #12
Wart The Wizard is unwillingly in a high speed pursuit of the dark wizard, Gravemoss!

Interior Page #13
Dark Bats have begun attacking the Sky Sweepers and Orlo The Great has arrived to the rescue!

Interior Page #14
Wart takes a spill and is left abandoned back in The Penumbra!

 

ALSO AVAILABLE!
WART THE WIZARD #1: REMASTERED EDITION!
Original Story by Mandy Summers, Completely New Artwork by Peter Gilmore!

Remastered Wrap-Around Cover!






The Portal of Echoes Cover Art Available!

MYSTICAL MAP OF BRIGHTMOORE (SOLD OUT!)


5K STRETCH GOAL DOUBLE-SIDED BOOKMARK!
The campaign has reached $5,000!! All backers will receive this Wart The Wizard: The Portal of Echoes Double-Sided Lixeon/Gravemoss Bookmark by Peter Gilmore for FREE!!

10K STRETCH GOAL TRADING CARD!
The campaign has reached $10,000!! All backers will receive this Wart The Wizard: The Portal of Echoes Trading Card by Peter Gilmore for FREE!!

Did You Sign Up For The Indiegogo Prelaunch Mailing List???
If so, you're one of the backers that will be getting this incredible trading card of LIXEON, The Portal Dragon for FREE!
