story:
The Story...

The Persian Empire 524 BC. Cambyses II, son of the Great Cyrus(founder of the Persian Empire), has conquered Egypt but hears rumors that his brother Bardiya has taken the throne back at home. With much speculation, Cambyses sends his most skilled Immortal(Asadi) to recon the alleged usurper. Asadi, a loyal member of the elite Persian Immortal Army and to the throne, rides out not knowing that unworldly monsters and demons have surfaced to stop him from uncovering the truth. Meanwhile, opportunists like Darius, a Mage and a demon King named Zahhāk are ready to seize the moment during this weak moment for the royal family.

THE IMMORTAL ASADI is a 24 page, saddle stitched, full-color comic book with art done by Nick Unlisted, colors by Jeff Henry and written by Del and co-written and edited by Jermaine Colon-Mendez(JC) of Tier One Comics. This will be the first issue of a series that takes you into a world inspired by the Ancient Persian Empire and by Persian mythology.

“History is written by the victors"

A quote we all know too well. A lot of what we know about the Persian Empire comes from the accounts of Greek historians and what ruins have been left behind. Many have speculated the legitimacy of the Persian King Darius and his accounts of how he ascended to the throne. A series of assassinations, rumors, and rewritten records of what happened between the two sons of Cyrus, from which King Darius took the throne, surround debates even til today. This story takes the accounts of this piece of Persian history, mythology, and fantasy to bring you a story like no other!

 

The Characters

Asadi: Persian soldier of “The Immortals”, an elite army unit of 10,000 fixed members. Asadi is well liked amongst the ranks and is popular for being undefeated against any challenger (man or beast). He does not see himself greater than anyone of his unit even though he is clearly  more exceptionally skilled in all areas of combat when compared to his peers. He is loyal to his unit, his chain of command, the King, and has never questioned his duty to protect the throne and its interests. Asadi has the ability to interpret dreams but mostly his own. In his dreams it is revealed to him the weaknesses of his enemies the night prior to confronting them. Many of his peers do not believe this to be true yet others remain suspicious.

Zahhāk: Known as Azhi Dahāka in ancient Persian literature. This demon king has origins in the mythology and Zoroastrianist beliefs of the Persian people. Here, he has come from the shadows and has found weakness in the state of the union of an expanding Persian empire. He plots to rule over man but plots to do so through shadow government, using a spear bearer for the king named Darius to gain control. He unleashes the mythological world of Ancient Persia that's filled with monsters and demons to create havoc within the empire. He will soon prove to be Asadi’s biggest challenge and test of immortality as the two will constantly cross paths due to their certain affiliations, end-state goals, and desires.

We want you to be a part of this!

In order to make this story something tangible that you can hold in your hands we have to cover the printing costs, artwork, coloring, and lettering. I've put a lot of my own money in and would like your help with making this book happen. Be a part of the journey!

If we don't reach our goal we will push forward and complete this project, however it would be more rewarding making this a combined effort.

The Impact

I'm very passionate about the history of ancient civilizations and am always inspired by storytelling using ancient mythology with historical figures. There are so many characters, historical figures, and events that have not been tapped into to create and tell great stories. This, I hope will introduce another world to many who are not familiar with Ancient Persian history and mythology and entertain those who do.

Risks & Challenges

We, unlike many other independent creators are starting off with less material. We ask that if you're still on the fence about backing us, to check in regularly as we will be constantly working and updating the content of this book. The script is complete and we are now starting on the pages which will soon be posted. We're all military(the creative team) and are making good use of our time to create this book. Challenges will present themselves through this situation but we will be upfront and regularly update statuses of this project. We're here asking you all to help us fund and be a part of a product that WILL get finished. We will have the means to make it possible but hope you'll join us. 

Prints available!

Below is "The Immortal Mask" worn by Asadi. These prints 8.5"x11" prints that are signed by the artist Nick Unlisted.

The process

Nick and I have finished character concept and development. What you'll be seeing in the next couple of days is us diving into the pages and starting the book. Follow Nick on IG @Nickunlisted to see more of his work and @tieronecomics on twitter and IG to see more content surrounding the day to day for this book. Below is some concept art for Asadi from our development phase. The character's look is based off Daniel Asadi, a well known Persian musician that mixes the modern trap sound with traditional folk music of the Persian culture. Follow his IG @danielasadi

story:
Story
 

  • A post apocalyptic future where all technology is dead except for the city floating in the sky and those who inhabit it. The ultra elite, the scientist, and the most brilliant of engineers  who keep them above all others and have for centuries..along with an unique power source!  Below are the experimented, mutated and sick..below that, the few living, scavengers looking desperately to survive. Our story follows an unknown woman, who was thrust into this world with little to no knowledge of how she got here! 
     
  • This comic book is fully created, story/art/logo/lettering by Vinnie Tartamella, Comic book professional, Image cover artist, co-creator of Through the Woods, former lead designer of McFarlane toys, storyboard artist, toy & statue designer for many companies and owner of Mella Art World.

    Check out the art below from this 32 page comic!!
















  •








***GET THE 52 page VOL.1 Art Book as an ADD-ON AT CHECKOUT***










And if anyone is looking for Vol.1 alone, it has been added to this campaign! Check the tiers. Also available as an ADD-ON at checkout!

Shadow of the Kraken is my newest campaign, support it here: http://igg.me/at/kraken1  


Also Check out Through the Woods Hardcover Collected edition http://igg.me/at/ttwc

~  4 extra pages of  sketches/layout pages were added

The Impact

The money you donate to this project is for me to do a larger print run for this New comic series & Art Books,.I will be able to get into more hands around the world! It will also help spread the word about Mella Art World as a comic company for the fans, delivering the highest quality art and stories!  

  • City of Venus: Dead City is a 32 page comic book! Thick cover stock!
  • The Art of Vinnie Vol 1. & 2 are two separate 52 page art books in a comic book format. Thick cover stock!



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! Share on social media!

Also available as an ADD-ON at checkout!Shadow of the Kraken is my newest campaign, support it here: http://igg.me/at/kraken1  Also Check out Through the Woods Hardcover Collected edition http://igg.me/at/ttwc~  4 extra pages of  sketches/layout pages were addedThe Impact
The money you donate to this project is for me to do a larger print run for this New comic series & Art Books,.I will be able to get into more hands around the world! It will also help spread the word about Mella Art World as a comic company for the fans, delivering the highest quality art and stories!  


City of Venus: Dead City is a 32 page comic book! Thick cover stock!

The Art of Vinnie Vol 1. & 2 are two separate 52 page art books in a comic book format. Thick cover stock!



Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! Share on social media!

story:
Read the first 21 pages of Brand chapter 1

Stretch Goals:

  • $10,000:  Dimitrius Miller Savage Dawn print
  • $25,000: Fame & Wyther: The Family that Preys print by Cartoon Muscle!

Round 2!

  • Brand: Way of the Gun  is the next 55 page chapter of the Brand saga. Just hours after the events in book 1 David is visited by the sinister Dark Santana and his former mask Horus. David's life and his relationships are in constant turmoil.
  • We learn more about Dawn and delve more into her past, her present, and her future as we meet the mysterious Jehovah.

More amazing art from Caanan White!

The success of the first Brand campaign allowed us to get a head start on this next chapter. The entire team from book one is proudly returning. Here are the first 5 pages from Brand: Way of the Gun.

New cover to Brand issue 1 by Caanan White and available as an add-on.

With your support Caanan already has over 10 pages of art completed. The script is almost completed as well as a separate script for The Fame Book which will be illustrated by Dimitrius Miller with a cover by Caanan White.

A Bigger Bolder Campaign

Brand book 1 had over 2200 backers with over $78,000 raised. We wanted to do something special to celebrate this new launch so I reached out to some of the hottest artists in comics.

Cover A David Craven versus Dark Santana by Jimbo Salgaldo

  • SHI 25th Anniversary cover. We celebrate 25 years of Shi with this stunning cover by Caanan White featuring Billy Tucci's lethal lady.
  • Matthew Weldon the artist of Antarctic Press's Punchline features Dawn Craven in a recreation of Demi Moore's Vanity Fair Cover
  • Dark Santana Cover by Shinobi Sasquatch artist Rob Willis showcases the essence of evil himself with brilliant colors by Kid Ikaris. 
  • Fame and Wyther Cover by Dimitrius Miller who is also drawing The Fame Book which is a featured add on perk for this campaign.
  • Santana Mega Pack  exclusive Jehovah's Checkmate cover by Caanan White

Risks & Challenges

To say that the first Brand campaign was a challenge would be would be an understatement but our team is very proud of the first campaign and the end results. Caanan and I are committed to telling these stories for as long as there is interest. We thank you all for your continued support.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate but want to help us out follow me on social media @ikaripress on Facebook,Twitter, and Instagram or purchase Ikari Press merch on Amazon. Share this campaign and help get the word out!

story:
A Short Summary of "Children of Genesis"

          Children of Genesis is a sometimes-funny sci-fi action drama coming of age story. 96 children were abducted in infancy and raised by the Upsylon alien Hemmingfirth and his artificial super-intelligent cohort Genesis to reach beyond the fullest of human potential. In Agoge, these children are sent forth into the wilds of the alien planet Relpek to prove they are worthy and up to the daunting tasks that lay ahead of them.

Here is a link to read the first 12 pages for free.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/iv7xcxbo599zcjl/COGVol0.108.pdf?

About me and this projects creation.

          Hello friends, family, and readers my name is Brian Brennan the writer and creator of Children of Genesis, the first 30-page issue of Children of Genesis is complete and test-printed. However, the work is just beginning.

          I must tell you as I hold the test print in my hands and flip through the pages, it is the most satisfying experience, next to holding my newborn sons, in my entire life. I am a carpenter by trade and writing became a hobby years ago after the idea for this comic came to me in a dream. I awoke in the middle of the night and furiously wrote down that dream. At first, those bleary-eyed writings were incoherent. Writing was never something I had even considered as a hobby. Since that fateful dream, however, I have spent several years organizing those ideas into several scripts.

          With the help of a childhood friend Anthony Jensen, who I had spent many a morning, noon and night drawing and writing homemade comics, we came up with a general outline for the first issue of those still incoherent scribbles. The last few years consisted of writing draft after draft until the finalized script for Children of Genesis: Agoge, as well as scripts for the next four volumes and outlines up to volume ten, were completed. 

          My next step was to find an artist whose style matched my dream. That’s where Cristian Santos comes in. He took the concept art and my script and brought them to life. The final piece of the puzzle was through what can only be described as true serendipity. I met the writer of The Minds Behind the Games book series and creator/writer of the indie comic Condrey, Patrick Hickey Jr. Patrick took my final draft and edited it to what I would consider perfection.

          So, seeing as the book is complete and the test print came out perfect, your contribution would help in a variety of ways. The necessary funding would not only support a print run of Children of Genesis, but would also fund a full-color version and the continuation of the series. I truly have lofty hopes that you all will fall in love with these characters which I have big plans for.

story:
An American hero comes out of self-imposed retirement after becoming disillusioned with his country during the Vietnam War...

 

 

American Eagle #1 is the story of that disillusionment. Born in San Francisco as Jordan Hayato, the young American Eagle was raised in a Japanese internment during the chaos of World War II. Taking up the mantle of American Eagle to guarantee the safety of his family, Jordan quickly established himself as a hero in the United States military. 

During the Vietnam War, Jordan was used as a symbol for the country and the military to get behind during a conflicted time in American history. Chafing against that role, American Eagle explores Jordan's personal journey into what really makes an American hero. 

Creative team

American Eagle is the brainchild of Jesse Hansen, an industry veteran with over 90 creative credits. Jesse has put together Cornerstone Creative Studios, a creative studio and comic book talent agency with over 100 members and numerous creative credits including on works from many creative companies including Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, Games Workshop, and Blizzard.  He also serves as the inker of American Eagle. 

 Jordan's story was conceived by Daniel Horowitz, a writer and Creative Director at Cornerstone Creative Studios. Daniel has been published in USA Today, Unwinnable Magazine, VentureBeat, and more, and is a regular contributor to HP Tech Takes. His creative credits include short comics from Fifth Dimension Comics, Grayhaven Comics and H-Alt Magazine. 



The book was brought to life by Javier Lugo, a reknown artist known for his work on FemForce #180-183,, Superbabes #1, Bobby Fulton & the Fantastics #1 and the RICANSTRUCTION anthology. He draws superheroes, real life, horror, sci-fi and fantasy for a wide variety of independent comic book projects. 

Rounding out the creative team is Mickey Clausen, a member of Cornerstone Creative Studios and the owner of MindWinder studios. Mickey has colored comics for a wide range of companies including IDW, Boom Studios, BlueWater Comics, Image Comics, Kingstone Comics, Beta 3 Comics and more.

 

 

The future of American Eagle

American Eagle needs continued funding to finish out its initial three issue arc. With the creative team already in place, and the Vietnam arc of the storyline already written, the funding will entirely go toward the creative team, shipping costs, and subsequent campaigns to bring this story to life. 


 

  • Initial round of $2000 of funding will go toward the completion of American Eagle #1. Any extra funds will help to finance future issues. 
  • There are two more issues planned for Vietnam arc. Future issues will take place in the modern era.
  • If the book does not reach its goal, Cornerstone Creative Studios will kick in the remaining funds to produce the book, so there is no risk to the backers. 

 

The future of Cornerstone Creative Studios

Cornerstone Creative Studios plans to launch a full universe of superheroes. This all depends on the success of American Eagle #1 as well as future issues. 

Additional characters include: 

  • Kinetic, a teenage Native American speedster written by Andrew Lucas
  • Kur of the Nexus, a barbarian warrior from the past written by Ryan Palmer
  • 5.E.N.T.R.Y, a mysterious armored guardian written and created by Monty Stikkman
    to name just a few...

 

Thank you for your interest in American Eagle #1 and we hope you'll consider buying a copy and following the story of Jordan Hayato!

story:
Are you being trolled by ghouls, pestered by the paranormal or attempting to file taxes after being resurrected? Nocturnal Commissions is the only agency with the expertise to help. A Wolfman, Vampire and a Zombie are ready to solve your supernatural concerns for a very reasonable rate (plus expenses). 

Nocturnal Commissions is a macabre romp exploring what happens when the mundane meets the monstrous.  X-Files meets the Monster Squad.

"Nocturnal Commissions is a rare comic that's original in its concept and execution.  The humor hits, but never at the expense of characters I care about." 

                                                                           -Writer Mark Sable (Unthinkable, Grounded)

We have successfully crowdfunded the initial print run of Nocturnal Commissions and will be offering pre-orders here in IndieGoGo. This 40-page one-shot comic will not be available in stores. IndieGoGo is the only place where you can order the years wildest monster romp!

Artist Greg Hinkle and I previously created the Rattler Graphic Novel for Image comics in 2016. we truly enjoy collaborating but have had trouble landing a new project that would reunite us on the page. We finally came to the conclusion that we would have to make our own opportunities through self publishing. Nocturnal Commissions is a passion project that the two of us have been working on in between other projects and on weekends. Now, after 15 months the book is fully colored and lettered and ready to go to the printers.

The mainstream comic publishing world is geared towards superheroes and licensed properties; an original horror-comedy is a hard sell these days. Rather than spending our time and energy knocking on closed doors, we'd rather spend it engaging directly with an audience.  The purpose of this campaign is to send you a copy of a kick-ass monster book that you won't be able to find anywhere else. Any additional funds raised will go toward supporting the creators who want to produce future Nocturnal Commission adventures.   

Thank you for taking a look at our perks. Every pledge, project share, and retweet supports independent creators who are willing to take risks and create original work for an adventurous audience. Thank you!

story:
[IMPORTANT NOTE: ALL PRICES INCLUDE SHIPPING IN THE USA.]

RAMMUR IS BACK-TO-BASICS COMIC BOOK STORYTELLING.

My name is Charles Santino.

I've been writing, editing, art directing, and packaging comics for 35 years.

I've written for Marvel, Bantam Books, Penguin, Fantagraphics, Dell/Abyss, Edgar Rice Burroughs, Markosia, and others.

Rammur #1 is the culmination of the experience I've garnered over the decades.

 

 

Rammur #1 is done, finished, completed--written, drawn, colored, and lettered. All 48 pages, plus covers.

Markosia is my publisher, but they will publish only a digital version of Rammur #1.

Markosia has kindly allowed me to reach out to you with this print offering. There will be no print version of Rammur #1 on Amazon or Barnes & Noble.

And the only print edition that will be available is on NEWSPRINT paper. You remember newsprint? The way comics are supposed to look? I knew that you would. [[SEE UPDATE: NEWSPRINT DITCHED FOR SQUARE-BOUND FORMAT WITH SPINE, ON MATTE (NON-GLOSSY) PAPER.]]

 

 

Rammur #1 is a creator-owned comic book. I've done those before. But not like Rammur.

What's so different about Rammur?

First and foremost, I own the property outright; Rammur is my baby.

 

 

I have collaborators, most notably the three artists who contributed to the distinct visual likeness of Rammur. Those three fine artists--Paulo Peres, Andrew Wendel, and Joe Staton--made invaluable contributions and they will participate in the profits of Rammur.

 

 

What else is makes Rammur different from other comics being produced today? Everything. The concept, the approach to story, the approach to art.

Rammur is a master thief in a future police state. That's it. Seven-word elevator pitch. Simple.

The stories will be self-contained, with beginnings, middles, and endings. And relatively short, by today's standards. (Story page counts in Rammur #1: 24 pages, 6 pages, 2 pages, 4 pages.) Plus ten pages of "making of" ("Steps") stuff, illustrating the development of the dynamic splash page--from script to finished art--for the lead story, "Dead on the Ground." The Steps section also includes an alternative cover, a TOPS Tales of the Police State cover, a must-have propaganda poster by Matt Chic (aka trashydreams) which is also a crowdfunding bonus, Paulo's "Aspects of Rammur" tryout page, and a sneak peak at Rammur #2. (More about TOPS below.)

 

 

Want page-after-page of clever dialogue, with word balloons crowding out the artwork? Look elsewhere. Rammur stories are told visually--what a concept!

Want tired, clichéd, elaborate "backstory" that just gums up the works? Again, you won't find it in Rammur. You'll be too caught up in what Rammur is doing now to care a whit about what he might have done in the distant past.

Want a cast of thousands? Crowd scenes? "Epic" scope? Sorry on those counts, too. Rammur takes a handful of characters (or less) and launches into action. No galactic wars and hordes of zombies In Rammur. Just tight little crime dramas with an intriguing (anti)hero, slimy antagonists, and good-looking women.

 

 

Origin story? You've got to be kidding! Zilch, zero, nada.

 

 

The lead story, "Dead on the Ground," is drawn by Paulo Peres. Here's the teaser:

A museum heist gone wrong. Two thieves dead. Rammur’s fusion gear damaged. The target of the break-in—a banned objet d’art—destroyed. But that’s just the beginning of Rammur’s problems, because one of his colleagues is a police informant. Can Rammur figure out who’s tipping off the cops before he finds himself in a Global Freedom Authority labor camp?

The Rammur back-up story by Marco Perugini (who created the boffo video) is called "Handiwork," and by the time you're finished with this little gem you will probably have caught on that double-crosses are a running theme in Rammur. These are crime stories, remember? In "Handiwork" Rammur passes on a heist he thinks is just too risky. End of story? No--beginning of story. Rammur finds that walking away from this heist might be deadlier than taking the job.

This is the Rammur Manifesto:

If you think testosterone is a kind of poison…

If you think that "macho" is a dirty word...

If you want comics to be safe…and “sensitive”…

Then Rammur is not for you!

Rammur: no man can stop him

Rammur: no woman can resist him

Rammur: no prize can daunt him.

You'll notice Rammur's visual style is not the currently fashionable, "busy," heavily rendered, ultra-modeled-color type of art you see everywhere. If you want that, there are plenty of places to go.

I decided that Rammur's style would be the "animated" style, made popular by DC Comics' tie-ins to the 1990s Batman animated cartoon.

Rammur will be a bit more mature than that, but not by much. It's PG-13 or so. ("12+ only" to be exact.) A little blood, no gore, implied sex. Some low cussing.

 

 

Fun factoid: Rammur’s gear is powered by a compact fusion reactor strapped to his back. Is Rammur the first and only comic book character powered by hydrogen/fusion power? Maybe. That would be cool. A ridiculous concept, you say? Totally impossible, scientifically? Yeah, but this is comics, where a kid who got his powers from getting chomped on by a radioactive spider is all the rage. Is that any sillier?

Note: that thing on Rammur's chest is a ram-scoop. It sucks up hydrogen atoms. Hence, the name "Rammur."

 

 

Here's a glossary of terms to help introduce you Rammur's world:

Ruptors: robot cops.

GFA/Global Freedom Authority: the world-wide future government that runs everything. Or tries. They have, of course, bitten off more than they can chew, so a guy like Rammur can make a living and mostly stay under the radar and out of jail.

Dominaytra/“Dommie”: the Big Sister at the head of the GFA; she may or may not be a real person.

Above: this is the "Dommie" mini-propaganda poster. Get one!

TOPS Tales of the Police State: funky little vignettes set in Rammur’s universe; here we throw a bone to the “alternative” comic book crowd who might find the pulp of Rammur just a bit too much of a guilty pleasure.   

 

 

"Almost Home" is the first TOPS story, a tight little two-page gut-punch, based on an old joke. But it's not funny--unless your sense of humor is pretty dark. Art by Carlos Aon.

TOPS story "Job Well Done" is twice as long as "Almost Home" and it clocks in at a whopping four pages. This one's another slice-of-life in the police state, where an unnamed young lady protagonist decides there's only one way to cut the cord with Big Sister. Art by Marco Perugini.

That's it. That's Rammur #1 b/w TOPS Tales of the Police State. We're keeping things simple--but exciting.

Check out the art samples, check out the perks, and while you're at it, check out Rammur #0 free, here: https://tinyurl.com/y7qo5axo

Will there be more Rammur comics? Sure. Paulo's coloring #2 right now and I'm writing #3.

Oh, yeah--did I mention that Rammur #1 is completely done? Yes, it is. So you won't have to wait years and years for satisfaction. That's a perk in itself if you ask me!

-- Charles Santino, somewhere in North America.

Everything. The concept, the approach to story, the approach to art.Rammur is a master thief in a future police state. That's it. Seven-word elevator pitch. Simple.The stories will be self-contained, with beginnings, middles, and endings. And relatively short, by today's standards. (Story page counts in Rammur #1: 24 pages, 6 pages, 2 pages, 4 pages.) Plus ten pages of "making of" ("Steps") stuff, illustrating the development of the dynamic splash page--from script to finished art--for the lead story, "Dead on the Ground." The Steps section also includes an alternative cover, a TOPS Tales of the Police State cover, a must-have propaganda poster by Matt Chic (aka trashydreams) which is also a crowdfunding bonus, Paulo's "Aspects of Rammur" tryout page, and a sneak peak at Rammur #2. (More about TOPS below.)  Want page-after-page of clever dialogue, with word balloons crowding out the artwork? Look elsewhere. Rammur stories are told visually--what a concept!Want tired, clichéd, elaborate "backstory" that just gums up the works? Again, you won't find it in Rammur. You'll be too caught up in what Rammur is doing now to care a whit about what he might have done in the distant past.Want a cast of thousands? Crowd scenes? "Epic" scope? Sorry on those counts, too. Rammur takes a handful of characters (or less) and launches into action. No galactic wars and hordes of zombies In Rammur. Just tight little crime dramas with an intriguing (anti)hero, slimy antagonists, and good-looking women.  Origin story? You've got to be kidding! Zilch, zero, nada.  The lead story, "Dead on the Ground," is drawn by Paulo Peres. Here's the teaser:A museum heist gone wrong. Two thieves dead. Rammur’s fusion gear damaged. The target of the break-in—a banned objet d’art—destroyed. But that’s just the beginning of Rammur’s problems, because one of his colleagues is a police informant. Can Rammur figure out who’s tipping off the cops before he finds himself in a Global Freedom Authority labor camp?The Rammur back-up story by Marco Perugini (who created the boffo video) is called "Handiwork," and by the time you're finished with this little gem you will probably have caught on that double-crosses are a running theme in Rammur. These are crime stories, remember? In "Handiwork" Rammur passes on a heist he thinks is just too risky. End of story? No--beginning of story. Rammur finds that walking away from this heist might be deadlier than taking the job.This is the Rammur Manifesto:If you think testosterone is a kind of poison…If you think that "macho" is a dirty word...If you want comics to be safe…and “sensitive”…Then Rammur is not for you!Rammur: no man can stop himRammur: no woman can resist himRammur: no prize can daunt him.You'll notice Rammur's visual style is not the currently fashionable, "busy," heavily rendered, ultra-modeled-color type of art you see everywhere. If you want that, there are plenty of places to go.I decided that Rammur's style would be the "animated" style, made popular by DC Comics' tie-ins to the 1990s Batman animated cartoon.Rammur will be a bit more mature than that, but not by much. It's PG-13 or so. ("12+ only" to be exact.) A little blood, no gore, implied sex. Some low cussing.  Fun factoid: Rammur’s gear is powered by a compact fusion reactor strapped to his back. Is Rammur the first and only comic book character powered by hydrogen/fusion power? Maybe. That would be cool. A ridiculous concept, you say? Totally impossible, scientifically? Yeah, but this is comics, where a kid who got his powers from getting chomped on by a radioactive spider is all the rage. Is that any sillier?Note: that thing on Rammur's chest is a ram-scoop. It sucks up hydrogen atoms. Hence, the name "Rammur."  Here's a glossary of terms to help introduce you Rammur's world:Ruptors: robot cops.GFA/Global Freedom Authority: the world-wide future government that runs everything. Or tries. They have, of course, bitten off more than they can chew, so a guy like Rammur can make a living and mostly stay under the radar and out of jail.Dominaytra/“Dommie”: the Big Sister at the head of the GFA; she may or may not be a real person.Above: this is the "Dommie" mini-propaganda poster. Get one!TOPS Tales of the Police State: funky little vignettes set in Rammur’s universe; here we throw a bone to the “alternative” comic book crowd who might find the pulp of Rammur just a bit too much of a guilty pleasure.     "Almost Home" is the first TOPS story, a tight little two-page gut-punch, based on an old joke. But it's not funny--unless your sense of humor is pretty dark. Art by Carlos Aon.TOPS story "Job Well Done" is twice as long as "Almost Home" and it clocks in at a whopping four pages. This one's another slice-of-life in the police state, where an unnamed young lady protagonist decides there's only one way to cut the cord with Big Sister. Art by Marco Perugini.That's it. That's Rammur #1 b/w TOPS Tales of the Police State. We're keeping things simple--but exciting.Check out the art samples, check out the perks, and while you're at it, check out Rammur #0 free, here: https://tinyurl.com/y7qo5axoWill there be more Rammur comics? Sure. Paulo's coloring #2 right now and I'm writing #3.Oh, yeah--did I mention that Rammur #1 is completely done? Yes, it is. So you won't have to wait years and years for satisfaction. That's a perk in itself if you ask me!-- Charles Santino, somewhere in North America.

story:
Malevolent Rising 4

Continuing the story from the CATACLYSMIC events of issue 3, what's left of our heroes must find a way to pick up the pieces and complete their mission. The events in this action-packed issue will change the world of Malevolent Rising forever and lay the foundation for everything to come. Some choices once made, can not be undone! Get all four issues in one bundle plus perks such as trading cards and art prints!

 

 

  • My name is Branden Sanderson, and I've been creating comics all my life. This book has been a dream come true for me and the rest of the creative team and we are all so excited for all of you to get to read this latest chapter in the story of Malevolent Rising. We have all poured our hearts and souls into this book in order to deliver the best product possible.
  • Your backing will go to printing and production costs for the book and perks as well as keep us going on this road to the epic conclusion to our story.

Your contributions help small press

Small press comics such as ours help to bring new and talented voices into the comics market to compete with the big comic publishers. Your contributions directly bring these books to life and allow the creators to work hard to create content that is just as good or better than anything you'll pick up at your local comic shop.

story:
It's time to print and release the newest volume of the GOLD DIGGER COLOR GOLD BRICK SERIES, which collects issues 226 through 250 of Gold Digger!  If you supported the previous color Gold Bricks, thank you very much, and we hope you support this campaign too. With a load of great standalone and continuity pickup stories, this collection makes a great jumping-on point for any new readers, as well as awesome reading for longtime fans. THESE ISSUES HAVE NEVER BEEN COLLECTED INTO ONE VOLUME BEFORE. Between its black-and-white and full-color issues, Gold Digger is now approaching the 300-issue mark and is going strong!

If you're not familiar with us, my name is Joeming Dunn, and I run Antarctic Press, a small, independent comic company started in 1984. I have personally collected comics of almost every type and genre since 1974, and I can say that during the past 30 years, we have published some of the greatest and best independent comics out there. Our publishing history includes titles like Gold Digger and Ninja High School. The comic industry has changed over the years, so we have started this Kickstarter program to help introduce new projects from our talented group of creators.

Over the years, we have published a number of series. Prominent among these is Fred Perry's ingenious title, Gold Digger, which Fred describes as a mixture of Indiana Jones and Final Fantasy. The idea for Gold Digger was first conceived during Fred's tour of duty in the first Gulf War, and it debuted in Antarctic Press's anthology comic, Mangazine, in 1991. A four-issue miniseries followed in 1992, and a regular monthly black-and-white series followed starting in 1993. The current color series began in 1999 and has continued since then. It is the second-longest-running solo-created title in the industry. In 2013, Fred was honored at Comic Con International in San Diego, where he received an Inkpot Award for his work on Gold Digger.

Over the past years, we have released other Color Gold Bricks as Kickstarter projects. We are now releasing the eighth Color Gold Brick, which features issues 226 through 250 of the Gold Digger series. (This is actually the 10th Gold Brick. More on that below.) If you haven't seen or read Gold Digger, this is your chance to enjoy one of the best and longest-running ongoing series in comics. Like the other Bricks, this one lets new readers join in easily, so you don't have to be shy!

The two earliest Brick volumes, Gold Brick 1 and Gold Brick 2, were black and white. Then Fred began his color series, so Bricks 3-6 were printed in color. Gold Brick 3 was originally printed in limited quantities, and Fred's only reference copy became thoroughly destroyed from years of constant use. Kickstarter was used to make this out-of-print edition available again as Color Brick 1. By this time, the original stock of Brick 4 had sold out as well, so we offered a new printing of that through Kickstarter as Color Brick 2.  However, the original Bricks 5 and 6 were still in stock at the time, so we skipped ahead to produce Gold Brick 7 (Color Brick 5), collecting material not previously available in this format, and have continued the sequence from there. (We know this can still be confusing, so we have a numbering guide at the bottom of this page.)

Since the original printings of Gold Bricks 5 and 6 have since sold out, we'll eventually go back to reprint these other volumes to match the new Kickstarter printings' format. We want everyone to have nice editions. For now, however, in addition to reasons already mentioned, many backers in previous campaigns have asked if we could skip ahead, since they had already purchased the earlier editions. Skipping ahead allows these backers to have a nice, new volume for their shelves. At the same time, we also help backers who missed the earlier Brick offerings way back in the day to catch up via the reprints.

You can actually read the color series up through issue #99 online at http://antarcticpresslibrary.com/ and see what you've been missing.

 

What are we going to do with the Campaign money?

Plain and simple, we're going to print and ship the Gold Digger Color Gold Brick 8.

The Color Gold Brick is over 600 pages in FULL COLOR. Printing the actual books is the biggest single expense. The first print run of a typical Gold Brick is quite expensive, as most printers require a minimum run to make it cost-effective. We are thus using Kickstarter to assist us with those costs. If the amount seems high, you must remember that we are printing at least a thousand copies of a 600+ page book. Another cost is shipping: First we will have to ship the books from the printer to our offices, and once we get them, send copies to all our supporters and distributors. Several thousand pounds of books represents a significant shipping expense.

Here is a breakdown of our expenses.

Printing: $12,500 (which includes hard and softcover)

Shipping: $3,000 (Sending a 600-page book is costly, especially overseas.  The cost for shipping just one copy overseas is now around $34.)

Fees: $1500 (Indiegogo takes their fees off the top)

Handling/Supplies: $1500 (We have to pay for boxes and pay people to pack those boxes.)

That does not include cost for sending the large PDF files to all the supporters and other miscellaneous costs.

Those basic expenses total $18,500.

So what do you get?

The brick is 6 x 9 inches and will contain issues 226 through 250 of the Gold Digger series. You can see the covers to all 25 issues below.

 

 

REWARDS

Here are the rewards we are offering. Some of you may ask why there are not any sketch editions with these rewards as in previous campaigns. Without going into details, Fred is a very busy man and has taken on more responsibilities, both family- and work-wise. At this time, we did not want to burden him with any further work. We hope you understand.

 

ADD-ONS

 

 

We hope to print other Gold Bricks, both earlier ones as they sell out and new ones never before collected. As you know, this volume will reprint 25 issues of the color series, but there are over 200 issues of Gold Digger, and this printing of 600+ pages only covers about 10% of the entire run. Many of the early issues are the ones that are most desperately out of print. Being a small, independent publisher, we are forced to try to keep our cost margins as narrow as possible, and the end result is many of our books sell out quickly and become unavailable. Hopefully, we can use this campaign to help us keep all of our books in print. This is especially important with Gold Digger, since new readers discover the comic every day. We hope to be able to include other items as push goals, which may include getting other Bricks out to you.

 

 

NUMBERING GUIDE

Gold Brick #1 (B/W #1) - The first Gold Brick, which collects the first 25 issues of the black-and-white regular series. (Not offered on Kickstarter.) 

Gold Brick #2 (B/W #2) - The second Gold Brick, which collects issues #26 – 50 of the black-and-white regular series. (Not offered on Kickstarter.) 

Gold Brick #3 (COLOR BRICK #1) - The third Gold Brick, the first to collect the COLOR Gold Digger series issues #1 – 25. (New Printing on Kickstarter ended on January 1, 2014.) 

Gold Brick #4 (COLOR BRICK #2) - The fourth Gold Brick, but the second to collect the COLOR Gold Digger series, containing issues #26 – 50. (New Printing on Kickstarter ended on May 16, 2014.) 

Gold Brick #5 (COLOR BRICK #3) The fifth Gold Brick, collects issues #51 – #75 of the COLOR Gold Digger series. Currently sold out.  New printing planned for a future campaign, but not yet scheduled.

Gold Brick #6 (COLOR BRICK #4) The sixth Gold Brick, collects issues #76 – #100 of the COLOR Gold Digger series. Currently sold out.  New printing planned for a future campaign, but not yet scheduled. 

Gold Brick #7 (COLOR BRICK #5) The seventh Gold Brick, collects issues #101 – #125 of the COLOR Gold Digger series. (First Printing! Kickstarter project ended on December 12, 2014.) 

Gold Brick #8 (COLOR BRICK #6) The eighth Gold Brick, collects issues #126 – #150 of the COLOR Gold Digger series. As of color issue #150, we integrated the 50 black-and-white issues into the numbering to emphasize Fred's landmark achievement.  The 150th color issue was therefore published as Gold Digger #200, and the issue numbering proceeds from that point. (First Printing! Kickstarter project ended on August 2, 2016.)

Gold Brick #9 (COLOR BRICK #7) The ninth Gold Brick, collects issues #201 – #225 of the COLOR Gold Digger series. (First Printing! Kickstarter project ended on May 15, 2017.)

GOLD BRICK #10 (COLOR BRICK #8) The tenth Gold Brick, collects issues #226- #250. NEVER PRINTED BEFORE AND NOW AVAILABLE ON KICKSTARTER.

GOLD DIGGER- Publication History- In the beginning, there was an issue of Mangazine, which introduced Gold Digger to the world, and the issue was good. Then there was a 4 issue mini-series that got this joint a poppin'. Lo, there came the regular Gold Digger (Black and White) issues #1-50. Then, when mankind was ready and their fingers grew tired of newsprint stains, Fred Perry and Antarctic Press begat Gold Digger (Color) issues #1-149 on the glossy paper. Many years passed while readers enjoyed those amazing issues, and the world was ready for re-numberification. Thus spake Fred Perry: There shall be a number, and the number shall be #150—no, WAIT!—it shall be... #200, and all the Gold Digger numbering was reintegrated. 50+150=200.  And the world rejoiced, and the numbering has continued ever since! (So, why didn't we include the 4-issue mini-series in the reintegrated numbering? That needed some SPECIAL treatment: GOLD DIGGER: REMASTERED BOOK ONE.  But that is a different tale.)

Risks and challenges

There are always risks inherent in any project. This project has very few risks; the book is already done, and all we just need to do is raise the funds, pay the printer, and get it made. Our biggest risk is that we won't get the funding, and then the book won't be made. We have been printing and releasing books for close to 30 years, so we have a good relationship with our printer and do not anticipate any hiccups. There is always the risk that we won't be able to get the books in on time due to a variety of factors, but again, we do not anticipate that sort of problem. We believe in full disclosure and we will make sure to keep you all updated on the progress of the book and all the incentives. As you can see we have had positive responses to all our previous campaigns and have had no difficulty fulfilling our obligations. The printer we are using for this project is the same one that we have dealt with for many years so we do not anticipate any printing issues.

story:
NOW OFFERING FREE DOMESTIC SHIPPING

DISCOUNTED INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING

*ONLY PHYSICAL TIERS WILL RECEIVE PHYSICAL STRETCH GOALS*

NEW ACTION FIGURE

LIMITED TO 20 COPIES

This is a test photo.  We will have a finished version within 10 days to show.  

This will be available in the COMPLETIST PERK and as an ADD-ON. 


DOWNLOAD PLAYERS GUIDE - RPG SAMPLER

 

ALL PHYSICAL BACKERS GET THIS TRADING CARD!

 

NEXT STRETCH GOAL!  100 BACKERS UNLOCKS THIS PATCH!

 

The Killing Field Part 2...

36 PAGE FULL-COLOR STANDARD SIZE COMIC BOOK

Armed with new information concerning an ancient weapon fabled to have the power to kill a demon, Rev and the team split up to gather the shards and put an end to Azazal before it is too late.  Little do they know, the GAME MASTER is still pulling the strings!  New characters, new threats, and tons of plot driven action awaits you in THE KILLING FIELD PART 2!

We left Danny in the hallway with a mysterious figure.  We start off this issue by revealing her secrets.  The action takes flight from there as we get a better look at some of our heroes and introduce new characters to the HYBRIDS UNIVERSE.  

This issue also includes a backup story that expands the universe further with our "BE A HYBRID" perk backers!

BOOK IS COMPLETELY FINISHED!

HYBRIDS: THE SONS OF GODS ROLE PLAYING GAME QUICK PLAY

35+ PAGE RULES INTRODUCTION AND GAME MODULE

The action continues with this fully immersive experience!  The FULL GAME MANUAL will be released later this year and in preparation of that release, we are offering this QUICK PLAY MODULE.  This introductory manual will give you a clear overview of the character building and game play through a fun and action packed TUTORIAL style game module.  

HYBRIDS: THE SONS OF GODS #1 REMASTER FAN EDITION

32 PAGE FULL_COLOR STANDARD SIZE COMIC BOOK

After several years of making the HYBRIDS UNIVERSE and many inquiries concerning a remaster of the first issue, we are finally bale to offer you the first issue we always wanted too!  With more than 80% of the old art being updated or redrawn, this is bigger and better than ever.  Old scenes that had been cut have been put back in.  We even wrote some fresh new scenes just for this release!  

This book also introduces RIFT RIDERS, a collaborative effort between Luke Stone and Piper Steed with art by Martha Schwartz.  

This special edition fan release is limited to 100 copies with no In Demand status!

 

WHERE IT STARTED:

 

THE KILLING FIELD PART 2 PREVIEW PAGES

 

Backup Story

ISSUE #1 REMASTER PREVIEW PAGES

RIFT RIDERS PREVIEW- BY PIPER STEED and LUKE STONE - Drawn by MARTHA SCHWARTZ

PERKS

LIMITED ACTION FIGURE

This action figure will be hand painted and numbered.  ONLY 20 of the INDIEGOGO variant available!  10 are being set aside for the COMPLETIST perk and the other 10 will be available as an ADD-ON.

 

STRETCH GOALS

INDIE PDF LIBRARY (75 Backers) - UNLOCKED!!!

METAL TRADING CARD (150 Backers) - LOCKED

8 MORE PAGES FOR ISSUE 7 (175 Backers) - LOCKED

HYBRIDS POGS (200 Backers) - LOCKED

 

 

ART GALLERY

 

SHIPPED IN GEMINI MAILERS!

story:
NIGHTMARE THEATER is a 272 page trade paperback anthology collecting horror stories by some of the biggest names in indie comics. 

Over thirty-five incredible comic teams bring you frightful tales steeped in all manner of morbid mayhem. Creators include David Pepose (Spencer & Locke, The O.Z.), Shawn Gabborin (Puppet Master, Let’s All Die!) Jessica Maison (Plastic Girl), Charlie Stickney (White Ash), Dave Dwonch (Prom of the Dead), Newton Lilavois (Crescent City Monsters), Karla Nappi (Duplicant), Richard Fairgray (Black Sand Beach, Blastosaurus), David Avallone (Drawing Blood, Elvira: Mistress of the Dark), Russell Nohelty (Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter), Terry Mayo (The Wicked Righteous), Don Nguyen (Pablo the Gorilla), James Powell (House of Fear), Kayden Phoenix (Jalisco), Peter Murrieta (Rafael Garcia: Henchman), Tony Fabro (Three Panel Crimes), M.L. Miller (Gravetrancers), Sebastian Kadlecik (Quince), Steven Prince (Monster Matador) and artists like Mick Beyers, Fabio Alves, Silvia Califano, Gian Carlo Bernal, Kyle Roberts, Orlando “Mexifunk” Arocena, and Carlos Granda...

...and many, many more!

Stories inspired by horror cinema--from Poe to Alien, ghosts and ghouls, slasher films, tales of terror, B-Movie scream fests, monster movies, Stephen King creepiness, stylized Kubrick hauntings, Romero zombies, demon possession, occult, and otherwise. 

Exclusive "MOVIE POSTER" hardcover and 11x17 fine poster print by Clio Award-winning vector artist Orlando “Mexifunk” Arocena 

 

Higher Tier backers can receive:

Both our standard softcover and our exclusive hardcover, plus:

  • Variant cover by superstar artist Sorah Suhng
  • Vintage 11x17 poster print of the Mexifunk cover
  • Variant cover by artist Leeahd Goldberg

Simply select "The Killer Collection" to get all of the above at a discounted price.

 

Leeahd Goldberg Variant "Unholy Trinity"

Sorah Suhng Variant "Box Office Death"

 

Crack the spine and discover these terrifying tales inside:

The team of James Powell, Jethro Morales, Josh Jensen and Matt Krotzer explore a House of Fear with HAIR TODAY, GONE TOMORROW:

 

David Pepose and Erica D'urso, along with colorist Rosh and letterer Justin Birch, bring you Super Sentai versus the Walking Dead in DIE, DIE, DANGER RONIN:

 

Richard Fairgray chills you to your core--or is that cob?--with a tale of everyday terror we call KERNELS ALL THE WAY DOWN:

Writers Clay Adams & D.E. Schrader team up with artist Ismael Canales to deliver a late-80's-style slasher in KNIGHTMARE:

 

Charlie Stickney , Mick Beyers and colorist Gab Contreras present the Fincher-esque story of a private detective who is GOING TO PIECES:

Dave Dwonch and George Quadros chronicle an ill-fated camping trip in a tale so twisty, we can't even tell you the title!

 

 

David Avallone & Silvia Califano bring you a dark fairy tale, straight from the Black Forest in 1945: GERMAN CHOCOLATE. Color by Ellie Wright, letters by Taylor Esposito:

Writer Nicole D'Andria, artist Michela Da Sacco, colorist Yann Perrelet, and letterer Justin Birch take you for an exciting and cruel ride on the THE KILL BOAT:

 

Terry Mayo, Lucas Romero, Julio Rojas and Warren Montgomery raise the alarm over FEUX NEWS:

 

Shawn Gabborin, artist Daniel J. Logan, and colorist Yann Perrelet present a tale of terror from another dimension that hits you like a ton of BRICKS:

 

Newton Lilavois and Gian Carlo Bernal craft an illustrated prose tale that expands the world of their hit series CRESCENT CITY MONSTERS:

 

M.L. Miller and Carlos Granda raise the curtain on unspeakable evil at the movies in OPENING NIGHT:

 

Mike Korpi and Don Nguyen invite you to spend a terrifying NIGHT AT THE VET, where the animals aren't who you think:

 

Kayden Phoenix and Amanda Julina Gonzalez explore the ways musical geniuses sacrifice for their art in CONCERT GRAND:

 

The team of Jeff Leeds, Alessandro Saiu and DC Hopkins invite you to witness a disturbing rite of PASSAGE:

 

Andrew Guilde, Donna Black, and DC Hopkins teach you why kids fear... THE CRICKET MAN:

 

Russell Nohelty and Matthew Childers dabble in the occult when they summon a WRAITH:

 

Kristian Hans Horn resurrects Universal monsters and EC comics of yore with FRANKENSTEIN'S VAMPIRE:

 

In a deeply personal tale of terror, Christie Shinn fears being ALONE:

 

Phil C. Butehorn and Don Cardenas serve up a late-night creature feature (in Technicolor!) in DINNER WITH BLOBBY:

 

Karla Nappi, artist Oenomene, and letterer Carlos M. Mangual check into THE HOTEL where secrets--and people-- never die...

 

Steven Prince and Fabio Alves invite you to enter the ghostly world of JOE UMBRAL:

 

Alex Breen, Anna Wieszczyk, DC Hopkins, and Leslie Bates enter Stephen King territory with this tale of a writer wrestling his demons, KILL YOUR DARLINGS:

 

Sebastian Kadlecik accompanies you on a moonlit walk with the devil in LA OSCURIDAD Y LA LUZ:

 

The team of Tony Fabro, artist Dexter Wee, colorist Kote Carvajal and letterer Rus Wooton present an extended "Three Panel Crimes" with COLD FEET:

 

In AHEAD OF JOAQUIN, by Peter Murrieta, Carlos Trigo and Ismael Canales, the severed head of a renowned Mexican Freedom Fighter plots further revenge from inside the jar he’s pickled in:

 

Andres Salazar presents a dystopian tale of survival in FATHER & SON OUTING:

 

Jessica Maison and artist Mark Mactal prove that even after death, Daddy's a real KEEPER:

 

...while the team of Bryant Dillon, artist Chris Thorne, colorist Jesse W. Campbell and letterer Oceano Ransford chill your spine with a tale of Lovecraftian terror that shows some things are better left BURIED...

 

Plus:

  • Introduction and origin stories of our festival hosts, the Trio of Terror 
  • Frightful features by Pat Shand and the scare masters from BL4KM4SS 
  • Shorts by Gary Scott Beatty, Tony Donley, and Eddie deAngelini 

 

And more! 

 

Who conjured this unholy anthology?

DAVID SCHRADER is a writer/filmmaker and sometimes reluctant actor with a background in stand-up, sketch, improv, and alternative comedy.

Feature credits include the 90’s slacker comedy NoHo, the horror film Bloodline (Lionsgate), and the upcoming movie/deconstructed web series, Mary Tyler, Millennial. He has created a wide range of short subjects, such as the Spike Jonze-endorsed parody, Being Ozzy Osbourne (with Christy Stratton Mann), the L.A. Indie Film Festival Winner Come and Knock: The Other Ray Charles and many more.

Schrader’s first comic book work, Baby Badass, published by Action Lab Danger Zone in 2018, quickly became a cult hit, with Volume 2 set to be released in 2021. He is also the co-writer of Rafael Garcia: Henchman, which recently funded on Kickstarter.

Follow him on Instagram and Twitter @schraderopolis and @thebabybadass

CLAY ADAMS has acted in two feature-length horror movies, BLOODLINE and THE SHADOW WALKERS, both released by LionsGate. When he's not sitting in the makeup chair getting covered in gore, he co-writes Red Xmas from Scout Comics and is best known as a voice actor, with numerous credits including Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Fast Forward and several seasons of Yu-Gi-Oh. He also has funded and fulfilled eight projects on Kickstarter with FRIED Comics. His feature script, THE ECLIPSE, placed second in the horror category of the FADEIn Awards, and ELECTRIC YOUTH, co-written with Kyle Roberts, wasrecently featured in the LA Times. He has written and directed for television and holds a BFA in Dramatic Writing from NYU. 

 

The Package

We've gotten our fair share of comics that arrived mangled by the mail carrier.

You pay premium prices on Kickstarter, and you deserve better. That's why we've started using Gemini Comic Mailers:

These babies are sturdy. They require a little more money, a little more time (and a lot more tape!) but it's worth it to make sure your comics arrive in pristine condition.

And if somehow your comic still gets roughed up?

We will replace it free of charge.

 

The Timeline

Book Goes to Printer: ~Jan 31

Digital Rewards Released: ~Feb 1

Book Printed and shipped to us ~Apr 30

S#!+ happens buffer ~ May 31

Pack and ship - ~June 1

Expected delivery to US backers - 2 Weeks (mid-June)

Expected delivery for International Backers - 4 Weeks (late June)

 

SEATS, PLEASE! THE SHOW IS ABOUT TO BEGIN...

You have your popcorn, soda, and a creepy sense of foreboding as you make your way into the darkened theater. You’re ready to settle into your seat and let the latest horror film wash over you like a deluge of viscous blood pouring from an Overlook Hotel elevator. You like to be scared. You like to scream, to bolt upright in your seat, to cover your eyes, then open them again-- to see the mysterious maneuvers of a ghostly apparition, the twisted machinations of a sinister spirit, the splatter from a psycho’s blade, a monster mash, a demonic possession, a zombie moan, and everything in between.

You like horror movies. So do we. You like comics. So do we. You like horror comics. So do... well, you get the idea.

Thanks for joining us at the Nightmare Theater. 

Hope nothing grabs you in the dark...

 

Risks and challenges

The book is 100% complete and we have selected our printer. Right now, the biggest risk is that the recent postal service disruptions will continue into next year. We sincerely hope this nightmare scenario doesn't play out... but if it is, we'll get your books to you via an alternate service. See? We're not so scary.

story:
Can You Tell The Difference Between Your Dreams and Reality?  Is There A Difference?

​

 

Take a trip from the insane asylum to a dream world so real it blurs reality.

SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1

Hello All! I'm Michael Siegenthaler, creator and illustrator for SKITS. A six book, graphic comic book on the next level of surreal dreams and reality.  Come along on the journey with SKITS to read about a guy who can't tell the difference between his dreams and his reality.  While all six books have been written, SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1 starts the adventure, that is colorfully illustrated and will lead you down an insane path for the rest of the books in the series.  BOOK 1 can be read as a stand alone comic, but as the dreams become clearer, your reality gets blurred into not knowing where the series will take you without reading all six books completing the dreams of SKITS.

 

What's the story...?

Enter SKITS. He’s at an Insane Asylum.  He's in front of his Doctor, telling his story why he went missing for a time.  As the questions keep coming, SKITS keeps remembering more surreal stories to tell.

SKITS recounts a dream world blurring his physical reality in this present world. When he blinks his eyes, we are now caught in the dream world with SKITS.  Other worldly planets, ships in the air, technology cut off by the native people and portal jumping are all part of SKITS' story.  Will SKITS crack under the revelations he’s about to uncover or will the reader be trapped in a dream world blurring their own reality? Will SKITS wake up?  Will You?

SKITS came from a series of sequential dreams I had while working the graveyard shift at a local T.V. station right after college graduation.  My sleeping patterns blurred my dreams into a waking reality where my nights became my days and my days became my nights.  The surrealism of waking up from this cycle blurred my days to where I dreamt my character SKITS exactly as you see him.  All of the detail, his adventures walking or flying in my dream, even down to the medical scrubs, industrial sized boots, to the very straight jacket you see SKITS wearing on his journey.  

Being a fresh new graduate in Art Design, I began to document my dreams with futuristic and forward thinking concept art, pencil and pen thumbnail sketches and oil based paintings to capture what I was dreaming.  Fast forward to about twenty years or so later, I've been working in the Graphic Arts and Design industries building up an international reputation for my product development for the art and toy industries, and now the time has come to unlock those powerful images with the creation of SKITS as a graphic novel.

 

CHOOSE YOUR ADVENTURE!

SKITS: THE SON BOOK 1, comes in 3 VARIANT ADVENTURES

 

Not only will you get 3 VARIANT COVERS but for the first time ever you will also get 3 VARIANT STORIES.

 

•Choose one adventure•

•Choose two adventures•

or

•COMPLETE THE JOURNEY•

with all three 60+ page Variant adventures.

 

Presented in this beautifully Signed and Numbered SKITS Band Edition. 

Each book can be read as a stand alone, but only the brave of heart will get all 3 and COMPLETE THE JOURNEY

SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1 will be presented in a perfect bound, comic book style size format (6.625" in x 10.25 in”) offering readers an immersive 60+ page experience, with multiple pages of full color art and story that will literally keep you guessing at every turn.  BOOK 1 will have 45 different panels and 12 different pages, spread across all three books to create the different journeys for the reader.

 

 

HOW DO YOU SPELL LEGENDARY?

SEE PHOTO:

Photo Credit: Allan Amato 

We are pleased to work with our friend, the LEGENDARY KENT WILLIAMS for our COVER B on SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1.  Kent Williams has built up a formidable reputation as a powerful contemporary draftsman and painter. His is a bold realism with combined attributes of abstraction and neo-expressionistic sensibilities. His work is characterized by strong gestural forms combined with areas of layered and arresting detail, rendered with rich dynamic brushwork.

Williams’ approach to his subjects is often subjective and intense. Whether through multi-figured compositional complexity and suggestive narrative, or with the straight-forward lone human form, there is often autobiographical narrative at play. Favorite models, friends, and the artist himself all play a role in the human story of his paintings.

Williams lives in Los Angeles. He has two sons, Kerig Sun and Ian Kai.  

–Peter Frank
From the exhibition catalog, Kent Williams: Native Bone and Far to Home, Davidson College, 2015

 

We're also excited to work with our friend PATRIC REYNOLDS for another special COVER C for SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1.  Patric is one of the most sought after young professionals in the Comics industry today.  Since 2009, Patric has worked with Patton Oswalt and Joss Whedon (Serenity: Float Out), Mike Mignola, Christopher Golden, and John Arcudi on several "Mignolaverse" titles (Abe Sapien, Hellboy & the BPRD 1954, and Joe Golem), Marc Andreyko (Let Me In), David Lapham (Exile to Babylon), Steve Niles (The Thing), and Chris Roberson (Aliens) as comic book illustrator, all published by Dark Horse Comics. Patric's work can also be seen on (Halt & Catch Fire) with co-creator Christopher Cantwell (I Pledge Allegiance to The Mask).  His extensive concept, character design as well as illustrated exclusive covers are also seen for several comic titles. 

 

MICHAEL SIEGENTHALER- Creator and Illustrator for SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1.

 

CARSHÉNAH JEFFERSON SIEGENTHALER- Editor and co-writer of SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1.  Carshénah has worked in the entertainment industry as an actress, director and producer in the T.V/Film industries and one of Carshénah's first jobs out of graduate school was model as a Barbie doll for Mattel Inc., then moving on to acting on Broadway with a NY touring company.  She is owner of VERSE FILMS PRODUCTIONS, a Horror production company that has launched numerous films for the Horror genre.  Carshénah's work spans from co-starring on TWENTIETH CENTURY FOX's "24," "SHAMELESS," Beyoncé's "LEMONADE," "WATCH ME: TRILOGY," "THE DEAD OF NIGHT," and most recently seen with "Malcolm in the Middle's" Frankie Muniz in a horror thriller called the "BLACK STRING." Carshénah is happy to edit this insanely wild dream ride.

 

WHAT'S A DREAM AND WHO'S DREAM IS REALITY?

SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1 will lead you deeper into your dreams with its fresh storyline that you as the reader won't be able to tell the difference of who's dream you're in blurring reality like never before.  BOOKS 2-6 will defy what you know about dreaming schizophrenically.

The images captured on paper have been locked away for a time until I could script out the story from my dream journals. Now, I find myself creating a comic book through the powerful art of storytelling from those very exact dreams.  

My designs uses a mixed media of traditional pencil, pen and paint, to images generated on the computer in order to create this fantastical world of SKITS.  Myself, along with my co-writer and editor wife Carshénah Jefferson Siegenthaler, are creating the story of SKITS as a comic book for all ages. SKITS is now our reality for everyone to share.

Risks & Challenges

Every Indiegogo comes with risks.  This isn't a store. You are a patron.  You are helping artists to realize a creative goal that couldn't be achieved without your involvement.  That being said, crowdfunding campaigns come with unforeseen circumstances due to delays, but we can minimize those risks with proper funding.  All we can do is assure that if this Indiegogo campaign gets funded, you will get an Insane book as fast as we can get it to you.

Money earned by this Indiegogo will go to covering fees such as production, postage, and printing of the book. All additional funds will be used to go back into the book, period. The first goal of this campaign is to give our readers a high-quality product.

Independent comics not created by the "Big Two" companies are labors of love. But to make a high-quality comic, we need the support of our fans and Indiegogo to make SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1 a reality!

Thank you for your support.

 

Other Ways You Can Help SKITS

For people who just can't contribute with a purchase don't despair.  YOU CAN HELP!

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign with the WORD OF MOUTH METHOD

Copy our URL link to share on ALL SOCIAL PLATFORMS!

Subscribe to our YOUTUBE CHANNEL https://youtube.com/skitscomic

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt: Can You Tell The Difference Between Your Dreams and Reality?  Is There A Difference?​ Take a trip from the insane asylum to a dream world so real it blurs reality.SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1Hello All! I'm Michael Siegenthaler, creator and illustrator for SKITS. A six book, graphic comic book on the next level of surreal dreams and reality.  Come along on the journey with SKITS to read about a guy who can't tell the difference between his dreams and his reality.  While all six books have been written, SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1 starts the adventure, that is colorfully illustrated and will lead you down an insane path for the rest of the books in the series.  BOOK 1 can be read as a stand alone comic, but as the dreams become clearer, your reality gets blurred into not knowing where the series will take you without reading all six books completing the dreams of SKITS. What's the story...?Enter SKITS. He’s at an Insane Asylum.  He's in front of his Doctor, telling his story why he went missing for a time.  As the questions keep coming, SKITS keeps remembering more surreal stories to tell.SKITS recounts a dream world blurring his physical reality in this present world. When he blinks his eyes, we are now caught in the dream world with SKITS.  Other worldly planets, ships in the air, technology cut off by the native people and portal jumping are all part of SKITS' story.  Will SKITS crack under the revelations he’s about to uncover or will the reader be trapped in a dream world blurring their own reality? Will SKITS wake up?  Will You?SKITS came from a series of sequential dreams I had while working the graveyard shift at a local T.V. station right after college graduation.  My sleeping patterns blurred my dreams into a waking reality where my nights became my days and my days became my nights.  The surrealism of waking up from this cycle blurred my days to where I dreamt my character SKITS exactly as you see him.  All of the detail, his adventures walking or flying in my dream, even down to the medical scrubs, industrial sized boots, to the very straight jacket you see SKITS wearing on his journey.  Being a fresh new graduate in Art Design, I began to document my dreams with futuristic and forward thinking concept art, pencil and pen thumbnail sketches and oil based paintings to capture what I was dreaming.  Fast forward to about twenty years or so later, I've been working in the Graphic Arts and Design industries building up an international reputation for my product development for the art and toy industries, and now the time has come to unlock those powerful images with the creation of SKITS as a graphic novel. CHOOSE YOUR ADVENTURE!SKITS: THE SON BOOK 1, comes in 3 VARIANT ADVENTURES Not only will you get 3 VARIANT COVERS but for the first time ever you will also get 3 VARIANT STORIES. •Choose one adventure••Choose two adventures•or•COMPLETE THE JOURNEY•with all three 60+ page Variant adventures. Presented in this beautifully Signed and Numbered SKITS Band Edition. Each book can be read as a stand alone, but only the brave of heart will get all 3 and COMPLETE THE JOURNEYSKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1 will be presented in a perfect bound, comic book style size format (6.625" in x 10.25 in”) offering readers an immersive 60+ page experience, with multiple pages of full color art and story that will literally keep you guessing at every turn.  BOOK 1 will have 45 different panels and 12 different pages, spread across all three books to create the different journeys for the reader.  HOW DO YOU SPELL LEGENDARY?SEE PHOTO:Photo Credit: Allan Amato We are pleased to work with our friend, the LEGENDARY KENT WILLIAMS for our COVER B on SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1.  Kent Williams has built up a formidable reputation as a powerful contemporary draftsman and painter. His is a bold realism with combined attributes of abstraction and neo-expressionistic sensibilities. His work is characterized by strong gestural forms combined with areas of layered and arresting detail, rendered with rich dynamic brushwork.Williams’ approach to his subjects is often subjective and intense. Whether through multi-figured compositional complexity and suggestive narrative, or with the straight-forward lone human form, there is often autobiographical narrative at play. Favorite models, friends, and the artist himself all play a role in the human story of his paintings.Williams lives in Los Angeles. He has two sons, Kerig Sun and Ian Kai.  –Peter FrankFrom the exhibition catalog, Kent Williams: Native Bone and Far to Home, Davidson College, 2015 We're also excited to work with our friend PATRIC REYNOLDS for another special COVER C for SKITS: THE SON, BOOK 1.  Patric is one of the most sought after young professionals in the Comics industry today.  Since 2009, Patric has worked with Patton Oswalt and Joss Whedon (Serenity: Float Out), Mike Mignola, Christopher Golden, and John Arcudi on several "Mignolaverse" titles (Abe Sapien, Hellboy & the BPRD 1954, and Joe Golem), Marc Andreyko (Let Me In), David Lapham (Exile to Babylon), Steve Niles (The Thing), and Chris Roberson (Aliens) as comic book illustrator, all published by Dark Horse Comics. story:
The earth has fallen into a state of lawlessness. As chaos reigns guardian angels attempt to protect the innocent, but many times evil prevails, and the innocents pay the price. After seeing the pain and terror for many years one guardian decides to “fall” to not only protect but to make those causing the pain and suffering to pay.

 

Our story continues... With the help of Malik, a fellow fallen angel. Lilith discovers his story as he tries to help her deal with this inner darkness.

 

Malik tries to explain Lilith's condition.

By telling her his story...

How he too had the noblest of intentions.

But will noble intentions be enough for them both..

Or is their fate that of despair and pain.

This campaign is for Book 3 and Book 4 of this ongoing Hero series. This will be the finale of Volume 1 of the Lilith series.

 

 

The Funds for this project will be strictly to help offset the cost of printing the artwork is 100% complete and ready to go. With your help we will continue to bring this hero series to light.

 

 

 

 

Lilith was created by Wes Knodel with art work by Marcelo Briseno.

story:
Collected in full color for the first time in one massive 600+ page volume:

The 1st appearance of Fred Perry's Gold Digger from the pages of Mangazine,

The original 4-issue Gold Digger miniseries,

The first 19 issues of Fred Perry's Gold Digger regular series.

ALL IN FULL COLOR!

We appreciate you taking the time to review our campaign. We are excited to finally present these issues in full color in printed format.

WHAT IN KING SOLOMON'S MINES IS GOLD DIGGER?

The idea for Gold Digger—archeologist/superscientist/ubernerd Gina Diggers and her adopted were-cheetah sister Britanny exploring the multiverse across time and space—was first conceived during Fred (USMC) Perry's tour of duty in the first Gulf War, and it debuted in Antarctic Press's anthology comic, Mangazine, in 1991. A four-issue miniseries followed in 1992, and a regular monthly black-and-white series followed starting in 1993. The current color series began in 1999 and has continued since then.

Gold Digger is the second-longest-running solo-created title in the industry, and the second-longest-running female-lead comic series after Wonder Woman. In 2013, Fred was honored at Comic Con International in San Diego, where he received an Inkpot Award for his work on Gold Digger. He's been working on Gold Digger since 1991. That's almost 30 years! That's like if Jack Kirby started work on Fantastic Four in 1962 and drew it up until the launch of, well, Gold Digger in 1991. Crazy, huh?

The industry has taken notice, too: In 2013, Comic Con International in San Diego honored Fred with an Inkpot Award for his work on Gold Digger.

SO WHY COLOR?

One of our most frequently received fan requests over the years is, "When can I see the original black-and-white series of Gold Digger in color and compiled in one book?"

Fred is within two years of reaching Gold Digger #300, a milestone record in comics history. Since only the first 50 issues are b/w, we wanted to try to get them colored before he hits that benchmark.

WHAT THIS BOOK CONTAINS:

Most of our Gold Digger compilations include 25 consecutive issues, and initially this was going to be no different, so why the change?  There are two main reasons.  The first is because of a special event within the run of the original black-and-white series: For the eight-part "Time Warp" storyline, Gold Digger crosses over with Ninja High School (a series by AP founder Ben Dunn), so the story spans four issues in each series.  Because of how integral the entire plotline is, we decided to collect the entire thing, including all four Ninja High School issues, in the SECOND book.  However, if we were to split the 50 regular GD issues normally (25/Brick) AND include the four NHS "Time Warp" issues, Book 2 would be well over 800 pages, making it logistically difficult to print and ship.  Therefore, it was decided to shift the content of the series, portioning  out the issues into THREE full-color collections.  And by including the five issues preceding the regular series, we get a truly complete full-color collection of classic GD!  Second, issue #19 of the regular series concludes the Lich King storyline, making it an excellent point to conclude Book 1.

BOOK 1 (THIS CAMPAIGN) - Gold Digger's complete 1st appearance from Mangazine, the original Gold Digger miniseries, and Issues #1 through #19 of the regular series (concluding on the end of the Lich King storyline)

BOOK 2- Gold Digger regular series #20 through #35, and four Ninja High School issues ("Time Warp" crossover) 

BOOK 3- Gold Digger regular series #36 through #50, Asrial Vs. Cheetah issues #1 and #2, and Gold Digger Beta

Getting a book colored is not an easy proposition due to the cost and time involved, and both of those commodities are scarce in the independent publishing world. But with crowdfunding, it is now possible to achieve that goal. With the support of backers like you, we were able to pay our colorists to colorize the Gold Digger black-and-white regular series.


And now, Book 1 is ready to be printed.

You get all this and more!

Now we are ready to take the next big step and COLLECT these issues into an ALL-NEW, FULL-COLOR volume!

The original, black-and-white compilation of the regular series issues sold out several years ago.  In addition, since we originally began getting Gold Bricks printed, our preferred format has changed, mainly owing to the needs of the different printers with whom we've worked.  We've had a steady format choice for our crowdfunded Gold Bricks, and now we can make these issues available again, REMASTERED and collected in print for the first time, in a unified format with the newer Gold Bricks.

Book 1 is  600+ pages in FULL COLOR. Printing the actual books is the biggest single expense. The first print run of a typical Gold Brick is quite costly, as most printers require a minimum run to make it cost-effective. We are thus using Indiegogo to assist us with those costs. If the amount seems high, please remember that we are printing at least a thousand copies of a 600+ page book. Another cost is shipping: First we will have to ship the books from the printer to our offices, and once we get them, send copies to all our supporters and distributors. Several thousand pounds of books represents a significant shipping expense.

Here is a breakdown of our expenses:

Printing: $11,500 (which includes hard and softcover)

Shipping: $4,000 (Sending a 500-page book is costly, especially overseas.  The cost for shipping just one copy overseas is now around $34.)

Fees: $1500 (Indiegogo takes their fees off the top)

Handling/Supplies: $1500 (We have to pay for boxes and pay people to pack those boxes.)

That does not include cost for sending the large PDF files to all the supporters and other miscellaneous costs.

Those basic expenses total $18,500.

"WHAT IS INCLUDED IN THIS AMAZING OFFER?"

  • The complete 1st appearance of Gold Digger from Mangazine,
  • The first 4-issue Gold Digger miniseries,
  • The first 19 issues of the Black and White Gold Digger series now in FULL COLOR
  • Plus a cover gallery and whatever else we can stuff within the confines of this gargantuan tome! You want more than all that?! Well, okay, you asked for it.

PERKS, or All that and a bag of gold chips!* 

*Gold chips not included

Risks and challenges

There are always risks inherent in any project. This project has very few risks: All that we will need to do is raise the funds and get it made. Our biggest risk is that we won't get the funding, and the book will not get printed. We believe in full disclosure, and we will make sure to keep you all updated on the progress of the book and all the incentives. We have COMPLETELY fulfilled and completed other crowdfunding campaigns and, as can be seen in our comment sections, we address all problems in a timely manner.

ADD-ONS

We have some great ADD-ONS. Once you make your purchase, you can add any of the following:

GOLD DIGGER TRIBUTE BOOK - $25

In celebration of Fred Perry's achievement, many artists and creators sent in art honoring Gold Digger in their own unique style. See many of the pieces that they sent in, along with some words from Fred. 

(NOT FINAL COVER...SUBJECT TO CHANGE)

SPECIAL DUST JACKETS - $10 Each

Display your book in style with special dust jackets from different creators featured in the Gold Digger Tribute. 
 

Adam Warren Dust Jacket Art

Ryan Kinnaird Dust Jacket Art

Timothy Lim Dust Jacket Art

Anime Flux Dust Jacket Art

GET PREVIOUS PDFs

Thanks for taking a look, and thanks for supporting Fred and Antarctic Press!

story:
A power-hungry witch and Ella are suddenly transported to the world of the Three Thorns. Now, empowered by a mystical relic, the witch is terrorizing a small rural town. Only the Three Thorns and Ella joining forces can stop her.

 

What are you backing?

  • This is a 32 page one shot comic
  • Dark Fantasy
  • Mature
