story:
"Imprisoned in her mystical sleep for fifteen hundred years, give or take, Morgan Le Fay has been discovered & restored to a shadow of her former glory by a cabal of powerful beings calling themselves the Triple Moon. For no less than thirteen years, Le Fay will serve this group, and at the end of that service she will be given the means by which she can restore her power. Until that time, she will be their trouble shooter, on call 24/7, no job too big or too small. The Triple Moon’s very own private investigator." Paul- Pullbox Reviews

This is a modern take on the classic villain from Arthurian legend brought into the present in an urban setting. Ever wonder what Jessica Jones would be like if she happened to be a powerful sorceress? That's Le Fay in a nutshell.

WHAT ARE YOU BACKING?

  • This is a 32 page full color comic, single (fifth) issue of a series.
  • Urban Fantasy Noir genre
  • Mature Readers

 

Returning Backers Print

All returning backers get a FREE print for returning to support Le Fay 

Day One Print 

All physical backers get this print for FREE, if they back by FRIDAY, JUNE 4th 5PM PST

Joshua Metzger - Writer/Creator

Writes the crime comics Punch Drunk (Arcana Comics) and Metzger and Pawlak Presents: Villain (Evoluzione Publishing).

Miguel Angel Ruiz - Artist

Miguel Angel Ruiz, was born in 1984 in Córdoba, a little city in the south of Spain.

He began his carrer in animation world, studing animation during two years, then was working in three films of spanish productions,three years later he moved to Mexico and worked in his fisrt comics for indy companies, then when he returned to Spain, studied Illustration carrer in Art School of Córdoba, while he was working in Farscape Scorpious for Boom Studios.  When he finished his studies, started to work in Crossed Badlands for Avatar press, Miguel Angel still working in indie comics since that moments, have worked in Arclight comics, Sygn media, Genuine comics etc...Currently  Miguel Angel is working for Evoluzione Publishing making the art of Le Fay, and covers for another titles.

Vittorio Astone - Colorist

Hi, I'm Vittorio Astone and I'm a professional comic book artist and freelancer concept artist. I've published some short stories with Heavy Metal Magazine and Editoriale Aurea's Lanciostory and now I'm working with Vault Comics on an upcoming comic book series. As a concept artist, I'm currently working as a freelancer for private clients.
story_txt:
"Imprisoned in her mystical sleep for fifteen hundred years, give or take, Morgan Le Fay has been discovered & restored to a shadow of her former glory by a cabal of powerful beings calling themselves the Triple Moon. For no less than thirteen years, Le Fay will serve this group, and at the end of that service she will be given the means by which she can restore her power. Until that time, she will be their trouble shooter, on call 24/7, no job too big or too small. The Triple Moon’s very own private investigator." Paul- Pullbox Reviews
This is a modern take on the classic villain from Arthurian legend brought into the present in an urban setting. Ever wonder what Jessica Jones would be like if she happened to be a powerful sorceress? That's Le Fay in a nutshell.
WHAT ARE YOU BACKING?

This is a 32 page full color comic, single (fifth) issue of a series.
Urban Fantasy Noir genre
Mature Readers








 
Returning Backers Print
All returning backers get a FREE print for returning to support Le Fay

story:
How the outbreak began.

Undead Row was originally written as a full length screenplay and has won awards in script competitions. But the cost to produce such a special effects heavy movie, made me rethink how I could get this work out to people that would enjoy it. So I turned to my other love Comic Books. That's when I teamed up with the super talented Tyler Carpenter to bring Undead Row to life. Hes been working tirelessly on all the art work for over a year and now its time to unleash the ROTTER hoard onto the people.

Read the First 20 Pages FREE Here >>>>>>>> Undead Row Preview

 

The graphic novel is born.

 

The artwork is dark and has a sense of realism to it.

 

 

And just in case you needed even more incentive to enter the world of Undead Row. We have a Limited Edition Variant Cover Drawn and Colored by DC and Marvel Artist Chris Marrinan, who has worked on such titles as: Wonder Woman, Spider-man, Nova, and Wolverine just to name a few. This cover will only be a run of 250 copies and each will come with a numbered COA.

With your help the Rotter hoard will break loose on the world! Here is the breakdown on how the funds for this campaign will be used.

Stretch Goals

JULY 4TH 11 X 17 Print Offer------ UNLOCKED

1500.00 UNDEAD ROW BUTTON-----UNLOCKED

5,000.00 - Two-sided, high quality bookmark

7,500.00 - 1 Set of 3 Trading Cards for each level of perks

10,000.00 - Undead Row Blank Variant Cover for each level of perks.

 

Undead Row was created by Wes Knodel with art work by Tyler Carpenter.

story:
Hello Potential IndieGoGo Backers!

Ciderverse Entertainment PROUDLY Presents:

THE COLOSSALS #1 is a 64 Page Full Color Action-Adventure Graphic Novel that takes you into a Multi-Multiverse 10 years in progress!

The year is 2030; the world has dramatically changed in the decade of peace following Star Supreme’s rise to the global stage. However even in an era of larger than life heroes, impossible miracles and logic defying technology--evil still flourishes.

 

After 10 years of working together, Star Supreme has assembled a team made of her family and friends called THE COLOSSALS! On their first public press tour, The Colossals are attacked by giant shark monsters leading the team to suspect they are being targeted by one of their mutual foes. When the team convenes to discuss the previous battle their attacker reveals himself and unleashes an ancient evil into the world.

 

THE COLOSSALS are thrust into a battle for their lives against twisted clones that not only possess the same powers as the heroes, but also their darkest memories. However none of these demented doppelgangers are as deadly as Nega Supreme…!

 

Heroes are pushed to their breaking point, and some even make the ultimate sacrifice to protect the future.

 

  • Created, Written, and Lettered by Thomas Burpee 
  • Art by Leandro Panganiban (Circus: A Graphic Novel, Adobe Kroger: Dame Commando)
  • Coloring by Daniel Grimaldi (Kraken Comics, Calico)
  • Character and Vehicle Designs by M Ferdy S. 

After two years of building the Ciderverse, I have assembled a team of phenomenal talent! Leandro's JAW DROPPING artwork has impressed indie and professional creators alike!  Daniel consistently SLAM DUNKS each page with colors that bring to life M. Ferdy S.'s  AWE INSPIRING designs inside of this expansive and rich world that I've built to tell this COLOSSAL first installment!

 

 

ETHAN VAN SCIVER'S HONEST CRITIQUE!

Armed with that advice Leandro has put these pages into OVERDRIVE!


RISKS & CHALLENGES


The challenge in this endeavor is to fulfill ahead of schedule, it is often talked about, but lately it hasn't happened a lot. That's a mountain I want to climb! I want to put this book into your hands as fast as possible! That way we can move on to #2! There's so much to see in THE CIDERVERSE I don't want the launch of it all to be anything less than stellar!

The risks in investing in a crowdfunding book are no secret these days, but that's is why I have developed so much content--to demonstrate that I am with this project until the end of the line!

[MORE BIOS TO COME!]

story:
RAPTOR: The Preamble is a 56 page full-color comic book, with some extra fan art pages. Raptor is a superhero that I (Milton Aguiar) have created years ago, and spent a lot of time developing with my friend Bruce Berrueco, later meeting Ryan Haack, a super talented writer that was a huge contributor to this book and its story. I'm so glad to meet them, it helped to give a lot of depth and to encourage me to do this! Let's make this a long lasting universe!

Brian Brens returns to his city from serving in the military for several years. When The Shrie, an evil alien force returns to attack the people of Earth, Brian uses his new resources to take on the enemy! We'll meet allies and, of course, enemies! Find out on this book! 

What makes this book different from the other superhero books, is that this isn't only a simple origin story. It is an event that forces the protagonist to step up, while we learn how he became the hero he's meant to be. It'll kickstart a whole new story to this world.

RAPTOR: The Preamble is also the first part out of two on his origin story.

At ImaginAction, we work to get the best creative members we can, and here's the one's behind the book since it began:

Milton Aguiar (Artist/Creator) - My name is Milton Aguiar, and I'm a Portuguese aspiring comic book artist and creator. I'm 21 years old and I've been creating this universe almost 10 years ago.

Ryan Haack (Writer) - My name is Ryan Haack and I love writing comics! I've been writing comics for the better part of 7 years now, and each day I try to hone my craft and learn from mistakes along the way. It's my goal to make the best comics I can. I am the creator of BRIC-A-BRAC and the UNSPEAKABLE TEXT. 

Bruce Berrueco (Co-Plotter) - My name is Bruce Berrueco and I've always loved comics, so I had the opportunity to help write and start this story on Raptor and beyond. 

We are starting this project from scratch, which is why we found it necessary to fund on Indiegogo. We need funds to cover the printing of a book with the total of 76 pages, production, postage, shipping and a very small fee to Indiegogo. 

We take our backers and fanbase seriously, while we interact with them and ask what they'd love to see and get. We're asking for this overall goal to make sure we give you the best quality we can while maintaining it cheap. Our biggest and most important things is our backers and possible backers, and our story.

UPDATE: Please, check out the FAQ on the top of the page.

P.S.: These pages (only these ones) could suffer alterations or even be remade in case if there's problems about important elements such as text or other things being cut out of the page when printing.

These are all the items for the Rewards that you can get. You can check each tier on the top right of this page and choose the ones you like! 

They are:

  • PDF copy of the book;
  • Physical copy of the book;
  • A3 poster;
  • Raptor T-Shirt;
  • Blank Sketch Cover;
  • Drawn Sketch Cover with a character chosen by you, drawn by Milton Aguiar. (Character requests need to be sent by e-mail).

 

STRETCH GOALS

 LOCKED - 5,000€ (roughly $6,000) - Free stickers to all the backers!

More to come...

There's low risks as almost half of the work has been completed, but there's always a chance that the book might take time to be completed due to personal schedules and unexpected situations. In any case, we'll keep you posted with updates of the progress, and deliver you the best we can and as soon as possible. The major challenges are being able to make this into an on-going series and expand our Universe.

  • Spread the word to everyone you know. Especially to someone you know that loves superhero comic books.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Let me ask you, what is "Star Wars" when you take away the starships, space wizards and laser swords?  

Its a story about a smuggler, who drives a van...  

Follow the handsome smuggler, Hansel, who drives a sweet custom van he calls "The Falcon," his best friend and co-pilot Chuey, an illegal immigrant from Guatemala who medicates with cannabis, which is why no one understands him, Lucas, the young farm boy who doesn't like farming and the smart, confident, beautiful, Princess. Her father is the self-proclaimed King of Barstow, Doctor Don Væder, M.D. a proctologist and a gynocologist, and wants to be Vice President of the United States. Doctor Don's mentor is none other than the Dark Lord, President Dick... Nixon, that is.  Summer of '74 is a hilarious mix of nostalgia, comedy, alternate realities and thoughtful examination of the light and the dark sides, set in our galaxy and not too long ago.  

THE ART

THE ARTISTS

Hi, I'm S.C.V. Taylor (or "Producer Scotch").  I'm a writer and filmmaker and have produced three feature films including THE WITCH FILES, HOLLY STAR and NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEB.  My partner in this new adventure is the brilliant artist illustrator and muscian, Bob Tkacik.  

We already raised $11,501 in May and we're here on INDIGOGO IN DEMAND to grow our audience and give more people the chance to pre-order the book and be among the first people to get the 48-page double-issue comic in December 2019.  

Indiegogo is an amazing platform to connect creators (that's us!) with fans (like YOU!) who want to play a part in the making of their own entertainment. (You do, don't you?)  This crowd-sourced graphic novel is an important first-step to launch the "Summer of '74" political satire-parody, and we want you guys to be a part of the journey.  By supporting us now and pre-ordering Book One, there are some really amazing perks and ways that you can not only get the book, but be a part of its evolution, and be one of the very first to help birth SUMMER OF '74: BOOK ONE.

Summer of '74 is going to be the one of the coolest geek gifts this holiday season, but you can only get it here. 

STRETCH GOALS

If the In Demand campaign goes really really well then we will add more pages and EVERYONE will benefit from that - more stories, more jokes and more art!!

  • The money raised previously is covering the fees for our dedicated artists who are doing amazing work, as well as the first print-run of the book.
  • All sales after July 30 will go toward making the book better, possibly adding more pages or other swag. And just frankly making our universe bigger.
  • We will have stretch goals for bonus items, travel to comic cons and other conferences, and maybe even a Spanish language comic print version (Realmente espero tu ayuda).

Risks & Challenges

PRODUCTION: 
This project is 7 years in the making. We have written the entire series, based on a stageplay, and have nearly completed production on issue#1. Over the summer and fall we will finish the remaining issue (#2), color and print the books and share it with the world. I have produced 3 feature films so I know how to manage a team and deliver a product on budget. 

DEADLINE: 
We have built our production schedule with plenty of time to deliver in December 2019 for the two-issue book. We will be providing regular updates during the campaign and throughout the production and printing process.

PRINTING: 
We have a great relationship with an amazing printer right here in the USA, and have colleagues who have used them many times with a mind blowing quick turnaround. We have no doubts about the quality of the printed final product.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you can't contribute and that's okay! We come from a long line of "starving artists" and get it.  But you can still help --

  • Please help spread the work and share this with your friends on social media.  
  • You can help us make a difference by bringing more laughter, and perhaps a bit of self-reflection into the world.

So please join us and our incredible team of Super Friends and LETS MAKE IT SO!!!

Please Pledge, Like and Share.

and

THANK YOU!

story:
NEW ART AND A PHOTO POSTED !

113% funded ! THANK YOU  to all the contributors !
We will still be adding new content & rewards !!

NEW interview with artist NEIL MAKOHON -and- NEW art both in the UPDATES section !!


Also - NEW mini-interviews with JOHN ORLANDO, the 1st artist to draw The Symbol in 1997 is now in the UPDATES section along with mini-interviews of writer DON SMITH and artist MARTINHO DUARTE ABREU !


--------------------------------------------

New promo card announced for all contributors !
This card debuted at the Mid Atlantic Nostaglia Con
www.midatlanticnostalgiacon.com

☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆

Mini-interviews coming soon !

☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆

Let us introduce to you The Symbol, a golden age superhero thrust into the modern world. This giant-sized comic is being brought to you by creator, and award-winning artist, Rusty Gilligan and the Rusty Ink! studio.

Who is The Symbol ? For that answer, we need to go back to World War II...
On an alternate Earth where the Axis is winning the war, US Army sergeant David Wayne is asked to go on a secret mission to expose saboteurs and black-marketeers. SO, to protect his identity, he fashions a costume to help make his mission easier. He had become the first and only hero on his world.. and aside from the honor of having that distinction, it also became a problem.
Doing his patriotic duty, The Symbol participated in a government experiment to travel to another reality, in the hopes of bringing back troops and equipment to help with the war effort, which was going poorly at the time.
But, as fate would have it , The Symbol became trapped in a ever-repeating cycle of reality hopping - popping in and out of universes - living through alternate Earth origins - and meeting new and exciting characters.

What is The Symbol ? For that answer, we need to go back to 1995...
The Symbol was created for Marvel Comics back in 1994 as part of a planned resurgence of retro and golden age titles. But, the project was scrapped and the character just sat unused.
In 1996/1997 MAIN Publishing released Test Drive #1, an anthology with a Symbol cover and story - his first time in print.
Since then The Symbol has had stories printed in various comics and spot appearances in other comics and publications. This special volume displays both published and unpublished stories, as well as a new adventure, along with a few retellings and behind-the-scenes art.

When, Where, Why is The Symbol ? For those answers, you'll need to read the book...


This special cover was penciled by Darren Taylor and inked by Rusty! back in 2001... and then recently colored by Terry Pavlet.
 


*Symbol's Debut Story (1996/1997)
Originally presented in MAIN Magazine's "Test Drive" #1 comic featuring art by John Orlando with a story by Rusty ! This story was originally silent, but will be shown for the first time with a script lettered by Michael H.eitkemper. "Test Drive" was the industry's first multiple crossover comic that featured the works of Rich Buckler, Rob Liefeld, Ben Dunn, Rusty Gilligan, and Gil Kane (to name a few) and won awards from Diamond Comics Distribution and Styx in Canada.
 


"Secret Missions" (1998)
Originally presented in a Comic Book Legal Defense Fund limited edition comic, this is another silent story that will presented with a new script. Art was provided by Mike Tucker from a script by Rusty Gilligan.
 


"Hurricane Relief" (2004)
This story was the first story in the rare "Hurricane Relief" charity comic book that featured both Marvel and DC characters and pinups. This serious story was pencilled and lettered by Jeff Austin with a script and inks by Rusty Gilligan.
 


"What Heroes Nightmare" (2016)
This story was originally presented in "Chronicles of Terror" by a failed publisher in the UK. Art was provided by Martinho Duarte Abreu from a script by Rusty Gilligan. Due to licensing problems, the story was re-lettered by Rusty. It was originally pencilled by Jeff Austin, but the UK publisher asked that it be re-done for publication.


"The Skygate Blade of Freedom" (2017)
A brand new 25-page story in a pulpish golden age style featuring the writing of Don Smith, the beautiful artwork of Martinho Duarte Abreu, and the lettering of Nikki Sharman. Is this the TRUE origin of The Symbol... or, another alternate Earth tale ? Only time will tell !


"The Other Day Machine" (2015)
As an added bonus, readers will get to see the 15-page pulp story of The Symbol and the incredible adventure he has with Mac and Trouble, as well as the golden age FearDevil. This great prose story was originally seen in "Amazing Tails" #2 written by Arthur Gibson with art stylings by the incredible Laura Inglis.

PLUS... never-before-seen sketches and behind the scenes art and pin-ups !!
☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆






RETAILERS... Please take advantage of our
awesome retail reward !
Retailers and Resellers will receive extra promotional materials for their stores !


**Variant covers - new artists - special merchandise - official Symbol gear - exclusive art and videos - and much more await you at every $100 mark !
And, if the campaign goes over the $600 goal - a HUGE announcement will be made where EVERY contributor will receive a FREE item, and a HUGE guest star will be added !


**Special edition Symbol 'eagle' pillows (limited to 5) and Exclusive Mac and Trouble sketch cover commissions ! Both rewards are pictured above !!
**Also, EVERY contributor is now receiving an official Symbol desktop pattern !!



**2 new artists announced to the project: popular comic artist, Dan Gorman will providing an exclusive variant cover for this issue -and- artist, Neil Makohon will lend his cartoon stylings to some great Symbol art !

**Also... plans for a NEW series for Rusty Ink!
Based on vintage anthology titles such as "World's Finest" and "Marvel Triple Action" comes a new title to be published quarterly by Rusty Ink! ... a new vision and direction for the "Amazing Tails" title featuring 1 Mac and Trouble story, 1 Symbol story, and a 'revolving-door' 3rd story featuring some of the finest artists and writers in the coming book industry. This title will bring back the feel of the golden age with the marvelous storytelling of the silver age !


**As promised, here are videos of Martinho Duarte Abreu penciling The Symbol art pages...


**And a 2nd variant cover artist is announced !!

**Popular gaming and comic artist Terry Pavlet will be providing an exclusive variant cover for this issue - that ties in with a special announcement coming up !


**"YOU ARE THE COVER" reward UNLOCKED !!
**New mini-interview with writer DON SMITH (now in the UPDATES section above)
**New art posted (below),,, A swatch from a 2004 story by JEFF AUSTIN and RUSTY!



**The ALTERNATE version of the "What Heroes Nightmare" story from 1998 that features Flagman and Vex (2 characters created by DAVID PRICE) will NOW be added to the digital release as well as be offered in a special format for print copies !
A preview is in the UPDATES section !!
**And, as promised, here's a SPECIAL look at the variant cover ideas to be used !
Art by Terry Pavlet (soon to be embellished by Rusty Gilligan) !


**A brand new collectable gets added FREE to every contribution over $10 !!
A signed exclusive artist print will now be added to every contributor...
(PHOTO TO BE ADDED SUNDAY 9/24/17)

**Art will be added to the campaign that hasn't been seen since 1998 !!
This art appears now in the UPDATES SECTION !

AND MUCH MUCH MORE !!

We will keep adding art, interviews, new rewards and more !
Keep checking back - you WILL be surprised !

NEW ART AND A PHOTO POSTED !113% funded ! THANK YOU  to all the contributors !We will still be adding new content & rewards !!NEW interview with artist NEIL MAKOHON -and- NEW art both in the UPDATES section !!Also - NEW mini-interviews with JOHN ORLANDO, the 1st artist to draw The Symbol in 1997 is now in the UPDATES section along with mini-interviews of writer DON SMITH and artist MARTINHO DUARTE ABREU !
--------------------------------------------New promo card announced for all contributors !This card debuted at the Mid Atlantic Nostaglia Conwww.midatlanticnostalgiacon.com

☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆Mini-interviews coming soon !☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆    ☆Let us introduce to you The Symbol, a golden age superhero thrust into the modern world. This giant-sized comic is being brought to you by creator, and award-winning artist, Rusty Gilligan and the Rusty Ink! studio.Who is The Symbol ? For that answer, we need to go back to World War II...On an alternate Earth where the Axis is winning the war, US Army sergeant David Wayne is asked to go on a secret mission to expose saboteurs and black-marketeers. SO, to protect his identity, he fashions a costume to help make his mission easier. He had become the first and only hero on his world.. and aside from the honor of having that distinction, it also became a problem.Doing his patriotic duty, The Symbol participated in a government experiment to travel to another reality, in the hopes of bringing back troops and equipment to help with the war effort, which was going poorly at the time.But, as fate would have it , The Symbol became trapped in a ever-repeating cycle of reality hopping - popping in and out of universes - living through alternate Earth origins - and meeting new and exciting characters.What is The Symbol ? For that answer, we need to go back to 1995...The Symbol was created for Marvel Comics back in 1994 as part of a planned resurgence of retro and golden age titles. But, the project was scrapped and the character just sat unused.In 1996/1997 MAIN Publishing released Test Drive #1, an anthology with a Symbol cover and story - his first time in print.Since then The Symbol has had stories printed in various comics and spot appearances in other comics and publications. This special volume displays both published and unpublished stories, as well as a new adventure, along with a few retellings and behind-the-scenes art.When, Where, Why is The Symbol ? For those answers, you'll need to read the book...This special cover was penciled by Darren Taylor and inked by Rusty! back in 2001... and then recently colored by Terry Pavlet. *Symbol's Debut Story (1996/1997)Originally presented in MAIN Magazine's "Test Drive" #1 comic featuring art by John Orlando with a story by Rusty ! This story was originally silent, but will be shown for the first time with a script lettered by Michael H.eitkemper. This serious story was pencilled and lettered by Jeff Austin with a script and inks by Rusty Gilligan. "What Heroes Nightmare" (2016)This story was originally presented in "Chronicles of Terror" by a failed publisher in the UK. Art was provided by Martinho Duarte Abreu from a script by Rusty Gilligan. Due to licensing problems, the story was re-lettered by Rusty. It was originally pencilled by Jeff Austin, but the UK publisher asked that it be re-done for publication."The Skygate Blade of Freedom" (2017)A brand new 25-page story in a pulpish golden age style featuring the writing of Don Smith, the beautiful artwork of Martinho Duarte Abreu, and the lettering of Nikki Sharman. Is this the TRUE origin of The Symbol... or, another alternate Earth tale ? Only time will tell !"The Other Day Machine" (2015)As an added bonus, readers will get to see the 15-page pulp story of The Symbol and the incredible adventure he has with Mac and Trouble, as well as the golden age FearDevil. story:
Vanth Dreadstar has a serious problem.

A massively destructive force, something both unknown and terrible, is devouring Altarix, the capital planet of the Willow Consortium and jeopardizing all one thousand worlds under the Consortium's rule.

If the Willow Consortium falls to this mysterious, other-dimensional force, what hope remains for the rest of the universe? With the fate of all existence at stake can Dreadstar, along with the catlike Oedi, cybernetic psychic Willow and powerhouse Tueton, find a way to defeat this all-powerful menace?

When Dreadstar uncovers a hidden connection between this omnipotent nightmare and his own past, the answer becomes a resounding no.

After 30 years, Vanth Dreadstar finally returns... just in time to die!

About Jim Starlin

Jim Starlin was already a legend in the comic industry, but his influence now extends across the globe, as the Marvel Cinematic Universe has embraced his creations and storylines to dominate worldwide box offices.  Jim’s signature creation, Thanos, has powered both the Avengers: Infinity War and Avengers: Endgame movies, two of the most successful films in history. The storyline, adapted from Jim’s Infinity Gauntlet saga, is known the world over.

Jim’s creations, Drax the Destroyer and Gamora lead the Guardians of the Galaxy film franchise, and his co-creation Shang-Chi, Master of Kung Fu, will headline his own Marvel film franchise in 2021.

Some might say it’s Jim Starlin’s universe, we’re just living in it.

Want to learn more about Jim Starlin and his Hollywood work? Click here: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4160687/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_0

The Hollywood Reporter talks to Jim Starlin about Dreadstar Returns: https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/thanos-creator-jim-starlin-returns-drawing-comics-new-crowdfunded-campaign-1290090

Jim Starlin featured on SYFY: https://www.syfy.com/syfywire/for-comics-icon-jim-starlin-back-to-the-drawing-board-is-a-dream-come-true

 

 

Dreadstar returns!

The first all-new Dreadstar adventure in thirty years, written and illustrated by series creator and living legend JIM STARLIN, has arrived!

In coordination with the exciting release of Dreadstar Returns, Jim Starlin and Creation.Ink have also produced an official handbook to the Dreadstar universe, The Dreadstar Guidebook. 

 

 

For almost three decades, fans of Dreadstar have pleaded with Jim Starlin to continue the adventures of Vanth Dreadstar and company. The long wait is finally over! 

Vanth Dreadstar has a huge problem.

A massively destructive force, something both unknown and terrible, is devouring Altarix, the capital planet of the Willow Consortium and jeopardizing all one thousand worlds under the Consortium's rule. 

If the Willow Consortium were to fall to this mysterious, other-dimensional force, what hope exists for the rest of the universe?

With the fate of all existence at stake can Dreadstar, along with the catlike Oedi, cybernetic psychic Willow and powerhouse Tueton, find a way to defeat this all-powerful menace? 

When Dreadstar uncovers a hidden connection between this omnipotent nightmare and his own past, the answer becomes a resounding no. 

After 30 years, Vanth Dreadstar finally returns... just in time to die! 

 

DREADSTAR RETURNS in Vanth Dreadstar's most cosmic, and personal, adventure ever in this all-new, over-sized 100-page hardcover written and illustrated by series creator and comic book legend Jim Starlin! 

The original, long-running Dreadstar series centered on the exploits of Vanth Dreadstar, newly arrived in the Empirical Galaxy after the necessary destruction of the Milky Way. Vanth attempts to live a pastoral existence on a planet populated by peaceful cat-people. That peace is quickly disturbed when Dreadstar and the crew he assembles are thrust into the conflict between the two major forces in the galaxy: The Monarchy and the Theocratical Instrumentality and its Lord High Papal.

Many years later, the  battle continues in new and surprising ways...

Near frozen and left for dead after the brutal slaying of his parents, Vanth Dreadstar is saved by the Sword of Power, giving him newfound might and abilities. With sword in hand, he travels the galaxy on a quest for revenge, but what he finds is much, much more.

 

Derived from an experimental race of cat people at the hands of The Church of Instrumentality, Oedi joins Vanth on his journey after an epic war destroys his people.

 

 A blind telepath, Willow can not only influence sentient minds, but has the power to affect the minds of cybernetics and computers as well. Joined by her seeing-eye monkey Rainbow, Willow uses the power of her inner light, but is fueled by a dark past.

 

Ravaged by his own mystical powers, Syzygy Darklock is kept alive only by cybernetic parts and a will to abolish evil. His faith makes him a ready companion and powerful ally in Dreadstar’s quest, but his heart remains focused on his own ambitions.

 

Freebooter Skeevo uses his friendship with Oedi to join the crew, and the fight. He serves as the ship’s lowbrow pilot.

 

 

 Tueton smash!

Originally published by Epic Comics in the early 80’s, Dreadstar’s story was crafted through the singular vision of series creator Jim Starlin who, working with several inkers over the years, as well as several different publishers, created an unparalleled, cosmic body of work that was finally collected in its ultimate, Omnibus format by Creation.Ink.

 

Comic fans everywhere believed the Omnibus Editions would be the end of Dreadstar’s journey. A career ending injury to Mr. Starlin's drawing hand all but confirmed that there could never be a new Dreadstar adventure written and drawn by Jim Starlin.

But quietly, secretly, Jim Starlin had other ideas. As he slowly began to overcome the injury to his hand, Dreadstar, the most personal of all of his legendary creations had continued whispering to Starlin. Tugging at the back of his mind. Refusing to go quietly into that good night.

Dreadstar had decided it was time to return and he was bringing Jim Starlin, with his inking collaborator Jaime Jameson, along for the ride.

(Click here to read more about Mr. Starlin's journey back to the drawing table- and to Dreadstar.  Jim Starlin in the Hollywood Reporter ).

 

 

Creation.Ink is honored to once again team with the legendary Jim Starlin to produce DREADSTAR RETURNS, an original 100-page hardcover graphic novel thirty years in the making!

 

 

To help celebrate this momentous occasion, we’ve also pulled together, in collaboration with Starlin and veteran writer Bob Greenberger, a brand-new companion volume: THE DREADSTAR GUIDEBOOK!

 

 

The Dreadstar Guidebook is a special 96-page hardcover companion volume to Dreadstar Returns.  In the vein of The Official Handbook Of The Marvel Universe and DC’s Who’s Who, The Dreadstar Guidebook is the ultimate fountain of information about Dreadstar and the many characters and locations that have appeared in the pages of his adventures over the years.​

 

 

Everything youve ever wanted to know about Syzygy...except how to pronounce Syzygy.

 

 

Creation.Ink has pulled out all the stops (and called in the talents of a few of our A-list friends/Dreadstar fans), to curate a variety of rewards for Dreadstar and Jim Starlin fans of all flavors. Have a look at a few below, with the full list of rewards right over there to your left.

 

 

 

 

 

A truly legendary writer and artist, Jim Starlin has blazed his own trail in comics for five decades. His expansive work spans every major publisher, and includes the creation of beloved characters including Thanos, Gamora, Drax the Destroyer, Mongul, and more. Mr Starlin's work helped form the bedrock of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, and has been celebrated on screens large and small the world over.

 

All of us at Creation.Ink couldn’t be more excited to help bring Dreadstar back to comics in this all-new adventure! The galaxy is once more about to tremble, buckle up and come along for the ride!

 

Ominous Press

  • Twitter - @OminousPress 
  • Instagram - @Ominous_press 
  • FB - Facebook.com/ominouspress
  • Web - 

 

Creation.INK

  • Twitter - @Creation_INK 
  • Instagram - @TheCreation.INK 
  • FB - Facebook.com/TheCreation.INK
  • Web - www.CREATION.INK 

 

Contact Us: Click the icon for Creation.INK, and then the Contact button. We are here to make your experience smooth and problem free. You can also give us a call at (855) 743-4650! Add-Ons: We are happy to assist with any add-ons through an over-pledge. Email us to let us know what you would like to add, and we will accommodate your request as best as possible. Please email us at info@creation.ink for add-on requests! International Shipping: When ordering from outside the United States, we can combine shipping for you to get the best rate possible.

story:
HELP LAUNCH AN EXCITING NEW COMIC BOOK SERIES DEATHSHROUD!

DEATHSHROUD is an action-packed anti-hero adventure for fans of Spawn, Venom, or The Darkness.  

 

INTERIOR PAGE EXAMPLES: 

 

 

HELP LAUNCH AN EXCITING NEW COMIC BOOK SERIES DEATHSHROUD!

We need your help and support to launch an exciting anti-hero comic book series. Our all-star talent lineup will deliver a AAA product that will captivate, thrill and scare you. With your support, we can bring this story and character to life.

www.deathshroud.net

 

SERIES SYNOPSIS:

When a special ops mission goes wrong and his entire squad is killed, John Azrael is transformed into a creature from his nightmares. John soon discovers he's one of the Nephilim and his very existence poses a threat to the established cosmic order.

With a conspiracy between Heaven and Hell against him, John embarks on a mission to take revenge on those who murdered his mother. Armed only with his wits and newly-discovered powers. John must maintain the balance of cosmic forces while protecting his fiancée Elizabeth from Kobolt City’s corrupt leaders, in this action-packed anti-hero adventure.

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET!

To ensure we deliver a 22 page AAA product, I’ve recruited some of the best talent in the industry. This means paying industry rates. 

Talent:

Chad Larsson – Writer/ Creator

Caanan White – Artist

Ryan Stegman – Cover Artist

Kyle Hotz – Variant Cover Artist

Brett Booth – Variant Cover Artist

Danny Gorgy – Editor

 

RISK & CHALLENGES:

With the COVID-19 pandemic, this can introduce unpredictable issues or delays. We will ensure transparency and update our backers should any problems arise. Regardless if we are completely funded, we will ensure Deathshroud one way or another becomes a reality.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

We understand that some of you are not able to support this new comic book IP by contributing money. That's OK! One of the most important ways you can support this project is by sharing this campaign with your friends and other passionate comic book fans! Show your support by sharing on Twitter, Instagram, Reddit, Facebook, or any other social media platforms that can help us get the word out. Together let’s make Deathshroud a reality!

story:
Annnnnnnd, we're back! Finally.

After you've read this, please check out the "GIVEAWAY" video to learn about the cool idea we came up with as a way to say thank you to our backers.

 

*OPENING DAY GIVEAWAY!!!!!*
The first 5 backers of any physical perk receive a free, limited edition HappyJack keychain illustrated by the great SixAMComics (@sixamcomics on Twitter)!

 

Tales From Neroesville is an anthology comic book with no singular star, rather the city itself serves as the backdrop for our entire universe with different stars and story types in each arc. Some stories will be a single issue, others will run multi-issue arcs, all taking place in a shared universe with shared continuity. 

TFN is inspired by the 80's indie comics boom. Books like Cat & Mouse, Roachmill, Dalgoda, Ex-Mutants, Grips, Legion X-1, Mighty Mites, etc are the books that lit our creative fires and drove us to create our own characters and universe. The '80s were a magical time for indie comics, and that atmosphere and creative enthusiasm are what we're trying to recapture. When asked in interviews to describe TFN, I tell people "Imagine if Astro City was published in the 1980s by Eternity or Eclipse comics. Fun, entertaining comics for escapism's sake. No morality of political leanings shoehorned in. Entertainment. Period."

Entertaining readers and giving them a lot of bang for their buck are our main objectives. Having readers enjoy the books and feel like they got a good deal will keep them coming back to see what our heroes and villains are going to do next. Solid writing, interesting characters, and top-notch art are what we have to offer.

 

Alright, as for the issues in this campaign: 3 issues, 88 pages!

TFN Issue #4 introduces readers to Eustace Kinsley, or “Raven D’Spair”, as he prefers to be called. Raven is a typical goth teenager. Unfortunately, he’s decided life is no longer worth living, and suicide seems like his best option. Despite his best efforts, Raven can’t seem to die. While contemplating this revelation, he sees a report that the supervillain Puffenstein is tearing up downtown Neroesville. New plan: Death by supervillain! But can even a psychotic, undead monster kill Raven? Can anything? (16 pages + 9 page backup story)

In TFN Issue #5 we meet the superhero team “THE WATCHGUARD.” Not what anyone would call a top-tier team, The Watchguard just can’t seem to catch their big break or make a name for themselves in Neroesville. Most of the team doesn’t care and just want to serve the greater good. Sgt Dixx, however, longs for fame, fortune, and his day in the spotlight. Wanting The Watchguard to be one of Neroesville’s premier superhero teams, Dixx blames team leader Valedictorian for the team’s lack of prestige. Not to worry, Dixx has a sure-fire, can’t-fail plan to send the team straight to the top. What could possibly go wrong? Oh, you’ll see! (23 pages + 9 page backup story)

HotL issue 1: Hero On The Lam is a self-contained 3 issue TFN miniseries. We will be including one issue HotL in each of our next 3 campaigns.

          When the body of popular superhero HappyJack is found murdered in an alley, all of Neroesville is shocked and saddened. But no one is more shocked than James Kinkead, the real HappyJack, who is very much alive and well. Who is behind this charade? What role does villain Von Droog play in all this? And how many more people will have to die before the truth come out? As the body count grows, so does the number of questions. (22 pages + 9 page backup story)

 

Just like the first 3 issues of TFN, each book in this campaign will feature a short backup story.

  • Issue #4 features the first part of the backup story “Who’s Yer Daddy?” featuring private detective Michael Murphy. Michael is hired by a teenage girl’s mother to look into the girl’s relationship with the skeevy superhero “Big Daddy Bad Ass.” What starts as a simple case quickly turns into a murder investigation.

  • Issue #5 features part 2 of “Who’s Yer Daddy?” The investigation takes PI Michael Murphy deeper down the rabbit hole, which only leads to more questions and more death. Can this former Neroesville Police Detective solve the case or will he end up in the morgue too?

  • HotL #1 features the backup story “Mr. Cameron Goes To Neroesville.” Some people come to Neroesville seeking fame and fortune. Others are just looking for a fresh start. Some find what they’re looking for, some are chewed up and spit out. Which one will Luke Cameron be? So excited to get this short story out. It's being illustrated by my super talented daughter and will be her first published work.

 

Want more goodies? Check out the SWAG perks!

Get the 3 newest books or all books to date. Prints, stickers, magnets, sketch cards, etc, we're throwing all the good stuff into the SWAG packs below!

Wave 2 SWAG: The 3 current TFN comics, #1 Misprint Edition, the "Ville's Villains" 11x17 print (above image is not the final product), magnet, stickers, pin, sketch card, blockhead, etc.

 

Catch Up SWAG: All 6 TFN comics, #1 Misprint Edition, "Neroes Heroes" print, "Ville's Villains" print, twice the magnets, stickers, pins, sketch cards, etc. All the TFN goodies to date!

 

Be the BRAWLER!

Check out the "BRAWLER" perk for a cool and unique way to show the world what a bad-ass you are. Appear on the back cover of one of the books as our mascot "The Brawler."

 

Original Art!

Snag the original El Guapo cover artwork to one of the "Who's Yer Daddy?" short stories. Get the current books, the Villains pinup, and all the swag for a great, low price. Claim yours now, there's only 2!

***

Don't let the flexible goal scare you away! We chose flexible because we are fulfilling NO MATTER WHAT! We were committed to that from day one. We want these books in people's hands. And they will be!

***

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need money to produce the books.
  • You give us money.
  • We give you the books.
  • Easy peasy!

The Impact

  • We are lifelong comic book fans that have always dreamed of being creators. This is our chance. But we can't do it without the support of fellow fans like you. Your contributions mean the world to us and are the only way we can continue to follow this dream. We love creating these stories and are excited to have you along for the ride. Tell your friends ;)

Risks & Challenges

  • By making sure the books are done in advance, we have removed nearly all possible risks. The book files are done, the creators paid in full. All that's left is the printing and shipping. Like the first campaign, these books are going out no matter what!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Our first campaign was called "The Best New Comics Deal On IndieGoGo." Something we took great pride in. So we're offering more quality books at a great bargain once again. Please share the campaign as much as you can, we're trying to reach as many possible fans as we can. The more we make on each campaign means we can get the next set of books done and the campaigns launched that much faster.
  • We're the little guys in this, fighting the bigger guys for attention. Any help we get is greatly appreciated. Word of mouth was our best advertising in the first campaign, so if you can, please help us get the word out.
